title: Colleges Priceless Value
description: Whats the most transformative educational experience youve had?

title: The Republican Discovery of the Poor
description: Senator Mike Lee of Utah, a Tea Party favorite, is worried about economic unfairness. Here he is, arguing for what he calls a conservative reform agenda:

title: A Quiet Fight to Marry
description: COKER, Ala.  MONDAY morning began like any other morning on our little farm in Alabama, where we have lived together for more than three decades. We already knew that Roy S. Moore, the chief justice of the State Supreme Court, had commanded the states probate judges to refuse to grant marriage licenses to same-sex couples. But turning on the radio, we learned that the judge in our county, Tuscaloosa, home to the states flagship university, had decided to go along with him.

title: Lynching as Racial Terrorism
description: It is important to remember that the hangings, burnings and dismemberments of black American men, women and children that were relatively common in this country between the Civil War and World War II were often public events. They were sometimes advertised in newspapers and drew hundreds and even thousands of white spectators, including elected officials and leading citizens who were so swept up in the carnivals of death that they posed with their children for keepsake photographs within arms length of mutilated black corpses.

title: Concealed Carrys Body Count
description: In Americas endless debate about gun rights versus public safety, there should be no disputing the hard facts in a new report on gunshot fatalities showing that at least 722 nonself-defense deaths since 2007 were attributable to individuals with legal permits to carry concealed weapons. Concealed carry by citizens has been a soaring phenomenon as states liberalize laws in the name of lowering crime that allow more permits and easier gun access in public places, even schools, churches and restaurants.

title: President Xi Jinping to Visit U.S. in September, Chinese Agency Reports
description: HONG KONG  The first state visit by President Xi Jinping of China to the United States will take place in September, the state-run Xinhua news agency reported Wednesday.

title: 6 Qs About the News | History of Lynchings in the South Documents Nearly 4,000 Names
description: In History of Lynchings in the South Documents Nearly 4,000 Names, Campbell Robertson writes about an effort to erect markers and memorials at certain lynching sites.

title: Test Yourself | Advice on Love and Romance
description: Here are several paragraphs from a 2010 article by the editor of the Modern Love column. Called Explaining the Irrational: Here Goes , it is his answers to head-scratching questions about love.

title: Patriotic Fish Sell Out in Southern China
description: As families around China prepare for Lunar New Year celebrations next week, shoppers in one southeastern city can add another delicacy to their shopping list: patriotic fish.

title: European Data Center Providers Agree on All-Share Merger
description: LONDON  The European data center providers Telecity Group and Interxion Holding said on Wednesday that they had reached a nonbinding agreement on an all-share merger.

title: French Muslims, Never Fully at Home
description: After the terrorist attacks last month on the offices of Charlie Hebdo and a kosher supermarket, the airwaves and the web were filled with vitriol toward French Muslims. Many demanded that they condemn the violence, which most Muslim organizations and public figures did. But far right-wing commentators in France and beyond attacked Islam itself, insisting that the religion was inherently violent.

title: When Do You Lie?
description: We all do it  sometimes to be kind, sometimes to get something we want (or avoid something we dont want), and sometimes just because we can. When do you lie?

title: Think Like a Doctor: Swept Off Her Feet
description: The Challenge: Can you figure out what is wrong with a young woman with a headache that has lasted for months who becomes too dizzy to walk?

title: New York Fashion Weeks Under-the-Radar Talents
description: Whether or not they plan a formal runway show, these under-the-radar talents bear watching. Some create their own fabrics, others work magic with knitting yarns, and still others combine street style and high style in strikingly inventive ways. Here, our picks for the season.

title: Better Fitness Through Your Phone
description: Many of us have invested in the wristbands or other wearable devices that tell us how many steps weve taken, calories weve burned and other information. But an interesting new study that compared activity monitors found that while some are accurate when measuring step counts, others are way off. And few are more accurate than the convenient and inexpensive apps you can find on your cellphone.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: To Understand Scott Walkers Strength, Look at His Donors
description: The best way to see the threat that Scott Walker, the Wisconsin governor, poses to Jeb Bush in the Republican presidential race is to look at Mr. Walkers donors.

title: New York Today:  Abandoned and Vanishing Places
description: Good Wednesday morning.

title: Daily Report: Teslas Rough Road Into China
description: Tesla owners in China are a well-connected bunch. Not only do they tend to be wealthy, but their avid use of social media means word of car problems can spread in minutes. And finding charging stations is a regular complaint.

title: Many Pilots Fail Safety Test at TransAsia
description: HONG KONG  Ten of 49 TransAsia Airways pilots failed emergency proficiency tests ordered by the Civil Aeronautics Administration of Taiwan after a deadly plane crash in the capital, Taipei, last week, the aviation regulator announced on Wednesday.

title: The Stanford Undergraduate and the Mentor
description: On a weekend in March almost three years ago, Ellie Clougherty flew from London to Rome with Joe Lonsdale. She was a 21-year-old junior at Stanford University, and it was her first trip to Italy. Lonsdale, then 29, was a Silicon Valley entrepreneur, and he booked a room for them for two nights in a luxury hotel  a converted Renaissance mansion in the shadow of the Pantheon  and arranged a special excursion, with a friend of his who is an architect, to an archaeological site amid the ruins of the Golden House on Palatine Hill, overlooking the Colosseum. Under a light gray sky, they stood on plexiglass bridges and looked down at the uncovered remains of what is thought to be a fabled rotating dining room that the Emperor Nero built for extravagant banquets. Lonsdale is a Roman-history buff, and he told Clougherty about the emperors, praising their civilization and engineering feats.

title: Today in Politics
description: Push for War Powers Measure Will Test Obama, Lawmakers Say

title: Morning Agenda: Private Equitys Recruiting Race
description: PRIVATE EQUITYS RECRUITING RACE | Some young bankers on Wall Street are the most sought-after financiers around, with lucrative pay packages dangling before them, DealBooks William Alden and Sydney Ember write. Junior investment bankers, many of whom graduated from college only last year, are being madly courted by private equity firms like Apollo Global Management, the Blackstone Group, Bain Capital and the Carlyle Group in a scramble that kicked off last weekend. After back-to-back interviews, many are now fielding offers for jobs that wont start until the summer of 2016.

title: World Leaders Meet in Belarus to Negotiate Cease-Fire in Ukraine
description: MINSK, Belarus  The leaders of Russia, Ukraine, France and Germany negotiated through Wednesday night and into Thursday morning, locked in a tough effort to defuse the escalating conflict in eastern Ukraine, though there was little indication that whatever peace deal emerged from these talks would last any longer than a previous truce in September.

title: An Unblemished Record Is New for Kentuckys John Calipari
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  Louisiana State fans began lining up at Pete Maravich Assembly Center nearly two hours before game time on Tuesday, fully expecting that their Tigers, so tough at home, would end Kentuckys 23-game winning streak.

title: Shares of Aena and Elis Climb in Strong Demand for European I.P.O.s
description: LONDON  Aena, the Spanish airport operator, and Elis, the French provider of rental uniforms and linens, surged in their stock market debuts on Wednesday as investor appetite for initial public offerings remained strong in Europe.

title: In Chapel Hill Shooting of 3 Muslims, a Question of Motive
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  It was a little after 5 p.m., a quiet time in a quiet neighborhood, before many people had returned home from work on Tuesday, when two women called 911 to report multiple gunshots and screams echoing through a condominium complex here near the University of North Carolina.

title: Rite Aid to Buy Pharmacy Benefit Manager EnvisionRx
description: Rite Aid, the big pharmacy chain, agreed on Wednesday to acquire a top pharmacy benefit manager, Envision Pharmaceutical Services, for $2 billion in cash and stock .

title: Fifty Shades of Grey, the Movie, as a Fairy Tale
description: If ever a novel could be described as review-proof, it is Fifty Shades of Grey, which, with its two sequels, has sold more than 100 million copies worldwide despite being ridiculed by virtually every critic who has read it. (Salman Rushdie, for one, said that it made Twilight look like War and Peace.)

title: The Times and Transgender Issues (Part 1 of 2): On Pronouns
description: In August 2013, soon after Chelsea Manning announced that she identified as a woman and no longer wanted to be known as Bradley Manning, The Times made a quick  and I thought appropriate  adjustment. Articles began referring to Private Manning with the feminine pronoun and the use of the name Chelsea. It caused a bit of a scramble at the time, because editors were concerned about clarity for readers when referring to the high-profile soldier who had just been sentenced to prison for leaking classified information. But in the end, a ruling principle  the preference of the individual  held sway.

title: Cloud Software Start-Up AppDirect Raises $50 Million
description: AppDirect, a start-up focused on helping customers sell software online, said on Wednesday that it had raised $50 million in new financing to help it expand its staff worldwide.

title: Workout Test: Fitness Apps vs. Trainer
description: Fitness apps and calorie counters like MyFitnessPal and FitStar pose a challenge to the traditional personal trainer model, but which stands the test of time? Molly Wood tests them out.

title: Test of Strength: Fitness Apps vs. Personal Trainers
description: ACTIVITY trackers. Calorie counters. Phones with heart monitors.

title: About Last Night: Jon Stewart, Signing Off
description: It appeared to be business as usual for Jon Stewart, the host of The Daily Show, on Tuesday night. He was gabbing with David Axelrod about his new book and discussing President Obamas frustrations with Congress and the news media.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: What to Watch for During Fashion Month
description: Its here: Fashion month (I mean, really, lets call it like it is; none of this pretend fashion WEEK stuff) officially starts on Thursday, though in the inveterate creep of these things, some brands have jumped the gun and are showing on Wednesday in New York.

title: Malaysian Police Use Twitter in Crackdown on Dissent
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  The Malaysian authorities have detained a cartoonist and ordered an investigation into two prominent politicians in an intensifying crackdown on dissent after the countrys highest court upheld a five-year prison sentence for the leader of the opposition, Anwar Ibrahim.

title: A New Orleans Neighborhood Takes Off
description: The Freret Corridor barely existed a decade ago. There was only Freret Street, run-down and with a single restaurant. In recent years, though, the Uptown neighborhood has taken off. The New Freret (pronounced fur-RET), as its sometimes called, combs the space of about six blocks. What makes it particularly valuable is the variety of the new spots, more than 20 of them, including a comedy club, a cocktail bar, a pet grooming shop, a boxing gym, and a garden center. And that is to say nothing of the eateries where New Orleans po boys are readily found, just in time for Mardi Gras.

title: A Midwinter Playground in the Hudson Valley
Close Friend of Russian Leader Takes Role as a Negotiator for Ukraine
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Viktor V. Medvedchuk often turns up in places where only buddies of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia get to go, like the V.I.P. section at a Formula One championship in Sochi, Russia, in October. He sat just a few feet from Mr. Putin, next to the actor Steven Seagal, another pal of the Kremlin leaders.

title: The Community College/Real College Divide
description: I heard it again, another community college putdown. This one came from an educator explaining criteria for high school graduation. She followed her summary with these words to her audience of parents and incoming freshmen: So thats the minimum requirement. But heres what you should take if you want to go to real college  you know, not community college.

title: Suburban Noise vs. City Noise
description: Dear Diary:

title: Currency Swings Help Push Down PepsiCo Earnings by 24%
description: PepsiCo, the beverage and snack giant, said on Wednesday that its quarterly earnings fell 24 percent, putting it in the ranks of companies whose finances were dented by currency swings at the end of last year.

title: Head of Belgian Group Said to Recruit Fighters for Syria Gets 12-Year Term
description: BRUSSELS  In a case seen as a test of Europes ability to combat Islamic extremism through the courts, a Belgian judge on Wednesday ruled that Sharia4Belgium, a group accused of recruiting fighters for Syria, was a terrorist organization and sentenced the groups leader to 12 years in prison.

title: A Neighborhood of Contrasts
description: Tottenville, a self-contained enclave along Staten Islands southwestern waterfront, can be rich in contrasts.

title: Carlyle Profit, Weighed Down by Energy Investments, Beats Expectations
description: The Carlyle Group reported lower fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, weighed down by declines in its energy investments and its hedge funds, but the results exceeded analysts expectations.

title: Bon Iver Frontman to Program a New Wisconsin Music Festival
description: Wisconsin is finally getting its own hip music festival.

title: Cambridge, 1963, From The Theory of Everything Soundtrack
Rescued African Migrants Recount Ordeal in Mediterranean
description: ROME  Survivors rescued off the Libyan coast by the Italian Coast Guard gave harrowing accounts of small boats packed with migrants that were overwhelmed by high waves, which washed scores of people overboard to their deaths in cold Mediterranean waters, humanitarian organizations said Wednesday.

title: American Sniper Jury Is Told of Troubled Ex-Marine Who Killed Chris Kyle
description: STEPHENVILLE, Tex.  As Chris Kyle and his friend Chad Littlefield drove to a remote shooting range not far from this rural town outside Dallas on a February afternoon two years ago, a man they had only recently met sat in the back seat of Mr. Kyles truck.

title: Obamas Dual View of War Power Seeks Limits and Leeway
description: WASHINGTON  In seeking authorization for his six-month-old military campaign against the Islamic State terrorist group, President Obama on Wednesday did something that few if any of his predecessors have done: He asked Congress to restrict the ability of the commander in chief to wage war against an overseas enemy.

description: ELK, CALIF.

title: Importing Images to iPhoto
Anti-Immigration Movement Splits Germany (Feb. 2015)
description: The German anti-immigration movement Pegida started in Dresden in October 2014 and spread to other cities, gathering followers and prompting a backlash.

title: Video Feature: Pegida Movement Divides Germany
description: A protest movement of largely middle-class Germans calling themselves Patriotic Europeans Against the Islamization of the West has prompted a new debate about immigration in the country.

title: 1940: Japanese Hold Anniversary
description: Celebrations in 1940 honoring the Japanese Empire. (britishpathe.com)

title: Sales Slide for Mondelez, Maker of Sweets
description: Mondelez International, the name behind brands including Cadbury, Oreo and Sour Patch, on Wednesday reported lower sales and earnings in the fourth quarter.

title: House Hunting in ... Austria
description: A DUPLEX PENTHOUSE IN CENTRAL VIENNA

title: White House to File Case Against China at W.T.O. Over Subsidies for Exports
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration accused China on Wednesday of providing illegal export subsidies to critical industries, flexing its muscle on trade as it presses Congress to expand President Obamas authority to secure major trade accords.

title: In the Fall of Saigon, Lessons for Today
description: As the war in Vietnam recedes deeper into history, replaced in the American consciousness by more recent conflicts in places like Iraq and Afghanistan, its lessons also seem to fade. That amnesia is what the film director and producer Rory Kennedy is trying to counteract in Last Days in Vietnam, one of five nominees for the Oscar for best feature-length documentary.

title: Nora Roberts: By the Book
description: The romance novelist and, writing as J. D. Robb, the author, most recently, of Obsession in Death, thinks all world leaders should be required to read Catch-22, and then give a book report to prove they understood it.

title: The B Side, by Ben Yagoda
description: What happened to American music? That often asked question is perhaps more valid now than ever.

title: Amiri Barakas S O S
description: Amiri Baraka eulogized James Baldwin on Dec. 8, 1987, by saying: He was all the way live, all the way conscious, turned all the way up, receiving and broadcasting. . . . He always made us know we were dangerously intelligent and as courageous as the will to be free.

title: Robert L. Greniers 88 Days to Kandahar
description: As Americas longest war draws to a close, journalists and diplomats, spooks and soldiers keep turning out books attempting to explain what was lost and won over the last 14 years in Afghanistan. While none so far have synthesized the disparate worlds of American civilian policy, military action and Afghan realities, the latest entry, 88 Days to Kandahar: A CIA Diary, by Robert L. Grenier, adds another on-the-ground view of how the early events actually unfolded. Grenier, who retired in 2006 after 27 years with the C.I.A., was the station chief in Islamabad, Pakistan, from 1999 to 2002, with practical responsibility for Taliban-dominated areas of southern and eastern Afghanistan during the crucial early months of the war. The books title refers to the period between Sept. 11 and Dec. 7, when an anti-Taliban tribal leader named Hamid Karzai made a perilous return to Afghanistan to rally Pashtun opposition to the Taliban, which culminated in their surrender.

title: Obama Administration Plans to Aggressively Target Wildlife Trafficking
description: WASHINGTON  Hoping to stem illegal wildlife trafficking, the Obama administration on Wednesday introduced an aggressive plan for taking on traffickers that will include using American intelligence agencies to track and target those who benefit from the estimated $20-billion-a-year market.

title: 1965: Resignations Over Madras Riot
description: NEW DELHI  Two cabinet ministers resigned today [Feb. 11] as rioting continued in Madras state against the adoption of Hindi as the official language of India. Five rioters were shot and killed after a mob of 4,000 stormed the railway station at Kumarapalam, a suburb of Madras city, and halted the speeding Indo-Ceylon Express. This brought to 39 the known death toll of the riots. The mob burned six coaches of the train before special armed police arrived and the shooting broke out.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 12, 1965

title: Jackie Robinson West, a Team That Won Hearts, Loses Its Little League Title
description: Rarely had the Little League World Series gained such widespread attention, especially for African-American players.

title: UniCredit of Italy Reports Profit Amid Cost-Cutting
description: FRANKFURT  UniCredit, Italys largest bank by assets, said on Wednesday that it had returned to profit in the last quarter of 2014 as it cut costs and set aside less money to cover problem loans.

title: Obamas Resolution to Authorize Military Force Against ISIS
description: A proposal sent by the White House to Capitol Hill on Wednesday would formally give the president the power to continue the airstrikes he has been conducting since last fall against the Islamic State.

title: John Malone Takes a Stake and a Board Seat at Lionsgate
description: John C. Malone rarely strikes straightforward transactions. And his deal to take a seat on the board of the film studio Lionsgate is no exception.

title: Verbatim: Boehner and the New Party of No
description: Speaker John A. Boehner, regarding the vote in the Senate to fund the Department of Homeland Security.

title: Review: In Fifty Shades of Grey Movie, Sex Is a Knotty Business
description: At the end of a recent New York sneak preview of Fifty Shades of Grey  in the blackout between the final lines of dialogue (Anastasia! Christian!) and the first breathy notes of the last Beyonc song  a lot of the audience burst out laughing. The source of that laughter continues to puzzle and intrigue me, perhaps more than the actual movie did. Was it delight? Derision? Embarrassment? Surprise? All of the above?

title: Chiles Pablo Larran Presents Film on Catholic Priests at Berlin Festival
description: BERLIN  The Chilean director Pablo Larran has a penchant for the dark side. His Tony Manero (2009) was about a serial killer, and Post Mortem (2012) and the Oscar-nominated No (2013) explored the complexities of Pinochets Chile. In The Club, which debuted at the Berlin Film Festival this week to strong reviews, the director has mined another troubling theme: errant Roman Catholic priests and the system that has helped cover up their misdeeds.

title: Dutchess County to Pay Brooklyn Native $7.5 Million for Wrongful Murder Conviction
description: The prize for this fight will be $7.5 million, but Dewey Bozella did not win it in a boxing ring.

title: A Measured Approach to Cooking
description: There is a hoary reference to a bad cook, almost always a woman, who couldnt even boil water. This apocryphal figure reminds me of another I used to consider similarly fictitious.

title: Tales of the Founders
description: New picture books include Gingerbread for Liberty and Dear Mr. Washington.

title: These People Tried the 36 Questions That Lead to Love
description: And here is what happened.

title: Outrage Over North Carolina Shootings Spurs #MuslimLivesMatter on Twitter
description: Global outrage over the murder of three Muslim students in North Carolina spread quickly through social media on Wednesday, with the hashtag #muslimlivesmatter appearing in scores of posts shared all over the world, from Southeast Asia, to the Middle East and Europe.

title: In Politics of Rebuilding Ground Zero, a Lone Critical Voice
description: Platitudes, bromides and evasions are the typical fare in public pronouncements about the redevelopment of the World Trade Center site.

title: Jewelry Designer Irene Neuwirth Goes to the Gem Show
description: In 2001, Irene Neuwirth took her first trip to the Tucson Gem, Mineral & Fossil Showcase, a massive exhibition held every winter that spans various venues across the city. At the time, the native Angeleno was teaching horseback riding and picking up beads at her local hippie haunt that she would later turn into jewelry for fun. I drove there, stayed at the airport Hilton, and had $300, she says. I spent $500 and thought I would be in debt for the rest of my life. Upon returning to L.A., Neuwirth made 10necklaces, and sent them to Barneys with a note written in Magic Marker that read, I hope you love them. Today, her namesakeline is one the department stores best sellers and she has a fanciful Melrose Place flagship store to call her own.

title: Hostages Hometown Is Well Acquainted With Loss
description: PRESCOTT, Ariz.  As if in a snow-globe village adjusted for the warmth of an Arizona winter, the gathering place at the heart of this city is a square with a western-wear boutique, a yogurt shop and, on the green lawn of the old courthouse, a scene playing out that is sadly familiar to many people here.

title: Survey of Foreign Companies in China Finds Pollution a Growing Problem
description: BEIJING  Foreign companies in China are struggling with growing issues, including a perception that their businesses are less welcome than before.

title: Babies Who Eat to Live, Instead of the Other Way Around
description: As a parent of a newborn, I was as nave as they come. I had flowery illusions of bringing my swaddled daughter home, placing her in her monkey-shaped bouncy seat and watching her coo for hours until it was time to tuck her into her crib, lovey in hand.

title: Composing The Theory of Everything
description: It begins with a piano riff and builds into a triumphant orchestral sweep. The piece, Cambridge, 1963, introduces audiences to a young, vibrant, bike-riding Stephen Hawking in The Theory of Everything, the film about the theoretical physicists first marriage, to Jane Hawking. The piece was composed by Johann Johannsson of Iceland, who won the Golden Globe for his now Oscar-nominated score. This piece is the composers favorite from the film.

title: Karate Means Empty Hand, but a Handheld Device Is Needed
description: LEARNING a martial art is a true challenge, both mentally and physically, because there is so much to master and remember. Turning to an app for help might not seem like an obvious course, but many apps do provide worthwhile support.

title: House Passes Keystone Bill Despite Obamas Opposition
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Wednesday passed a bill approving construction of the Keystone XL oil pipeline, setting up a confrontation with President Obama, who has vowed to veto the measure.

title: In an Era of Disclosure, an Excess of Sunshine but a Paucity of Rules
description: Louis Brandeis was wrong.

title: App Smart | Unleash Your Inner Bruce Lee
description: Whether it is jiu-jitsu, karate or tai-chi, three mobile apps can help you practice and improve your martial arts skills.

title: Jon Stewarts Notable Moments on The Daily Show
description: Jon Stewart, who took over The Daily Show in 1999, announced on Tuesday night that he would leave the satirical news show sometime this year. Mr. Stewart had plenty of confrontations, hard talks and other memorable moments, both comedic and poignant, in his 16 years at the helm. Here are a few highlights.

title: A Visitor From London
Frigid New York Draws the Frozen and the Eclectic
description: If you think its chilly in New York City, its even colder in Toronto. So it is perhaps not surprising that several theater companies from Ontario are headed south to participate in Frigid New York. Frigid, entering its ninth year, is actually affiliated with the Canadian Association of Fringe Festivals and is modeled on its principles of first-come, first-served access for artists and a 100 percent return of box-office proceeds to those artists.

title: 36 Hours in Koreatown, Los Angeles
description: Explore street view, find our points of interest and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: 36 Hours in Koreatown, Los Angeles
description: As the most densely packed part of Los Angeles, Koreatown is also one of the citys most strollable, with Art Deco buildings, palm-lined streets and East-meets-West restaurants.

title: 36 Hours in Koreatown, Los Angeles
After Talks, Eurozone and Greece Fail to Settle Differences Over Debt
description: BRUSSELS  Eurozone finance ministers failed to narrow their deep differences with Greece on Wednesday over how to keep the country from running out of money as it tries to revise the terms of its bailout.

title: American Sniper Case Opens
description: Alan Nash, a district attorney in Texas, and Tim Moore, the defense lawyer, gave different portraits of Eddie Routh, who is accused of killing Chris Kyle, the protagonist in the American Sniper film.

title: The World of Pat McGrath
description: In the beauty universe, you could say the world spins around Pat McGrath. Over the course of her three-decade career, the prolific, self-taught makeup artist has worked with in-demand models (Naomi, Gisele, Cara, Kendall), major fashion houses (Christian Dior, Versace, Prada) and the top photographers (Steven Meisel counts her among his closest collaborators). A backstage fixture, McGrath can set trends with a wave of her hands  she famously prefers to work with her fingers instead of with brushes  and is nothing if not extremely versatile: dewy, no-makeup skin, custom-made Swarovski crystal face masks and feather-adorned eyelids and brows are all in her wheelhouse. In 2004, she was made global creative design director for Procter & Gamble Beauty, and last spring, Queen Elizabeth II named her a Member of the Order of the British Empire for services to the fashion and beauty industries. (To celebrate, McGrath snapped her first selfie.) Here, a closer look at all things in McGraths orbit.

title: The Case for Buying a Powerball Ticket
description: This article was published last February when the Powerball lottery hit $500 million. The point remains the same with the even larger jackpot this week.

title: Jerry Tarkanian, 84, N.C.A.A. Foe and College Basketball Force, Dies
description: Jerry Tarkanian, who built Nevada-Las Vegas into a national powerhouse in college basketball with an insatiable will to win, created the persona of Tark the Shark and ignited a long-running feud with the N.C.A.A. over accusations that he ran outlaw programs at three universities, died on Wednesday in Las Vegas. He was 84.

title: The Power of Saving: Exploring the Mathematics of Compound Interest
description: Overview | How do savings accounts grow? How can small, regular contributions add up to sizable retirement accounts? In this lesson students explore the basic mathematics of savings and interest using a simple model inspired by a recently proposed automatic retirement savings plan. By manipulating the parameters of the model and analyzing the consequences, students can build intuition about long-term investment strategies and evaluate the proposed policy from a quantitative perspective.

title: Would an Emoticon Have Taken Eight Years?
description: Maia Leppo didnt think that she and her boyfriend, Alex Kobzik, had a problem until they were vacationing with his family on Cape Cod, Mass., last summer, eight years into their relationship, and his mother asked them when they had first said I love you.

title: Obama Seeks an Expansive War Authorization to Combat ISIS
description: Nearly five months after launching a war against the Islamic State, in Iraq and Syria, the Obama administration has gotten around to requesting formal authorization from Congress to conduct that war.

title: For Valentines Day, Adore Me Takes On Victorias Secret and Other Bigger Lingerie Rivals
description: In the weeks leading up to Valentines Day, the headquarters of Adore Me, a lingerie start-up, are frantic with activity, for good reason: Its daily sales in this period are more than 20 times the typical volume and nearly double those of Black Friday or Cyber Monday.

title: Marcel Hirscher, a New Kind of Austrian Ski Star, Is Set to Add to His Title Collection
description: BEAVER CREEK, Colo.  After winning the world title in the Alpine combined on Sunday, and delivering on the high expectations of his ski-crazed country, Marcel Hirscher of Austria was able to relax. So he celebrated his victory the best way he knew how: with steins of beer and plates of Wiener schnitzel at the Austria House, a temporary outpost of his homeland here in the Vail Valley complete with apple strudel, oompah bands and women wearing dirndls.

title: Some Weekend Wandering Yields Ancient English Coins
description: LONDON  A cache of 11th-century coins found by an amateur treasure-hunter was unveiled at the British Museum here this week.

title: A Police Sergeant Is Charged With Sexually Assaulting a Girl
description: A New York City police sergeant was arrested on Tuesday and charged with several counts of sexual assault, including rape and sexual misconduct, on a girl in the Bronx, the authorities said.

title: Helen Mirren Returns toBuckingham Palace in The Audience
description: LONDON  You bastard.

title: A Supermarket of Choices
description: To look at the spring collections is to see broad categories based on distinct, vintage styles.

title: Kings of Their Crafts, but on Divergent Paths
description: Other than timing, Jon Stewarts triumphant retirement and Brian Williamss public and humbling disenfranchisement would seem to have little in common.

title: Newsom Wastes No Time in Run for California Governor
description: The election might be nearly four years away, but the race to be the next governor of California is already getting started.

title: Can Jon Stewart Be Replaced?
description: As with many late-night departures in recent years, Jon Stewarts announcement that hell be leaving The Daily Show quickly incitedspeculation about who would take over his job. As Deadline Hollywoodputs it, denial is the first stage of grief for fans of Mr. Stewart Stage 2 is Replacement List Compilation.

title: Google, Mighty Now, but Not Forever
description: Technology giants often meet their end not with a bang but a whimper, a slow, imperceptible descent into irrelevancy that may not immediately be reflected in the anodyne language of corporate earnings reports.

title: Clothes and Character: Inherent Vice
description: There are often misperceptions about what a costume designer does, said Mark Bridges, the Oscar-winning designer of The Artist and a nominee once again for Inherent Vice, Paul Thomas Andersons take on the hemp-infused novel by Thomas Pynchon.

title: PEN World Voices Festival Returns With Eye on Africa
description: The PEN World Voices Festival has announced the schedule for its 11th annual incarnation, from May 4 to 10.

title: Reducing Blood Pressure Lowers Risk of Diabetes Complications
description: Lowering blood pressure can significantly reduce the risk for many of the complications of Type 2 diabetes, a review of data from 40 trials involving more than 100,000 people with diabetes has found.

title: Premature Delivery Tied to Heart Risks in Mother
description: Premature delivery is tied to increased heart risks in the mother, a review of studies has found.

title: On the Strauss-Kahn Trial Beat: Reporters Notebook
description: Covering the trial of Dominique Strauss-Kahn, the former I.M.F chief accused of being part of a freewheeling global sex ring, presented a challenge. How should one cover the case in a manner that would not be too prurient or inappropriate for a family newspaper?

title: Love and Politics Collide as Scandals Plague Oregons Fourth-Term Governor
description: SALEM, Ore.  The allegations swirling around Gov. John Kitzhaber and his live-in fiance did not seem to bother Oregonians much when they re-elected him last fall to an unprecedented fourth term. But now, with hints of scandal tumbling out almost by the day  about the business dealings of the fiance, her previous marriage and her role in state government  the reaction has descended into a mix of tittering gossip, outrage and dismay, threatening to tarnish the last years of one of the states most enduring politicians.

title: Director of  Gardner Museum to Step Down
description: Anne Hawley, who has led the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston for 25 years and oversaw an expansion that opened in 2012, more than doubling the museums footprint and increasing attendance, announced Wednesday that she planned to step down at the end of the year.

title: Scott Walker, Traveling Abroad, Avoids Foreign Policy
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin visited London on Wednesday on a trade mission that some saw as an opportunity to bolster his foreign policy bona fides as he looks toward a presidential run in 2016.

title: First 911 Call
description: The first of two 911 calls, made at 5:11 p.m. on Tuesday, reporting a shooting in Chapel Hill, N.C. The caller describes hearing multiple, between five and 10 gunshots and kids screaming.

title: Steps to Protect Your Tax Data as Refund Fraud Spreads
description: Last weeks suspension of some electronic state tax filings because of a sudden increase in fraudulent returns highlights the need for consumers to track potential misuse of their personal information, especially at tax time.

title: One Great Unknown Steps Into Another
description: LOS ANGELES  On a sunny January afternoon, James Corden stood on the roof of CBS Television City, the boxy building where he will take over as host of the networks Late Late Show, and surveyed his new domain.

title: My Name Is Rachel Corrie to Be Staged Off Broadway in April
description: My Name Is Rachel Corrie, a one-woman drama about a pro-Palestinian activist, will be staged Off Broadway this spring for the first time since an earlier production nine years ago caused an uproar in some corners of the New York theater world. A spokesman for the show announced on Wednesday that the play would run April 2-12 at the Culture Projects Lynn Redgrave Theater in the East Village.

title: Kyle Bass Wields New Weapon in Challenging Drug Makers
description: Drug makers make unlikely candidates for the next big short. Kyle Bass, a hedge fund manager who bet successfully on a housing market crash in the United States, is aiming at pharmaceutical companies worth a combined $450 billion in market capitalization.

title: Congress, Dont Be Fooled; Obama Still Believes in Unlimited War
description: PRESIDENT OBAMA is going before Congress to request authorization for the limited use of military force in a battle of up to three years against the Islamic State. On the surface, this looks like a welcome recognition of Congresss ultimate authority in matters of war and peace. But unless the resolution put forward by the White House is amended, it will have the opposite effect. Congressional support will amount to the ringing endorsement of unlimited presidential war making.

title: Captain of Ship That Capsized Off Italy in 12 Is Convicted
description: ROME  An Italian court on Wednesday convicted the captain of a cruise liner that capsized in 2012, killing 32 people, of manslaughter and sentenced him to just over 16 years in prison for his role in one of the worst maritime disasters in modern Italian history.

title: Facebook Takes Its Hardware Designs to a Giant Scale
description: Not content with connecting 1 billion-plus people, Facebook wants to connect millions of computer servers, too. The idea is to create technologies to handle data loads that are tens, even hundreds of times greater than what most companies have to handle today.

title: Officer Charged in Akai Gurley Case Debated Reporting Gunshot, Officials Say
description: For four minutes, a New York City police officer who had just fired his gun into a darkened housing project stairwell argued with his partner over whether to tell their superiors about the shot.

title: Another Week at No. 1 for Taylor Swift
description: In a slow season for new albums, no one can beat Taylor Swift.

title: Unauthorized Immigrants Access to Drivers Licenses Is at Risk
description: DENVER  His drivers license is an economic lifeline, said Felipe Castro, an unauthorized immigrant from Mexico who commutes 40 miles each morning to his construction job in Northern Colorado. Or it was, until it expired last week.

title: Student Filmmakers Focus on Coral Reef Revival in Curacao
description: Its hard for me to believe, but this is my fifth year working with Pace University graduate and undergraduate communication students on films with environmental themes.

title: First Draft Focus: Obama Between Speeches
description: President Obama, at the White House, making the case for Congressional authorization to use force against the Islamic State.

title: Withdrawing Troops, Obama Calls for Vigilance on Ebola
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama announced on Wednesday that the United States was withdrawing almost all of its troops from the fight against Ebola in West Africa, but he said the world needed to remain vigilant as it sought to eradicate the deadly disease.

title: Microsoft Continues Mobile Push With Sunrise Acquisition
description: Microsoft has again turned outside the company to bolster its mobile app offerings.

title: Vienna, City of Dreams
description: Known as The City of Dreams, Vienna, Austria, is one of Europes crown jewels. But modern Vienna is more than just a place for history buffs looking to explore extravagant attractions (though Schloss Belvedere and the Lipizzan ballet at the Imperial Palace certainly fit that description). Its a host to a burgeoning community of designers and artists. Furthermore, the home city of Sigmund Freud also offers an array of indoor cultural experiences, making it an ideal wintertime destination. Here, in honor of the citys festive ball season, is a guide to the places worth visiting.

title: New York Fashion Week: Fingers Crossed Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Helga Traxler.

title: Doris Salcedo, Whose Art Honors Lives Lost, Gets a Retrospective in Chicago
description: CHICAGO  When the elevators at the Museum of Contemporary Art here stop on the fourth floor, they usually open on a large, airy lobby with a view of Michigan Avenue. These days, they open onto a vast art installation by the Colombian sculptor Doris Salcedo that evokes a mass grave.

title: Indictment of Officer Peter Liang in the Death of Akai Gurley
description: The six-count indictment of Officer Peter Liang in the fatal shooting of Akai Gurley includes several felony charges, including second-degree manslaughter.

title: Lincoln Center Will Bring Concerts to the South Bronx
description: Lincoln Center is going to the South Bronx this spring, announcing Wednesday that it will offer a series of free events there for families and children by groups including the New York Philharmonic, Jazz at Lincoln Center, New York City Ballet and the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Dressing Inherent Vice
description: Mark Bridges dressed the women of Inherent Vice in one sexy number after the other because he wanted to give life to the vivid, psychedelic world created by the books author, Thomas Pynchon.

title: Reid Offended by Boehners Language
description: Speaker John A. Boehner went to great lengths on Wednesday to get his message across on funding the Department of Homeland Security, urging Senate Democrats to get off their ass and do something.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Ukraine and More  Pictures of the Day

title: New York Fashion Week: Fingers Crossed Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Helga Traxler.

title: Feb. 11, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Yemen, Greece, Ukraine and Egypt.

title: Obama Says U.S. Work on Ebola Isnt Done
description: President Obama said that although all but 100 of the American troops deployed to West Africa to help manage the Ebola outbreak will be coming home by April 30, the civilian response will be expanded.

title: Where to Caffeinate, Juice Up and Wind Down During New York Fashion Week
description: Fashion Week starts tomorrow. And with the dizzying number of shows scattered throughout the city this season, attendees will have even less time than usual to settle in for leisurely breaks and repasts in between presentations. With a focus on whats mostly new and talked-about this season, weve compiled a list of the best spots to drop by for beverages, whether its a hot coffee, a healthful juice or smoothie, or a days-end cocktail  in other words, the trifecta of Fashion Week drinking.

title: Review: BalletNext Takes Risks in Baroqued
description: Despite its live music and the admirable skills of most of its dancers, Baroqued, BalletNexts program at New York Live Arts, is always less than good. It varies from the blandly vague (the first two items) to the amateurishly pseudo-experimental (the last). That last dance, Something Sampled, is sufficiently irksome to be considerably more memorable than the first two.

title: Review: Janine Jansen and Itamar Golan Balance Power and Nuance at Zankel Hall
description: New York fans of the Dutch violinist Janine Jansen have had it rough in recent years. Illness caused her to bow out of high-profile concerts with the Budapest Festival Orchestra in 2013 and the New York Philharmonic last year. On Tuesday, she was back, in radiant form, with a recital at Zankel Hall alongside the Israeli pianist Itamar Golan, which proved that she is an artist worth the wait.

title: Classical Playlist: J. S. Bach, Mendelssohn, Wu Man and More
description: J. S. BACH: CONCERTOS FOR OBOE AND OBOE DAMOREGonzalo X. Ruiz, oboist; Portland Baroque Orchestra, Monica Huggett, violinist(Avie AV2324) The mellow, soulful sound of the Baroque oboe and oboe damore is the star attraction of this quietly compelling album of arrangements of Bach keyboard concertos featuring one of the pre-eminent artists on those instruments. The Baroque violinist Monica Huggett, at the helm of the Portland Baroque Orchestra, offers sensitive, stylish support. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

title: Data Security Gaps in an Industry Student Privacy Pledge
description: On the eve of a congressional hearing to explore the use of new technology in classrooms nationwide, a software engineer has found significant gaps in an industry effort to bolster student data security and privacy.

title: On Set | Floral, Military Spring Fashion
description: Ts senior fashion editor Jason Rider reveals the inspirations behind styling a floral and military trend fashion spread for the magazines spring fashion issue.

title: At Yale, Trading a Playbook for a Songbook
description: Approaching 10 p.m. on the eve of a recent blizzard, the Rockwood Music Hall, on the Lower East Side of Manhattan, was running low on breathing room, packed so tightly that each whoosh of cold air from the opening of the rear door brought sharp-eyed looks from those inside  no more, please. Even the stage was jammed: four musicians (drummer, keyboardist, two guitarists) and four singers, one of whom, stashed in the corner, slapping a tambourine against his hip, stood 6 feet 6 inches.

title: Smokings Toll on Health Is Even Worse Than Previously Thought, a Study Finds
description: However bad you thought smoking was, its even worse.

title: Review: Sara Gazarek Exudes Confidence and Cheer
description: The West Coast jazz singer Sara Gazarek, who appeared at Birdland on Tuesday evening, has many of the right moves. Rhythmically adept, she is an accomplished scat improviser who exudes an engaging blend of confidence and cheer. Her singing, at its most inventive, recalls Jane Monheits flights of fancy but without Ms. Monheits vocal lushness. She is at ease with tricky samba rhythms that break up phrases into staccato exclamations, and her far-reaching taste in songs encompasses both standards and original collaborations that take her in a pop direction.

title: On JetBlue, Passengers Can Use Apple Pay
description: If youre a frequent flier, JetBlue has just given you one more excuse to upgrade to an iPhone 6. This week the airline announced that it would become the first to allow its customers to use Apple Pay to make in-flight purchases.

title: Beautiful Unrest: Roughed-Up Florals for Spring
description: Vivid botanical prints lose their ladylike sweetness when paired with utilitarian staples.

title: Obama on His Islamic State Resolution
description: President Obama described the resolution he submitted to Congress for authorization to use military force against ISIS. He said it did not authorize a ground war like those in Iraq and Afghanistan.

title: Review: Single, Carefree, Mellow, Except for That Illicit Affair
description: The young woman in the first story in Katherine Heinys debut collection, Single, Carefree, Mellow, has never lived in an apartment with air-conditioning. But thats about as close to hardship as Ms. Heinys heroines get. Most are urban American semi-strivers, worrying a little about work, a little about happiness and a lot about the illicit affairs theyre carrying on. When it comes to these liaisons, Ms. Heiny has a fine way of keeping her women sharply perceptive about details yet too delusional to see the big picture.

title: Theyll Just Hate to See Jon Stewart Go (So They Say)
description: WASHINGTON  He has all but called them losers and fools, but when Jon Stewart announced on Tuesday that he would leave The Daily Show sometime this year, many politicians and news media personalities had something of an unusual reaction: grief.

title: Deutschland 83 and Shkufim Are Among Exciting International Series
description: BERLIN  Sometimes there are limits to the imagination. Luckily, reality is much more boundless.

title: A Credit to the Game Leaves a Legacy
description: One of the true gentlemen of bridge, Ernesto dOrsi, died on Jan. 9 in his hometown, So Paulo, Brazil. He was 78.

title: Wife Says Gunman Believed in Equality
description: Karen Hicks, the wife of Craig Stephen Hicks, who is accused of murdering three Muslim students, said he championed individuals rights on his Facebook page and believed everyone was equal.

title: New York City Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Rules Are Suspended on Thursday
description: Because of Lincolns Birthday, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Thursday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Shopping With Paige Novick
description: Some jewelry boxes look like jewels themselves. Others are strictly for storage.

title: Review: In Iphignie en Aulide, a Daughters Ultimate Sacrifice
description: The opera world often seems consumed with arguments over productions. A high-concept modern staging is at once condemned and cheered by various factions; a traditional production will be seen as either appropriately respectful or hopelessly timid.

title: Walker Steps Back From Evolution Punt
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, in London on a trade trip, was forced to elaborate Wednesday on his views about evolution after his decision to punt on the question turned into a trans-Atlantic stumble.

title: Whole Foods Market Reports a Rise in Sales
description: Sales at Whole Foods Market stores rose 10 percent to $4.7 billion in the most recent quarter as the upscale grocery chain drew more customer traffic, the company announced on Wednesday.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: The Green Goddess Club
description: The fashion color of the moment is deep green.

title: For New York Fashion Week, Look-at-Me Style Statements
description: As Fashion Week comes to town on Thursday, the streets will fill with look-at-me style statements. But fewer of those, we suspect, will be ratcheted to the heavens on sky-high heels. Its all about sneakers now. So which will be the most popular of the season? Were betting on these styles, some of which, like the pastel Stan Smiths reinterpreted by Raf Simons, were previewed by attendees at last months fashion shows in Paris. Safer passage across New Yorks patches of ice is but a bonus.

title: Reading The Times With Andrew Solomon
description: Andrew Solomon is the National Book Critics Circle Award-winning author of Far From the Tree and The Noonday Demon.

title: By Their Emails Ye Shall Know Them
description: The art of legislative power is being in the know before anyone else  which is why rank-and-file Kansas lawmakers are asking why they were kept in the dark for weeks even as Gov. Sam Brownbacks office was sharing his pending state budget with a couple of heavyweight statehouse lobbyists. The sneak preview was allowed for a select few state officials plus David Kensinger, who resigned three years ago as the governors chief of staff to become lobbyist for the powerfully conservative Club for Growth, and Mark Dugan, another ranking lobbyist who previously served as Mr. Brownbacks campaign manager.

title: A Topsy-Turvy Day in TV Land
description: To the Editor:

title: Shopping Sales and Events in New York City
description: Not on Fashion GPS? There are still plenty of ways to take part in New York Fashion Week festivities. On Thursday, from 2 to 6 p.m. at Fivestory, you can sip pink Champagne and shop Valentines Day confections  Treat House Rice Krispies bars ($24 for 12), heart- and penguin-shaped New York Cake Pops ($19.99 for six) and Jars by Dani parfait-like creations ($6.25 for a four-ounce Mason jar)  from some purveyors of the fashion flocks favorite guilty pleasures. They are not the only goodies: Theres a new Kotur x Fivestory glitter globe minaudire ($445), as well as drapey tees from the London cult T-shirt label Rotten Roach with witty slogans by the illustrator Hugo Guinness ($106) for those wanting something a little less, well, sugar-coated. At 18 East 69th Street.

title: Public School Is Giving Women Their Due
description: Walk strong, Piergiorgio Del Moro, the casting agent, urged. Avery, a model, complied, stalking the makeshift runway at Milk Studios in Chelsea the other day with a scissors-like stride and a scowl. Avery didn't make the cut, but those loose-limbed girls who did were invited to walk once more, each cocooned in a flyaway puffer coat.

title: Lease Deal for Pier 55 Park in Hudson River Is Approved
description: Plans for a cultural island in the Hudson River took a step forward on Wednesday, when the Hudson River Park Trust approved a lease agreement with a group controlled by Barry Diller that plans to help create a new $130 million pier with performance spaces and sylvan paths.

title: Natures Patterns in an Ancient Art
description: The pots made at the Acoma Pueblo in New Mexico were digital before there was digital, said Dan Brewster, an owner of DARA Artisans, an online store that sells handmade goods from around the world.

title: Its Place in the Footlights
description: David and Donna Feldman were looking for a balance between modernist rigor and antique embellishment when they began to produce their own furniture out of a workroom in Chelsea. They named the business Dmitriy & Company, inspired by Mr. Feldmans Russian-born grandfather, who had a pillow shop on the Lower East Side.

title: Wood Dressed in Black Tie
description: Josh Vogels Blackline collection is a result of a kitchen accident of sorts: He set a knife on a cherry cutting board and it turned the board black.

title: New Lookout for Solar Storms Lifts Off on SpaceX Rocket
description: On the third try, the Deep Space Climate Observatory rose into the sky above Cape Canaveral, Fla., on Wednesday night atop a Falcon 9 rocket built by the Space Exploration Technologies Corporation, or SpaceX.

title: She Did the Traveling, You Get the Souvenirs
description: Folkthread, a collection of home furnishings by Kit Kemp for Anthropologie, was inspired by the folk art and textiles she has encountered in her travels. (Ms. Kemp, an interior designer, runs Firmdale Hotels with her husband, Tim; they own eight hotels in London and the Crosby Street Hotel in Manhattan.)

title: A New Generation of Designers Chooses Anonymity
description: A few days before the beginning of New York Fashion Week, Christopher Peters was on the phone, talking about his forthcoming collection.

title: Jewelry Boxes: My Bracelets Keepers
description: Paige Novick has her own line of costume jewelry, but she also designs fine jewelry, so she is well versed in the wearing and storing of both.

title: Should We Replace the Patterned Wallpaper in Our Powder Room?
description: Q. Our cozy powder room has dark, dramatically patterned wallpaper. Should we replace it with something simpler and lighter before selling?

title: Fashions Racial Divide
description: When Michelle Obama stepped onto the stage at the Democratic National Convention in 2012 to talk about her husband and the coming election, the Internet went into an effective group swoon. Words like spotlight stealing and dazzling were used with abandon. Not about the first ladys speech, but about her dress: a shimmering pink and silver sleeveless number by the designer Tracy Reese.

title: In Sort-of-Defense of Roy Moore
description: Chief Justice Roy Moore of the Alabama Supreme Court is trying to block same-sex marriage in his state, despite a federal court order allowing it. Moore told Good Morning America that he is confident he will absolutely not end up on the wrong side of history. The fact that 36 states (apart from Alabama) now allow same-sex marriage, with rising support from the public, suggests hes probably wrong about that. His central legal claim  that same-sex marriage is a states rights issue, rather than one that implicates the guarantee of equality in the Constitution  is also a loser. Moore argued that redefinition of the word marriage is not found within the powers designated to the federal government, but Congress makes all kinds of rules involving marriage (and pensions and taxes) and the Supreme Court has previously ruled that marriage is a fundamental right.

title: The Hollyhock House Comes Into Its Own
description: Finally, the planets seem to have aligned for Frank Lloyd Wrights Hollyhock House. On Jan. 30, the United States Department of the Interior announced its decision, seven years in the making, to nominate the 1921 Los Angeles home, along with nine other works by Wright, to the Unesco World Heritage List, which includes icons like the Taj Mahal and Statue of Liberty. And tomorrow, the building, now a house museum, will reopen after a four-year $4.3 million restoration.

title: Backpacks That Pack Power for Mobile Devices
description: WITH people juggling multiple digital devices that constantly need charging, backpack manufacturers have sensed a market opportunity. Some new backpacks are specifically designed not only to protect our smartphones, tablets, laptops, headphones and game players, but also to recharge them and track their whereabouts.

title: Deadlier Ties to Ukraine?
Furnishing the Presidents House
description: Last year, the interim president of RISD found herself with a 21-room house to fill. Luckily, she knew a few suppliers.

title: The Most Famous Macedonian Designer Youve Never Heard Of
description: On Monday, a few days before New York Fashion Week was set to begin, one of its newest participants was at home in Bali, working to get his collection ready and fretting about the move from London Fashion Week, where he typically shows.

title: Its Empty at the Top
description: When Rosanne Somerson was promoted in January of last year, the good news was that her new job came with a historic house on a lush piece of property. The bad news? She had two and a half weeks to furnish it.

title: His Game in Tatters, Tiger Woods Takes a Leave
description: The soap opera that has become Tiger Woodss life took another shadowy turn Wednesday when Woods announced he was taking an indefinite leave of absence from competitive golf to work on his floundering game.

title: In Community Gardens, a New Weed?
description: The trouble started with an R.F.Q: a request for qualifications in the bloodless shorthand of city government. But thats not quite right. The shot that started the latest skirmish in New Yorks never-ending garden wars wasnt an R.F.Q., but an addendum to an R.F.Q.

title: Six Nights, Seven Pillows
description: Can the right pillow fix what ails you? Penelope Green tests several in an effort to find out.

title: Look Out Below!
description: Ive occasionally been known to throw myself onto the face of a home-improvement cliff so steep that I can barely make it to the top, let alone finish with something pretty. Last week, I bailed halfway up the cliff, and the crash was gloriously, hideously ugly.

title: Installing Molding and Tin Ceilings
description: Heres what youll need.

title: The Pillow Cure
description: My neck is killing me. Isnt yours? My shoulder hurts, too. Not always the same one, but always in the morning. Herniated disks, spinal stenosis, bone spurs: Its a mess in there. As for the shoulders, one gave out with a horrible popping noise in a yoga class a few years ago; the cause of the others decay remains a (very dull) mystery.

title: Lincoln Prize Goes to Harold Holzer
description: Harold Holzer, a Lincoln scholar who recently announced his retirement as a public affairs executive at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, has been awarded the 2015 Gilder Lehrman Lincoln Prize, to be announced Thursday.

title: Education Is Newest Target of Kansas Budget Cuts
description: KANSAS CITY, Kan.  In November, shortly after Gov. Sam Brownback won re-election, experts forecast that the state would bring in $1 billion less than expected over the next two years. He responded by cutting state agency budgets and proposing the transfer of funds among various state accounts. In December came news of a revenue slump, falling to $15.1 million below estimates. Mr. Brownback proposed increasing taxes on liquor and cigarettes, slowed reductions in the income tax and changed the way money was distributed to public schools.

title: Tesla Motors Met Its Output Goal, but Showed a 4th-Quarter Loss
description: DETROIT  Tesla Motors, the maker of high-end electric cars, said on Wednesday that a flurry of production in the fourth quarter helped it achieve its target of building 35,000 vehicles last year.

title: Jury Pool for Trial in Aurora Shooting Is Pressed on Death Penalty
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  Lawyers on Wednesday began questioning potential jurors for the trial of the man accused of killing 12 people and wounding 70 during a showing of a Batman film in a packed Colorado movie theater in 2012.

title: Council Speaker Seeks Criminal Justice Reforms in State of the City Address
description: The speaker of the New York City Council, Melissa Mark-Viverito, on Wednesday took aim at the broken windows approach to policing, proposing a significant easing of penalties for certain minor quality-of-life offenses like jumping turnstiles.

title: British Revenue Chief Is Faulted on HSBCs Efforts to Aid Tax Evasion
description: LONDON  The chief executive of Britains tax agency was questioned by politicians over leaked documents that describe how HSBCs Swiss private banking arm helped clients, including politicians, rock stars and dealers of illicit diamonds, hide billions of dollars before 2007.

title: Corruption Scandal at Petrobras Threatens Brazils Economy
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The accusations of corruption at Brazils state-controlled petroleum giant Petrobras have already led to a political scandal and a change in management. Now, the problems are threatening other Brazilian companies and may even tip the country into recession.

title: A Black Preacher Addresses Congress
description: On Sunday, Feb. 12, 1865, Henry Highland Garnet, minister of the Fifteenth Street Presbyterian Church in Washington, entered the halls of Congress. He could not escape notice. He was, his friend Alexander Crummell later wrote in his Eulogium on Garnets life, tall and majestic in stature, over six feet in height, with a large and noble head, its front both broad and expansive, his chest deep and strong, his limbs straight and perfectly moulded. Garnet was in the House of Representatives that morning at the invitation of William Henry Channing, chaplain of Congress, to deliver a sermon. Channings request was hardly a surprise; after all, the Capitol had served as a church for many decades, and preachers had long spoken in its halls. What was astonishing was that Garnet was a black man, no longer relegated to the galleries but standing at the speakers dais.

title: Indonesias Graft Fight Strikes Fear Even Among the Honest
description: BANDUNG, Indonesia  One is a telecommunications executive, another the former president-director of a state airline, and the third a project manager for Chevron.

title: F.B.I. Director to Give Speech Addressing Relations Between Police and Blacks
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, on Thursday will wade into the national debate about the relationship between police officers and African-Americans that was highlighted by the fatal shooting of an unarmed black man in Ferguson, Mo., in August. It will be the first time one of the bureaus directors has publicly addressed the issue of race at length.

title: Soldiers From Sudan Raped Hundreds in Darfur, Human Rights Group Finds
description: UNITED NATIONS  Sudanese soldiers raped more than 200 women and girls in Darfur last fall, Human Rights Watch concluded in a report issued Wednesday, confirming allegations that the large United Nations peacekeeping mission in the area could not.

title: Former Head of Inquiry Into Gaza War Says He Faced Pressure and Threats
description: PARIS  The Canadian law professor who resigned this month as head of a United Nations inquiry into last summers Gaza conflict said his appointment had been troubled from the outset by intense pressure from Israels government, which accused him of a pro-Palestinian bias.

title: Valentines Day Chocolate Will Cost More This Year, as Cocoa Prices Rise
description: This year, perhaps more than ever, kisses may not come cheap.

title: At Cricket World Cup, a Group of Underdogs Gets a Rare Opportunity
description: It would be hard to find two words that seem so ill-matched as Afghanistan cricket.

title: Funding Is Still Elusive for Homeland Security
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans who have been so disciplined in their opposition to President Obama are now finding themselves badly splintered over how to keep the Department of Homeland Security operating as they struggle to demonstrate they can govern effectively as the party that controls Congress.

title: Comedy Central Ponders How to Replace Jon Stewart
description: Jon Stewarts announcement that he will give up his anchor chair on Comedy Centrals The Daily Show by the end of the year reverberated on Wednesday through the corridors of power in Washington, New York publishing houses and most important, the networks parent company, Viacom.

title: At the Time Warner Center, an Enclave of Powerful Russians
description: In March 2009, a bookish-looking Russian senator stepped to the podium at the Brookings Institution in Washington. The occasion was the inauguration of a new think tank devoted to United States-Russia cooperation on financial and energy security, and the speaker, Andrey Vavilov, had donated money.

title: Brian Williams Scandal Prompts Frantic Efforts at NBC to Curb Rising Damage
description: Hours before Brian Williams took the anchors chair for the nightly newscast on Feb. 4, a sense of dread began to spread through the Rockefeller Plaza offices of NBC News.

title: Jet.com Gets Investment That Values It at $600 Million
description: Jet.com, a soon-to-start online marketplace that aims to loosen Amazons grip on e-commerce, said Wednesday that it had raised $140 million in a new round of funding.

title: In India, Glimpses of Economic Optimism and Frustration
description: MUMBAI, India  Arriving at the new international airport here last month, I felt like I had gotten on the wrong connecting flight and ended up in Shanghai. Instead of the smelly and decaying terminal I remembered from the four years I spent here as a news correspondent, the building was sparkling. The walkway to the immigration counter doubled as a museum filled with paintings, sculptures and handmade crafts from around the country.

title: Part Villain, Part Victim, Jerry Tarkanian Simply Won
description: It was strange that Dean Smith and Jerry Tarkanian died within days of each other. They were coaching peers from opposite sides of the reputational spectrum, with Smith, the longtime coach at North Carolina, remembered as the gentlemanly throwback to a time when coaching was done right and Tarkanian cast as the misunderstood pioneer of an era  the same era  when it all went wrong.

title: Landlord Bribed Inspectors in Ruse to Evict Tenants, Prosecutors Say
description: One night last December around nine oclock, tenants at 159 Suydam Street in Bushwick, Brooklyn, were startled by loud banging on their doors and walls. A man in some kind of uniform was going up and down the four stories of their building, yelling that they had 72 hours to get out.

title: In Fashions for Men and Everything You Touch, Clothes Are a Main Player
description: Many costume designers claim that the best examples of their work are the ones that go unnoticed, that serve the play while staying demurely in the background.

title: Little League Scandal Shows Why Baseball Is Better Viewed From Afar
description: Heres a tip on choosing the perfect seats for this summers Little League World Series.

title: Taiwan: Six Inmates Kill Themselves, Official Says
description: Six inmates at a prison in southern Taiwan killed themselves Thursday morning, ending an overnight hostage situation, a Justice Ministry official said. Two prison staff members were released unharmed after being held for 14 hours at the Kaohsiung Prison, said the official, Chen Ming-tang, a vice minister in the Justice Ministry. The six inmates, who were all serving lengthy terms for crimes that included drug trafficking and murder, apparently complained about their living conditions to get a meeting with prison officials, whom they then took hostage on Wednesday, according to local news reports. The inmates later took firearms from a prison armory, Taiwans Central News Agency reported. Taiwanese news outlets broadcast a series of demands from the men, including that they be provided with vehicles and that former President Chen Shui-bian, who was convicted of embezzlement and taking bribes in 2009, be returned to prison. Mr. Chen was released on medical parole in January. But early Thursday, the six inmates shot themselves, Mr. Chen, the ministry official, said in a brief televised interview. He provided few details about the episode.

title: Christophe Gbenye, Radical Nationalist in Congo, Dies at 88
description: Christophe Gbenye, a radical nationalist whose brutal rebel warriors seized control of eastern Congo in 1964 and held hundreds of foreigners hostage until they were rescued by Belgian paratroopers dropping from American planes, died on Feb. 3 in Kinshasa. He was 88.

title: In Adolf Hitlers Hometown, Trying to Overcome a Legacy of Evil
description: BRAUNAU AM INN, Austria  Days after this city across the river from Bavaria surrendered to the United States Army in May 1945, a group of German soldiers sought to flatten a three-story house here that had served as a Nazi pilgrimage site and shrine since the late 1930s.

title: Response in Ferguson Draws Scrutiny

title: Rose E. Frisch, Scientist Who Linked Body Fat to Fertility, Dies at 96

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (NBC) THE SLAP Hector (Peter Sarsgaard) is a public servant, a father and a potentially philandering husband who has just lost out on a big job promotion. He finds his life in additional turmoil on the day of his 40th birthday party when his hotheaded cousin (Zachary Quinto) slaps the bullying 5-year-old son of another couple, inciting legal action  and resurrecting some long-buried family secrets. Melissa George plays the boys mother; Thandie Newton is Hectors beautiful wife; and Uma Thurman, Thomas Sadoski, Brian Cox and Makenzie Leigh round out the cast of this eight-part mini-series adapted by Jon Robin Baitz from an Australian series based on a novel by Christos Tsiolkas. Writing in The New York Times, Alessandra Stanley called the show a remarkable feat  a sophisticated, suspenseful comedy of ill manners that seems much more like a Showtime or Netflix drama than a broadcast network offering. The Slap, she added, connects, but its not a harsh blow. Its more of a bracing surprise.

title: What Our Paranoia About Drones Says About Us
description: A lazy drift of mist obscured an already gray November morning as I stared skeptically skyward in Morningside Park. It was not, I told myself, technically raining; still, moisture had begun to collect in the folds of my jacket as I surveyed the weather conditions. Driven more by impatience than by prudence, I decided to go ahead with the plan. Carefully following the precise sequence prescribed by the instructions, I switched on my remote controller and then the Wi-Fi transmitter, and finally double-pressed the power button on the back of the DJI Phantom 2 Vision quadcopter I purchased the night before. The copter trilled, then emitted four consecutive beeps. The GPS system began searching for satellites to map its launch coordinates, and a moment later the rotors whirred to life, sending ripples across a nearby puddle. And then the drone was airborne, rising to a hover six feet above me, conducting an aerial choreography to maintain its position despite the wind pushing it toward Manhattan Avenue. The copter streamed an image to my iPhone  me with my cap pulled low against the November drizzle, head tilted to meet the cameras gaze. A drone selfie. Portrait of a man under self-surveillance.

Dressed in hijab and fashionable dresses, carrying a fabric floral arrangement in a gold-colored pot, they came for the funeral of the three Arab-American students who were gunned down at their home a couple of days earlier.

title: Teaching Students How to Talk Less, and Think More
description: This weeks question comes from a discussion on my Facebook feed, in which Mark North, an instructor at Highline Community College in Des Moines, Wash., asked for suggestions about how to manage students who monopolize class time with their comments. I often get the flip side of this question from parents who say their childs teacher calls on some students and not others, or from parents who are concerned that their quiet child gets overlooked in class.

title: Does Your Work Fit Your Life?
description: Flexible work schedules have come in fora lot of praise lately. Last year, President Obama called for greater flexibility for federal workers  to attract, empower, and retain a talented and productive work force in the 21st century, he wrote in a memorandum, the Federal Government must continue to make progress in enabling employees to balance their responsibilities at work and at home. This year, hes been advocating for paid family and sick leave. In December, astudy suggested that work might be contributing to Americans sleep deprivation  its authors argued that making the work start time more flexible may help increase sleep time; even if total time spent working is kept constant. And in January, Samantha Cole at Fast Company reported on another study, this one finding that employees who were given flexible schedules and the option to work from home slept more than other workers, and also felt more well rested.

title: Oscars 2015: A. O. Scott and Manohla Dargis Discuss the Contenders
description: A love-fest and a hate-watch, the Academy Awards is one of the few widely seen real-time television events left. Last year, an estimated 43 million Americans watched the ceremony and clearly not because its good entertainment. It isnt even obvious that people love the movies in contention. When 12 Years a Slave won best picture, only about six million people had seen the film; Gravity sold many more theater tickets, but even so, more people watched the Oscars than had seen that movie then. To judge from the recent flurry of culture-war-inflected skirmishes about some of the nominees, its clear that its no longer a question of whether the Oscars matter but why. Manohla Dargis and A. O. Scott have been observing the commotion and offer some late-breaking critical views on the race as it enters its frenzied final stretch.

title: 1915: Wilson Sends Berlin Ultimatum
description: LONDON  In a firm, but respectful, Message, which New York papers, led by the New York Herald, described as an ultimatum to prevent war, President Wilson has notified Berlin that the sinking of an American ship by a German war vessel will constrain the American Government to hold the German Government to strict account, and to take any steps necessary to safeguard American life and property. The Note to Germany reminds the Imperial Government that the sole right of belligerents is limited to visit and search unless a blockade is effectively maintained  which this Government does not understand is proposed in this case. To Note continues: To declare of exercise the right to attack or destroy any vessel entering the prescribed area on the high seas without first determining its belligerent nationality and the contraband character of its cargo is an act so unprecedented in naval warfare that this Government is reluctant to believe that the Imperial Government of Germany in this case contemplates it as possible. The New York Herald, European Edition, Feb. 13, 1915

title: The Whites, by Richard Price Writing as Harry Brandt
description: Many years ago, in a magazine interview, Richard Price (now the author of nine novels, including Clockers and Lush Life) was asked why he devoted so much of his considerable literary talent to crime fiction and film scripts featuring criminals. He responded by saying that when you circle around a murder long enough you get to know a city. I cut that line out of the magazine and taped it above my computer screen. For several years, it presided over what I wrote in my own novels. With that answer, I believed that Price had crystallized what many writers knew and attempted to practice. That is, he considered the crime novel something more than a puzzle and an entertainment; he saw it as societal reflection, documentation and investigation.

title: Charles Ptillons Invasions Animate the Ordinary
