description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Dance Listings for Feb. 13-19
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Dismay and Relief in Brooklyn Over a Party That Wont Be Coming to Town
description: The citizens of Brooklyn had been told that their story was Americas story  a story of possibility, of hope, of diversity, of a new start (Mayor Bill de Blasio). They had been reassured that their borough had swag on lockdown (City Councilwoman Laurie Cumbo).

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for Feb. 13-19
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

description: Mark Spitznagel is the founder and chief investment officer of Universa Investments, and the author of The Dao of Capital.

description: Meet the Breeds

title: Spare Times Listings for Feb. 13-19
description: Around Town

title: The Private-School Sales Bump on the Upper East Side
description: For the next several weeks, many New York City families will be in a state of apprehension as private schools begin sending out their acceptance letters.

title: Chinas Internet Restrictions Are Hampering Business, Foreign Companies Say
description: BEIJING  The new Chinese agency in charge of Internet control and censorship might have recently unveiled a rousing television anthem celebrating its shaping of cyberspace, but foreign businesspeople here say they have little to sing about.

title: U.N. Envoy Says Assad Is Crucial to Defusing Conflict in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Appearing to address one of the core issues that have derailed peace talks in Syria, the United Nations special envoy for the country on Friday described President Bashar al-Assad as a crucial part of the solution to ending the war there, news agencies reported.

title: CCTV, Chinas Propaganda Tool, Finds Itself at Center of Antigraft Drive
description: BEIJING  As President Xi Jinping accelerated his sweeping campaign against government corruption, political enemies and Western influences in China, he deployed the Communist Partys most powerful propaganda tool, the state television network, like a hammer.

title: Reader Idea | He Said, She Said, I Say: A Researched Argument Essay
description: We are in the middle of our Second Annual Student Editorial Contest, when students practice writing short, evidence-based persuasive pieces similar to the editorials in The New York Times.

title: A Russian TV Insider Describes a Modern Propaganda Machine
description: LONDON  NORMALLY a boisterous sort, Peter Pomerantsev says he kept quiet when he found himself, at the age of 24, in a Moscow meeting room listening to 20 of the countrys top media executives discussing the news agenda for the week.

title: Tune In, Slim: 50 Ways to Be Entertained by Love
description: Confused about love as Valentines Day weekend arrives? Not sure how to get into, improve, reinvent or get out of a relationship? You obviously havent been watching enough television. With all due respect to Fifty Shades of Grey on its debut weekend, its the 50 Ways song that comes to mind here, with 50 TV shows standing ready to help you meet, retain, change, impress or leave your lover:

title: The Mystery of Lower Voter Registration for Older Black Voters
description: In December, I wrote an article titled Evidence That the Jim Crow Era Endures for Older Black Voters in the South. The article, based on voter registration and census data in Georgia, noted that older black voters who reached voting age before the passage of the Voting Rights Act were significantly less likely to be registered to vote compared with whites of similar age and black voters who reached voting age in the years afterward.

title: Zlata Mangafic Transforms at Creatures of the Wind
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Zlata Mangafic before (left) and after (right) makeup by James Boehmer and hair by Anthony Turner.

title: Whats on This Week Around the World
description: Humlebaek, Denmark

title: Suicide Attackers Kill 19 in Assault on a Shiite Mosque in Pakistan
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Heavily armed militants killed at least 19 people and wounded more than 40 after they stormed into a Shiite mosque during Friday Prayer in a suburb of Peshawar, the main city in northwestern Pakistan, doctors and officials said.

title: 1890: Taxi Tariff Approved in Paris
description: The committee of the Chambre Syndicale des Cocher has accepted the principle of the compteur horo-kilomtrique, and all the Paris cabs will have to be supplied within eighteen months.Though the mechanism of the compteurs may differ, no special model having been chosen, the exterior plate will be of a uniform type for the convenience of the public. It will be fastened to the box in such a position that it will face the occupant of the cab, and that the light of one of the lamps will fall on it. M. Alphand will make his report to the Municipal Council on Monday next. He proposes to fix the tariff for a cab at 25 centimes per kilomtre, plus 50 centimes for the hire of the vehicle. The clock is intended to show the amount of time the cab may have been kept waiting. Two francs an hour will be charged in cases of this kind.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Feb. 14, 1890

title: When the First Bagger, David Carr, Hit the Red Carpet
description: Its a dark day at The New York Times, and particularly here on the Carpetbagger beat, which the inimitable David Carr, who died last night, started a decade ago.

title: Weekend Entertainments from the Archives of The New York Times
description: 138 YEARS AGO

title: A Former Fashionistas Life as a Florist Blooms
description: As Georgie Newbery welcomes guests in the fields of her small farm on a rainy winter day in Somerset, England  her Wellingtons muddied and water dripping off the rim of her soggy hatits hard to imagine that she was once a regular guest at Paris fashion shows. During her glamorous previous life in the 1990s, Newbery was the assistant to Susan Train, the legendary Paris bureau chief of American Vogue, and later served as office manager for John Galliano, back when he was being courted by LVMH to take over Givenchy. Next, she moved to London where she penned three rollicking romans  clef about the fashion industry, before leaving that world for good. Today, with her press-shy English husband, Newbery runs Common Farm Flowers, a floral company that delivers cheerful bouquets and centerpieces by mail throughout Britain. They grow most of the flowers organically themselves at Common Farm, a seven-acre spread with a ramshackle house they are restoring. Newbery has also returned to her original love of writing and combined it with her third career as a florist, producing The Flower Farmers Year: How to Grow Cut Flowers for Pleasure andProfit ($30, Green Books), a richly illustrated how-to guide in which Newbery shares all that she has learned in her 10years in the fields of southern England.

title: For Molly Pope, Adventures in Cabaret and Horseplay
description: In an 1861 performance of the melodrama Mazeppa, the actress Ada Isaacs Menken, playing a man, caused outrage when she appeared to be stripped naked  she was actually wearing a body stocking  and was tied to a horse.

title: Health Insurance Enrollment: Beating the Deadline
description: THERES still time to get health insurance this year under the Affordable Care Act. But youll have to be quick.

title: Aftermath of Bombings at Pakistan Mosque
description: Policemen surveyed the scene after Taliban suicide bombers attacked a Shiite mosque in Peshawar, Pakistan, while victims were rushed to the hospital.

title: On the Ukraine Cease-Fire
description: A plan for peace in Ukraine was negotiated in Minsk, Belarus.

title: Rice Apologizes to Fans, Citing Horrible Mistake
description: Ray Rice, the former Baltimore Ravens running back who punched his fiance in a hotel elevator a year ago and has been at the center of a swirling controversy over domestic violence in the N.F.L., apologized Friday for his behavior.

title: At Baltimore Symphony, a Cello and a Violin Make More Than Music
description: BALTIMORE  It was a year ago that Marin Alsop, the music director of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, lost both of her parents, who were respected musicians themselves, within the space of 11 days. But whenever she takes the podium here to conduct the orchestra, she finds herself surrounded by audible, often quite mellifluous, reminders of them both.

title: Page One Documentary Trailer
description: Watch a preview of the 2011 documentary about the paper, Page One: Inside The New York Times, featuring the media desk and David Carr.

title: 20-20 Foresight
description: Simon Wren-Lewis has a long-form discussion of the austerity con in the London Review of Books, which is well worth reading; he also has a sort of commentary on his commentary on the blog, which makes some good points about the difficulty in talking about macroeconomics to a general audience.

title: Online Dating Rules for My Grandmother: Must Drive, Preferably at Night
description: I look like a barracuda, my then 83-year-old grandmother, Gloria, said, laughing, but rather matter-of-fact. That was her appraisal of an iPhone picture that my husband snapped for her JDate and OurTime.com profiles back in September. We went with a picture of her from our wedding instead.

title: Modi Voices Concern at Crimes Seen to Target Indias Christians
description: NEW DELHI  Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India expressed concern on Friday about a series of episodes at Catholic churches in New Delhi that have raised fears among Christians here about a deliberate campaign of violence.

title: Video Reviews of Fifty Shades of Grey, Gett and The Last Five Years
description: In this video, Times critics share their thoughts on Fifty Shades of Grey, Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem and The Last Five Years. See all of this weeks reviews.

title: States Consider Increasing Taxes for the Poor and Cutting Them for the Affluent
description: A number of Republican-led states are considering tax changes that in many cases would have the effect of cutting taxes on the rich and raising them on the poor.

title: Selling America in Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  In the competition for hearts and minds in Asia, one of the United States best weapons may be a storefront in a Jakarta mall.

title: Minding the Kids
description: Those daring adventures into the treacherous territory of the stand-alone novel are all very exciting, but readers do remain devoted to their series sleuths. So its good to see Laura Lippmans scrappy Baltimore private eye, Tess Monaghan, back on the job in HUSH HUSH (Morrow/HarperCollins, $26.99), a tough-minded but wonderfully entertaining book that might be called a parenting mystery. During the years shes been out of commission, Tess has become the mother of a little girl, Carla Scout, now 3 years old and a real handful. (A first-class meltdown in the liquor aisle of a grocery store should endear the child to amused strangers, while piling up sympathy points for her mother.)

title: Chickpea Stew With Moroccan Spices
description: Melissa Clark makes a vegetarian stew with chickpeas and rainbow chard.

title: Democrats Convention Choice for 2016 Reflects a Philadelphia Resurgence
description: PHILADELPHIA  Cheesesteaks? Never mind. Sichuan shoestring French fries? Thats more like it. Like many American cities, Philadelphia has greatly evolved both economically and culturally since 2000, the last time a major political party held its national convention here, not to mention the days when W. C. Fields made it a national punch line.

title: Paperback Row
description: WORLDLY PHILOSOPHER: The Odyssey of Albert O. Hirschman,  by Jeremy Adelman. (Princeton University, $24.95.) Shaped by modern horrors and hopes, Hirschman (1915-2012) spent his life in constant motion. Born in Berlin, he studied at the London School of Economics; fought in the Spanish Civil War; helped spirit thousands of refugees out of Nazi-occupied France; and blended economics, politics and culture in a pathbreaking 30-year academic career. Adelmans superb biography brings every twist and turn of this story to life.

title: Editors Choice
description: MOURNING LINCOLN,  by Martha Hodes. (Yale University, $30.) In her lyrical and important study, Hodes finds little evidence of national unity in the face of the assassination, but rather shock, jubilation, confusion and disagreement.

title: Jersey Guy Attitude Sinks Christies Ratings in New Jersey
description: Gov. Chris Christies push to raise his national profile ahead of a possible White House bid is taking a toll at home in New Jersey.

title: Wes Gordon: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: David Carr, the Traveler
description: These are the things I carried: an iPad jammed with various kinds of media, enough batteries to stock a Wal-Mart, a BlackBerry, a bunch of DVDs, 7,000 songs on my iPod, and a bottle of extra virgin olive oil, David Carr wrote about his visit to a private island in the Bahamas in 2010. These are the things I needed: My wife.

title: Try the 36 Questions on the Way to Love
description: A recent Modern Love essay refers to a study that explores whether intimacy between two strangers can be accelerated by having them ask each other a specific series of personal questions. The idea is that mutual vulnerability fosters closeness.

title: U.S. Faults Russia as Combat Spikes in East Ukraine
description: ARTEMIVSK, Ukraine  As fighting erupted throughout eastern Ukraine on Friday before a cease-fire begins on Saturday night, the United States accused Russia of joining separatist rebels in an all-out attack on Ukrainian forces around the contested town of Debaltseve.

title: The Elm, Paul Liebrandts Brooklyn Restaurant, Is Closing
description: The Elm, a Brooklyn hotel restaurant that hoped to bring the art-influenced, French-tinged cuisine of the chef Paul Liebrandt to the booming neighborhood of Williamsburg, will serve its last meal on Sunday.

title: Law Enforcement Concerns Create Unlikely Alliances in Missouri and Beyond
description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo.  For years, poor black residents of St. Louis County have complained bitterly about being jailed when they could not pay traffic fines. Protesters in Ferguson, after the fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager by the police last year, even cited those fines  and related trips to jail  as a major reason for their anger.

title: Readers Inspired by the 36 Questions
description: Stories we have received from strangers and longtime couples who were inspired by Mandy Len Catrons Modern Love essay.

title: The 36 Questions: An Answer to Their Prayers?
description: Last month, a few days before Mandy Len Catrons essay To Fall in Love With Anyone, Do This appeared in Modern Love, she aired some concerns about the coming exposure on her blog, writing that while a few hundred people may see one of her blog posts, thousands would see this column.

title: Irish Animators in a Strange Land (Los Angeles)
description: Five years ago, Hollywood was mildly gobsmacked when The Secret of Kells, an obscure animated Celtic film from a teeny studio in southeast Ireland, came from nowhere to land a nomination for the best animated feature Oscar. The young filmmakers were, too. This year, the same filmmakers put a little more muscle into getting a nomination for their second effort, Song of the Sea, by spending time with Academy members and so on. That, too, worked: they earned their second nod.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: Ebola, measles and weight and fertility. Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: The Beginners Guide to Chartering a Yacht With a Crew
description: ADAM ROSENFELD, a lifelong Miami resident, needed a vacation, but he was struggling to persuade his wife to go anywhere with their toddler in tow. Gone were the days when the couple could jet around Asia, jamming as many things into a vacation as they wanted.

title: Breathing Life Into Dragons
description: Cara Buckley is invited to the Dreamworks Animation Studios, to meet the creators of the award winning animated feature, How to Train Your Dragon 2.

title: Chasing the Scream, by Johann Hari
description: On July 9, 2001, the British newsweekly New Statesman published a column by a 22-year-old named Johann Hari titled Just You Wait Until I Grow Up. It began with Haris announcement that hed celebrated his recent graduation from Cambridge University with a few tabs of Ecstasy and the odd line of coke. After that casual boast, Hari argued that the legalization of narcotics was not only inevitable but would save lives, create a more just society and help rectify the disengagement of young people from politics.

title: Tributes From All Over for the Incomparable David Carr
description: The Times did right by its brilliantmedia columnist, David Carr, on Friday, featuring a beautifully written obituary on the front page, above the fold, with a perfect black and white photograph. It was accompanied by a perceptive appraisal from his friend the film critic, A. O. Scott. On the home page, there were other offerings, too: Links to some of the best Carr quotes, to an excerpt fromhis book, to the video of a panel he moderated just before he died, and to the trailer for Page One, the documentary in which he played a starring role.

title: From Syria, an Atlas of a Country in Ruins
description: A satellite image analysis reveals vast devastation in major cities across Syria from the civil war that started nearly four years ago.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: The War on Drugs
description: This week, Seth Mnookin discusses Johann Haris Chasing the Scream; John Williams has news from the publishing world; Ben Yagoda talks about The B Side; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: David Carr, the Journalists Bard
Aer Lingus Board Urges Irish Government to Support Takeover Bid
description: LONDON  The board of Aer Lingus urged the Irish government on Friday to support a takeover bid by the parent of British Airways, saying the offer will accelerate the Irish airlines growth plans and enhance Irelands position as hub for trans-Atlantic travel.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: The War on Drugs
description: This week, Seth Mnookin and Ben Yagoda.

title: Stuff We Liked: Surprising Facts About Vaccination and Beer
description: Here are the things we found on the web this week that you might enjoy as much as we did.

title: Inside the List
description: Adaptation, Part I: Readers who have kept tabs on Nick Hornbys career might not be surprised that his new novel, Funny Girl  new at No. 9 on the hardcover fiction list  devotes considerable attention to a couple of scriptwriters. Thats because Hornby, who made his name with the 1995 novel High Fidelity, has lately embraced Hollywood in a big way. He received an Oscar nomination for his screenplay for the 2009 movie An Education (adapted from Lynn Barbers memoir), then went on to adapt Cheryl Strayeds Wild, currently in theaters, and Colm Toibins novel Brooklyn, which had its premiere last month at Sundance. (Interestingly, Hornby did not write the screenplay for High Fidelity, which jumped to film in 2000, or any of his other books to become movies  confirming the wisdom that its better to operate on other peoples children than your own.) In a recent online interview with The Atlantic, Hornby, who is British, explained why he had actively pursued the Wild gig: Theres a side of me that responds very deeply to American things, he said. The book to me felt like a Springsteen album. I always loved Springsteen, but hes very American. That kind of directness is really interesting to me because it doesnt have to be unsubtle. Its just a different way of being, a different way of thinking. The great thing about adaptation is it gives you a chance to be someone else.

title: A Bad Character, by Deepti Kapoor
description: The title character of Deepti Kapoors searing debut is dead by Line 1, but I still read A Bad Character in one frantic sitting. I wasnt desperate for details about his mysterious death or his relationship with the narrator; it was Idha, a woman ready to defy societal conventions, who kept me on the line.

title: Kelly Links Get in Trouble
description: So come on then, whats your superpower? You must have one  everyone does. And who is your nemesis? Whats your origin story? Have you managed to find a reliable sidekick? How many shadows do you have? Do you currently have a boyfriend, or would you prefer a Boyfriend? And have you been to the pocket universe thats like Florida, only better?

title: Greg Baxters Munich Airport
description: Imagine being in a foreign airport with your father, and your sister is somewhere in the same airport in a coffin waiting for you to fly her home, but the airport is fogbound and heaving with unhappy souls and you are given hours and then days to contemplate her death and your life. This is the plot, such as it is, of Greg Baxters second novel. The airport in question is Munich, and the fog is a confusion that seeps into the whole novel  Baxter is the fog machine and we the readers are also fogbound.

title: The Patient Will See You Now, by Eric Topol
description: With his previous book, The Creative Destruction of Medicine, Eric Topol, a cardiologist and director of the Scripps Translational Science Institute, established himself as one of medicines most innovative thinkers about the digital future. In The Patient Will See You Now, his exhaustively researched follow-up, Topol turns his attention to medicines democratization via unplugged digitization, with the smartphone as the hub. With approximately two billion users worldwide, smartphones, Topol says, are the most rapidly adopted technology in the history of man.

title: Flipping Through Film School
description: The film critic Matt Zoller Seitz met the filmmaker Wes Anderson in 1994 in Dallas, after seeing the short film Bottle Rocket, an expanded version of which would become Andersons first full-length feature. In 2013, their long relationship yielded The Wes Anderson Collection, Seitzs lavishly illustrated book about Andersons seven feature-length movies up to that point.

title: The Jaguars Children, by John Vaillant
description: In 2003, a trailer truck crammed with immigrants trying to cross the United States border illegally was abandoned on the outskirts of Victoria, Tex. As the heat inside climbed over 100 degrees, 19 people died of asphyxiation and heatstroke  one a 5-year-old boy and one believed to be his father. Holes, which people had made by taking turns attempting to scratch their way toward breathable air, were visible in the insulation of the locked door.

title: Love
description: THE BOOK OF LOVE  Improvisations on a Crazy Little Thing  By Roger Rosenblatt  Ecco/HarperCollins, $22.99.

title: Bonita Avenue, by Peter Buwalda
description: The title of the Dutch writer Peter Buwaldas volatile, time-scrambling first novel alludes to a residential street in Berkeley, Calif., where its central characters, the Sigerius family, once experienced a fleeting year or two of happiness before returning to their native Netherlands. But an equally apt title might be Breaking Glass.

title: A Moroccan Stew With Spice and Sweetness

title: Classic and Contemporary
description: An exquisitely preserved townhouse at 26 East 80th Street that was built in 1888, became part of a landmark district in 1977 and was restored and updated inside and out in 1995, has returned to the sales market after spending two years as a specialized rental  the tenant was the Argentine mission to the United Nations.

title: Gene-Altered Apples Get U.S. Approval
description: The government on Friday approved the commercial planting of genetically engineered apples that are resistant to turning brown when sliced or bruised.

title: Peak Times for Loan Closings
description: The most popular times to close on a mortgage are on Fridays and at the end of the month  even though there is not necessarily any financial advantage to borrowers in doing so.

title: Deleting Files From Microsofts OneDrive
description: Q. I have Windows 8.1 on my desktop computer. I moved a document to the OneDrive, which I did not mean to do, so how do I delete it?

title: Posing for Fashion Houses, N.B.A. Stars Feel at Home

title: A Spool of Blue Thread, by Anne Tyler
description: Picture a middle-class American family, four generations, living in the suburbs. The founder is an upstart with a murky past, a hard-working construction guy in a bleak marriage. Next in line are his son and the sons wife  hes a chip off the old patriarch, inherits the construction business, soldiers on. Shes the maddening, meddling family fixer-upper, determined that her four children will, against all odds, tolerate if not love one another. And then there are the children, at midlife and with children of their own: a couple of daughters who annoy each other, an acquired son (the product of a crazy arrangement) and of course the obligatory black sheep, Denny, the prodigal son who surfaces intermittently to provide the drama, which, after all, is his job  in the family as in the plot of Anne Tylers graceful and capacious new novel, A Spool of Blue Thread.

title: Once Upon a Revolution, by Thanassis Cambanis
description: Western coverage of the Arab Spring was often simple-minded, as journalists focused on the dramatic confrontations between the police and protesters in Tahrir Square in Cairo or on Libyan militiamen fighting Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis soldiers on the road south of Benghazi. Uprisings were reported like scenes out of Les Misrables, with an oppressed people battling a brutal tyranny everywhere from Tunis to Bahrain.

title: To a Friend, on His Divorce
description: YOU were 7 and I was 6 when we met near the jungle gym. After becoming bandmates in high school and enjoying a brief twinkle of local stardom, we became men and did man things, one of which was each finding someone we loved enough to marry. I have proof that both of us were happy then. The photos from our weddings show us laughing, smiling, greeting friends and relatives, eating cake, smoking cigars and dancing.

title: Making Brokers Toe the Mark
description: If you are in the market for financial advice, good luck figuring out which financial advisers are legally obligated to act in your best interest. There is a big difference between glorified salesman and true investment advisers, and yet the onus is on consumers to sort it all out.

title: When Italys Bad Bank Is a Good Idea
description: Italys bad bank is a good idea. Rome wants to set up a vehicle to sweep up banks toxic loans. Its risky; government-funded bad banks can wind up losing taxpayers money. Yet it could also help lending and even spur consolidation in Italys fragmented banking system.

title: Drexel, 25 Years After Its Collapse, Only Helps a Rsum

Poroshenko of Ukraine had agreed on her release during peace talks this week.

Enter Craig Bassam and Scott Fellows, the founders of the design brand BassamFellows, known for their work with the James Hotel and their aid in reviving the Swiss luxury brand Bally (and designing its corporate headquarters). On Monday, the duo will introduce its first line of apparel and accessories, imbued with the same attention to detail and craft as their rigorously Modernist furniture, interiors and architecture.

title: Close but No Cigar
description: I have been close with a family member since she was a little girl. She is now the mother of two young children. I am also a mother, so I know how time-consuming that is. But I dont understand why she has time to post on Facebook but doesnt have time to answer my emails. I have tried commenting on her posts, but that doesnt work, either. I am a baby boomer, and she is a Gen X-er. Can you explain whats going on? Anonymous

Not Your Bubbes Kasha
description: On Sunday I cooked up a big pot of nutty-tasting kasha, the cooked cereal made with toasted buckwheat groats. I enjoyed it all week. I stirred some into a frittata along with leeks and spinach, added it to two different salads and to buckwheat pancakes. I ate it plain, with a little milk and maple syrup as porridge for breakfast, and made a dinner in a bowl of kasha topped with mushroom ragout and kale.

title: Roger Goodells 2013 Pay of $35 Million Keeps Him in Top Tier of Executives
description: Roger Goodell, the commissioner of the N.F.L., was paid $35 million in 2013, a year in which the league signed major television and sponsorship deals and settled a landmark concussion lawsuit, and in which two teams began work on new stadiums.

title: The End of Trend
description: Typically, fashion editors sit at shows seeking out common threads or ideas to bring back to their offices and translate into fashion spreads that tell us what we ought to be wearing that season. This service is what you might think that we, at T, are here to provide. But times have changed. Technology and the economics of fashion have overthrown the old hegemony in which what was fashionable was proposed by designers, decreed by editors and proselytized for by department stores.

title: Gov. John Kitzhaber of Oregon Resigns Amid Crisis
description: SALEM, Ore.  Gov. John Kitzhaber, long regarded as a wily survivor of Oregon politics, resigned Friday amid a spiraling crisis that included a criminal investigation of the role that his fiance played in his administration and crumbling support from his Democratic Party colleagues.

title: 1915: Britain Hails Air Raids Success
description: LONDON  All England is rejoicing to-day [Feb. 13] at the superb flight of her great air fleet, thirty-four strong, across the Channel, with not a serious injury to a pilot, and accidents to only two of the machines. It seems almost incredible that it was only five years ago that Blriot made the pioneer aeroplane trip across the Channel, so vast and rapid has been the progress since. The raid not only represents the largest fleet of air craft that has ever operated together, but it is a fitting reply to the German bombardment of British towns, and a warning to the Kaisers forces in Belgium of further damage. One fact well demonstrated by the raid is that in case of such an attack, land guns are unreliable defences, and it is necessary to meet aeroplanes with aeroplanes. The attack probably puts an end to Germanys reputed intention to use Zeebrugge and other places on the Belgian coast as bases for submarines. The Admiralty states that no submarines were seen. This indicates that German preparations are too incomplete for them to trust these craft in Belgian harbors.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Feb. 14, 1915

title: Can Battery Geniuses Transform Cars and the Grid?
description: Early this week, I enjoyed discussing a brewing, but halting revolution in battery technology with the journalist and author Steve LeVine, who spent the last several years exploring the frontiers of energy-storage innovation for his new book, The Powerhouse: Inside the Invention of a Battery to Save the World.

Still, this move raises questions about how satisfied the administration is with Mr. Gilberts work and sends uncertain signals about the orchestras future.

title: Refuse to Vaccinate? Little Religious Ground to Stand On
description: Earlier this month, a bill surfaced in the New York State Legislature proposing that parents be permitted to reject vaccinations for their children simply because they opposed them philosophically, as one might oppose Oreos or the Disney Channel. The bill had emerged before and gone nowhere; in the unlikely event that it was enacted, it would give parents even greater leeway to reject science for children who were ostensibly in school to gain an understanding of it.

The Bagger visited the studio shortly after its Globe win, meeting the films animators and even trying voice acting with one of the films stars, Craig Ferguson.

title: Michele Mariotti to Conduct at the Metropolitan Opera

Two company members danced an Agnes de Mille pas de deux. The production manager, also a puppeteer, did a melancholy number with a wooden board as a prop.

description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi and American military officials have intensified talk in recent weeks of a major offensive against Islamic State militants, casting it as a quickly approaching operation that is likely to target the extremists stronghold in the northern city of Mosul.

title: Lynn Hershman Leeson Explores Technology and the Split Self
description: The philosopher Isaiah Berlin once described David Humes idea of the self as a pure fiction, a name for the concatenation of experiences out of which human personality and human history were formed, simply a kind of string which held together the onions, except that there was no string. For decades, the artist and filmmaker Lynn Hershman Leeson has been playing with this un-string, which technology has rendered all the more evanescent. Starting Thursday, a broad sweep of her unsettling work will inaugurate Bridget Donahue, a new gallery on the Lower East Side being opened by a longtime director at Gavin Browns Enterprise, the West Village gallery. Ms. Donahue said she had been drawn to Ms. Hershman Leeson as a kind of prophet of our cybernetic condition, through early interactive works that delved into artificial intelligence and surveillance and yearslong performances that blurred the line between acting and life. The show, Origins of the Species, through April 5, will span from the late 1960s to recent work exploring the implications of genetic manipulation. (99 Bowery, 2nd floor; bridgetdonahue.nyc.)

title: Why Movie Facts Prevail
description: THIS years Oscar nominees for best picture include four films based on true stories: American Sniper (about the sharpshooter Chris Kyle), The Imitation Game (about the British mathematician Alan Turing), Selma (about the passage of the Voting Rights Act in 1965) and The Theory of Everything (about the physicist Stephen Hawking).

title: Review: Douglas Dunns Aidos Is Set to Bach at BAM Fisher
description: Its about halfway through Douglas Dunns Aidos that things get weird. This 75-minute work, which had its debut on Wednesday at BAM Fisher, is set to 12 movements from Bachs six suites for unaccompanied cello, played live and out of their original order by Ha-Yang Kim. Much of the choreography is politely balletic, its decorum ruffled only momentarily by a rough outburst here, a flash of louche hip motion there.

title: Jason Wu Lets His Models Hair Down
description: Its a new wave for Jason Wu, who usually sends his models down the runway in some sort of low ponytail but opted instead for a natural hairstyle on his fall/winter 2015 runway. It was nonchalance and sexiness having their hair just the way it is, letting the girls really shine through, explained the designer. The clothing is very glamorous, very sexy. The hair down felt like the girls did it themselves.

I know youre not following what Im saying anyway, right? he says, laughing at an audience he considers too unsophisticated to understand.

description: Scenes from the second day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Bill Cunningham | The Teddy Bear Coat
description: New York Fashion Week opened on Thursday with designers proposals for next winter, but many people on the street have already decided that the future is functional and classic, and the eccentricities of fashion are better left to the art world. A row of teddy bears in a window display for Valentines Dayshow the color that is already the choice of many men and women spotted in New York.

title: Inside Ts Spring Womens Fashion Issue
description: Ts spring womens fashion issue celebrates the free thinkers whose distinct visions shape our culture today. On the cover is Bjork, whose genre-bending songs and mastery of design, technology and visuals have been pushing music forward for the past three decades, and who is being honored with her first retrospective at MoMA next month. We pay a visit to Sharjah, where the progressive sheikhs daughter, Hoor Al Qasimi, has inherited  and subsequently boosted the profile of  a humble but growing art expo with some serious indie cred. Stateside, we take a closer look at Philip Johnsons iconic Glass House, which may be the late architects greatest achievement (even if its not quite right to call it his home). And in the never-dull French capital, where politicians have been known to air their laundry for all to see, Liesl Schillinger spins a true-life tale of sex, lies and presidents truly befitting the City of Light. Elsewhere, Cathy Horyn assesses the promise and perils of a post-trend fashion world; a pair of authors and a visual artist spill secrets from their diaries; a writer with a rare skin condition that keeps her isolated from the outside world sheds light on her life in the darkness; the talented and at-times controversial French-Canadian filmmaker Xavier Dolan sets his sights on Hollywood; and the prolific makeup artist Pat McGrath gets a close-up of her own in By the Numbers. See all stories from the issue >>

title: Evening Hours | Florid Designs
description: Dinners, exhibitions and a traditional ball.

title: Argentine Debt Dispute Remains Murky Even as London Court Sheds Some Light
description: A stalemate in the bitter dispute over Argentinas bonds looks set to drag on, even after a ruling on Friday in an English court gave one side a small victory.

title: Drake and Kanye West: Proven Paths to Stardom
description: Kanye Wests debut album, The College Dropout, ends with a rambling recitation, Last Call. In it, he recalls the conspicuous consumption of his younger years: Get a Pelle Pelle off layaway, get some Jordans or something/Or get a TechnoMarine, thats what we wore back then.

title: Review: Joan Shelley Offers Celtic-Tinged Melodies
description: Stars shine overhead, and rivers flow nearby in songs by Joan Shelley, who performed on Thursday night at Union Pool in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Her music is folky and pastoral, with a sense of scale that makes her humble about her place in mankind and the universe, and her songs are serene but never complacent. In Electric Ursa, the title song of her current album (No Quarter Records), Ms. Shelley sang, Under your stars, your earthless movement/We are only feeble humans.

title: The AmfAR Gala:The Right Place, Just in Time
description: Fashion Week isnt a safe space for Brian Williams, either.

title: From Feuding Friends, Lovers From Russia and Ukraine
description: When tirades between Russians and Ukrainians overwhelmed Oksana Yushkos Facebook feed, she issued a plea for understanding. Soon, love followed.

title: Love in the Time of Binge-Watching
description: Like many couples, Jed Kolko and Eric Rice like to watch their favorite television programs together. The hardest part is hitting the play button at the same time.

title: What Makes a Celebrity Gaffe Stick?
description: At the National Book Awards last November, Daniel Handler, better known as the childrens author Lemony Snicket, bounded onstage after Jacqueline Woodson won a top prize for Brown Girl Dreaming, the chronicle of her familys history from slavery to civil rights. As the applause for her award died down, Mr. Handler, the evenings M.C., told the crowd that Ms. Woodson had once shared with him over lunch that she was allergic to watermelon.

title: Shelves Full of Superheroes
description: Alexs MVP Cards and Comics has found a new home in Yorkville.

title: Change, Slower Than a Speeding Bullet
description: Im not a big change guy, said Alex Gregg, the owner of Alexs MVP Cards and Comics. The depth of that understatement becomes clear as you get to know Mr. Gregg, who has been married for 28 years, tended bar at Elaines for 22 years and ran his comic store at 256 East 89th Street for 26 years.

title: Gradual Transformation at Oscar de la Renta
description: Peter Copping, the successor to Mr. de la Renta, has made small but significant changes at the company.

title: Bridget Everett, Curves and All
description: An encounter with Bridget Everett, for some of us at least, means acquiring a new vocabulary, terms like meatballs, slingshots, low-riders and slip-and-sliders. Turns out that in Ms. Everetts colorful lexicon, they are synonyms for breasts, expressions she drops routinely in Rock Bottom, her wildly ribald thrice-weekly cabaret show at Joes Pub.

title: Cynthia Rowley: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: A Deal at the 2009 Baze Senior Knockout Teams
description: The names of most great bridge players are well known in the game. A few experts, however, fly under the radar  their talent being recognized primarily by their peers. One of those was Garey Hayden, who died on Feb. 5 in Tucson, his hometown. He was 70.

title: Catching Up at Upholstery Store, the Bar That Got Itself a Kitchen
description: Sometimes even the best old neighborhood haunt can use a little sprucing up. So it went with Upholstery Store: Food and Wine, once a narrow wine bar on a quiet block in the West Village, which reopened in late January, after a year of renovations, with a new food menu. We always wanted to do something with oysters and with fish, said Leo Schneemann, who owns the reincarnated Upholstery Store with the chef Kurt Gutenbrunner. But the bar had no kitchen.

title: Trust Us, Hes Big on the Underground Club Circuit
description: AGE 23

title: Keeping the Oscar de la RentaName Alive
description: The first day of Peter Coppings new job at a new brand in a new country did not go exactly as planned.

title: Hidden Buyers of High-End Condos
description: To the Editor:

title: Jordanians See U.S. Reporting Bias in Coverage of Student Killings
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Whether three young students were shot and killed in North Carolina this week in a parking dispute or, as their families believe, because they were Muslims, online commentators here and outside the Middle East say the victims religion makes it a hate crime.

title: Condemning Radical Islam
description: To the Editor:

title: Is Truth in Love Overrated?
description: To the Editor:

title: Love Is in the Air
description: Over the past several years, the photographer Todd Heisler has captured moments of affection in New York, everywhere from baseball stadiums to subway stations.

title: Betsey Johnson: A Role Model, Still
description: Fifty years ago, the designer Betsey Johnson  part rebel, part cheerleader  got herself from proper Connecticut to New York City, as many a respectable female adventurer was wont to do. She arrived in Manhattan by way of a 1964 Mademoiselle magazine guest editorship. (She was in good company: Joan Didion and Sylvia Plath preceded her.) But that wasnt the New York she was searching for. She had been staying at the white-gloved Barbizon Hotel for Women, and knew there was another New York. Soon she found it: the dark new bohemia that was just then supplanting the earnest folk-singing scene of Macdougal Street. She was home.

title: In Praise of the Cute Animal Video
description: It started with the wombat. Or was it the big blackbird that for reasons unexplained, landed and loitered on a mans guitar while he skillfully played Blackbird by the Beatles? Or did it start with the raccoon sitting up on its hind legs and putting its agile little paws in the mouth of a beagle to give what looked like an unusually thorough checkup?

title: Smoke-Free Policies
description: To the Editor:

title: Iran: Delays Feared in Reporters Trial
description: The mother of Jason Rezaian, The Washington Posts Tehran correspondent, who has been incarcerated without publicly explained charges since July 22, said Friday that she feared new delays in his trial, and that the Iranian authorities had sharply curtailed prison visits from Mr. Rezaians Iranian wife. Mr. Rezaian was formally charged in January, even though the judiciary has not disclosed any details. His mother, Mary Rezaian, said that under Iranian law, Mr. Rezaian should be put on trial by early March, within 60 days after formal charges are set. But now, she said, there are rumblings that her sons case will not be heard until after the Persian New Year holiday, which falls on March 21 and lasts for about two weeks, so it can only be assumed his trial date might not be set before April 6. Mrs. Rezaian, an American who lives in Turkey, made the assertions in a written commentary posted on CNNs website. American officials and The Post have repeatedly called on Iran to release Mr. Rezaian, 38, a dual Iranian-American citizen.

title: Welcome in Connecticut
description: To the Editor:

title: Interfaith Marriages
description: To the Editor:

title: At Dangerfields Comedy Club, a Longtime Waiter Serves Up Shtick
description: Chario Antonio, 79, a longtime waiter at Dangerfields comedy club on First Avenue in Manhattan, loaded a stack of dishes into a small dumbwaiter behind the bar, then turned the joke on himself.

title: Conservative Politicians Abroad Seem More Accepting of Evolution
description: On Wednesday, in an interview in London, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, a potential Republican presidential candidate, sidestepped the question of whether he believed in evolution.

title: At Wes Gordon and Jason Wu,Seeing Blue Skies In a Grey Horizon
description: Fifty Shades of Grey, which (as we all know  admit it) opens on Friday, has already racked up the highest advance ticket sales ever for a Valentines Day, and taken up acres of newsprint, whether its critics wondering why it is so successful given how boring/prurient/sophomoric it is, or dismissing other critics wondering the above, or rising above by trying to make it into some sort of bellwether of our times.

title: Nicole Miller: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Recording Music, With a Camera
description: The members of Austins Mother Falcon are multi-instrumentalists, especially Tamir Kalifa, who is their man on accordion, piano, bouzouki, guitar and camera.

title: At New York Mens Day, Mens WearTakes a Turn Front and Center
description: Theres one group, at least, that wont be happy about the designer David Harts new mens wear collection, and thats the anti-man-spreading brigade.

title: Lagat, 40, Seeks Different Kind of Millrose Triumph
description: Bernard Lagat, who has won the Millrose Games signature Wanamaker Mile a record eight times, will probably finish toward the back when the race is contested Saturday at the 168th Street Armory. But he has his sights set on another significant accomplishment.

title: What Happened to the Big Armchairs in Grand Central Terminal?
description: Q. I live near the Throgs Neck Bridge. I watch the container ships passing under on a regular basis. They all have a tugboat either pulling or pushing them. How is the decision made to push or pull?

title: Multicolored Snow in Russia? No Worries, Officials Say
description: MOSCOW  In some places, say New York, the panic over snow often begins as soon as there is a forecast for it. In Russia, where it is a bit more familiar, there is typically no fear, unless the snow on the ground happens to be blue, as it was in Chelyabinsk this week, or orange, as it was earlier this month in Saratov on the Volga River.

title: At Brooklyn Police Station, Using Inmates Video (and Pizza) to Prevent Youth Crime
description: Instead of the evening tour of officers gathering in the muster room of the 73rd Precinct station house in Brownsville, Brooklyn, on Tuesday, a group of 10 teenagers slumped on folding chairs, joking and fidgeting as lights were dimmed for a video.

title: Finally Married in Mobile, Ala.
description: Kim and Regina Gebauer found themselves in the news media spotlight while waiting for a federal judge to order Mobile County to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.

title: A New Fix for Obamacare
description: EARLY next month the Supreme Court will hear arguments in King v. Burwell, the latest significant legal challenge to the Affordable Care Act. The petitioners argue that under the statute, the federal government is not allowed to provide health insurance subsidies in the 37 states that have either declined or failed to establish their own exchanges.

title: Banana RepublicArrives at Fashion Week
description: Marissa Webb, flanked backstage this week by assistants, stylists and a constant stream of admirers, has a lot riding on her shoulders at New York Fashion Week. There is her own designer label to manage, and then there is Banana Republic, set to make its Fashion Week debut this weekend.

title: Tapas for a Winter Break
description: I first ate at Xunta Tapas Espaa in Caldwell on a bleak day in January. It was the same day I had come to the realization that hibernating bears were onto something.

title: Taking Risks in Love
description: SHE was 25. I was 24. We spent only a couple of days together and shared no language in common. But when I returned to the United States from that European music festival, I announced to my parents that I had met my future wife.

title: Gary Owens, Droll Announcer on Laugh-In, Dies at 80
description: Gary Owens, a television and radio announcer best known as the droll, deadpan voice of Rowan & Martins Laugh-In, died on Thursday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 80.

title: Breaking a Record, 11 Days Pass in New York City With No Killings
description: Police commanders are almost afraid to mention it. One said on Friday that he was too superstitious to talk about the string of days without a killing in New York City.

title: Hitching a Toy to a Star
description: Superheroes wage some of their deadliest fights on the big screen.

title: Sifting Ukrainian Fact From Ukrainian Fiction
description: When Senator James Inhofe took the floor of the Senate on Wednesday to argue for arming the Ukrainian military, he brought with him what he called indisputable proof of Moscows support for the separatists in eastern Ukraine  a poster with three large photographs of Russian tanks entering Ukrainian territory.

title: In Dunk Contest, Tallest Competitors Face Taller Odds
description: The N.B.A. may be a tall mans league, but in the slam dunk contest, the taller you are, the harder it is win.

title: N. Hoolywood: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Leagues Visiting Stars Draw a Crowd and Leave a Sense of Longing
description: Come on, you can get it up there, LeBron James said.

title: Teenager Pinned Under Bus in Brooklyn; Driver Charged
description: A bus driver with the Metropolitan Transportation Authority was arrested and charged with failing to yield after his bus struck a 15-year-old girl on Friday, severely injuring her leg, officials said.

title: Standards Are at Stake in a Fight Over Schools in Arizona
description: PHOENIX  Diane M. Douglas, a Republican, was elected state schools superintendent in Arizona after vowing to repeal the Common Core, a set of reading and math standards intended to guide teachers from kindergarten through high school graduation.

title: Scott Walker Needs an Eraser
description: Lately, the big star in the race for the Republican presidential nomination has been Scott Walker, the governor of Wisconsin. He gave a rip-roaring speech at a conservative confab in Iowa last month, and its been his moment ever since.

title: A Suburban Bistro Born of an East Side Legend: P. J. Clarkes in Woodbury
description: Early on in James Salters recent novel All That Is, the hero, Philip Bowman, meets two women in an East Side Manhattan bar. I was thinking of going over to Clarkes, he tells them. He is, of course, referring to P. J. Clarkes, the 130-year-old saloon at Third Avenue and 55th Street. Bowman, recently back from the war in the Pacific and newly minted as an editor at a major publishing house, is meant to symbolize the romance and optimism of the Greatest Generation. That his preferred watering hole is P. J. Clarkes is testimony to the authors keen eye for detail. For a character like Bowman, there would be no other bar.

title: Assia Djebar, Novelist Who Wrote About Oppression of Arab Women, Dies at 78
description: PARIS  Assia Djebar, an Algerian-born writer and filmmaker whose widely admired work explored the plight of women in the male-centric Arab world, died here on Feb. 7. She was 78.

title: Ending Secrecy on Police Misconduct
description: The deaths of unarmed civilians like Eric Garner in New York City and Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., led to demands for greater transparency in the workings of police forces all over the country. The need for more openness is especially pressing in New York, where a uniquely strict disclosure law has shielded from public view the records of individual officers, even those who have committed crimes.

title: A Shoppers Guide to Asian Treasures
description: The best things in life may be free  if the lyrics from the 1927 musical Good News are to be believed  but few people can resist the siren song of shopping.

title: New Hotels in Asia for Surf and Sand
description: Whether your idea of going coastal involves surf spray intensity, paddleboard calm or some gently lapping middle ground, this new crop of Asian hotels and resorts celebrates the sea in a range of moods. Room styles vary too, from dwelling above coral heads to fronting an industrial wharf. (Dollars are accepted at these properties unless otherwise noted.)

title: Discovering Lodge Hospitality in New Zealand
description: As the co-founder, chairman and chief executive of the $30 billion investment firm Tiger Management L.L.C., Julian Robertson, 82, has achieved a high profile in the world of finance. His role as a luxury hotel proprietor, however, has been more under-the-radar.

title: County Coroner in Washington Plans Inquest Amid Furor Over Police Killing
description: The coroner in Franklin County, Wash., plans to order an inquest into the killing of a Mexican-born orchard laborer who, a cellphone video shows, was fleeing police officers and was then shot by them from what appeared to be no more than 20 feet away as he turned toward them with his hands held out in front.

title: A War on Workers in Illinois
description: As one of his first official acts, the new Republican governor of Illinois, Bruce Rauner, issued an executive order this week that would weaken state unions by barring them from assessing fees on some of the workers they represent in collective bargaining. Worse, the damage from the order could reach far beyond Illinois.

title: Basis for Case in Brooklyn Police Shooting: No Threat Led Officer to Fire
description: On the surface, the police shooting of an unarmed man in a housing project stairwell in Brooklyn seemed like a freakish accident.

title: An Uzbek Wave, Made for Wrestling
description: At least nine high schools in Brooklyn and one in Queens have Uzbek immigrants on their wrestling squads.

title: Former Army Sniper Pleads Guilty in Murder-for-Hire Conspiracy
description: A former Army sergeant with the nickname Rambo pleaded guilty on Friday to conspiring to murder a federal drug agent and another man, in what the government has said was his post-military role as a contract killer.

title: Sport Works to Stay Relevant in Changing N.C.A.A.
description: Michael Phelps is an outlier for reasons beyond his record haul of 22 Olympic medals. On the United States national team, he stands apart as one of the few swimmers not to use college as a stepladder to scale the world rankings. Of the 49 athletes who represented the United States in swimming at the London Olympics, only Phelps and the freestyler Chloe Sutton had pasts or futures, or both, not tied to N.C.A.A participation.

title: An Infamous Gap
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  I need to apologize to David Steinberg for saying in the past that the fill in his puzzles makes him seem older than his years.

title: Craft Beer in an Unlikely Location: At the DeCiccos Grocery Store in Armonk
description: On the steps leading to the second level of the DeCiccos grocery store in Armonk are these names:

title: The Double All-Nighter for Matisse
description: It made perfect sense: Henri Matisse did so much of his cutout art in the restless dead of night, why not view it in the exhibits unusual all-night visitation hours offered last weekend at the Museum of Modern Art?

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 13, 2015
Elevating the Ubiquitous
description: In Connecticut theres no better culinary success story than that of Dorjan Puka, a self-taught chef who immigrated from Albania at 23 after winning a green-card lottery, labored a dozen years in various restaurants, then opened two superb places of his own, Treva and  Vert Brasserie, in West Hartford. Now Mr. Puka has taken his act east of the river, with the Artisanal Burger Company, just off the highway in Manchesters Buckland Hills.

title: Dr. Marcys March
description: As January 1865 drew to a close, Lt. Gen. William T. Sherman readied his army, then camped around Savannah, Ga., to march north into South Carolina. Some 60,000 men strong, Shermans troops sensed the Confederacys flagging will. Four years of carnage had cost Southerners dearly, and Shermans campaign across Georgia had dealt the Confederacy a devastating blow. With the Army of Northern Virginia crouched in defensive positions around Richmond and Confederates scrambling to defend the Palmetto State, Shermans men prepared to push on, determined to bring the long and bloody war to an end.

title: High School Recruits Think Twice About Signing Letters of Intent
description: MONTEZUMA, Ga.  In a crowded gymnasium at Macon County High School on Feb. 4, Roquan Smith, one of the top high school linebackers in the country, picked up a U.C.L.A. hat and put it on his head, signaling his intention to play for the Bruins.

title: Braving the Freezing Temperatures for Love, Religion and Chocolate Sales
description: One hundred couples plan to get married on the 86th floor of the Empire State Building on Saturday. Outside.

title: Suspension Rules Altered in New York Citys Revision of School Discipline Code
description: Mayor Bill de Blasios administration on Friday announced changes to the discipline code that governs New York Citys public schools, an attempt to further rein in some of the most severe punishments while also keeping schools safe.

title: Canada: Attack Plot Is Foiled, Police Say
description: The police said Friday that they had disrupted a plot by four people to kill a large number of individual citizens in the Halifax area of Nova Scotia. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police and the Halifax police offered few specifics about the planned attack except to say that its two leaders also planned to commit suicide at the conclusion of their armed assault, which was scheduled for Saturday. Theres nothing in the investigation to classify it as a terrorist attack or terrorist incident, said Assistant Commissioner Brian F. Brennan, the commanding officer for the mounted police in Nova Scotia. He said the plotters were motivated by some beliefs, which he declined to identify. A 23-year-old woman from Geneva, Ill., was arrested at the Halifax airport along with a 20-year-old man from Nova Scotia. A 17-year-old man was arrested separately, and a fourth man, 19, was found dead in a house.

title: Suno: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Selling Cure for Being Gay Found Illegal in New Jersey
description: The plaintiffs described the methods used by the counseling group in Jersey City from which they had sought help: One of them, a young man hoping to overcome his attraction to other men, said he had been told to grab a tennis racket, scream and beat an effigy of his mother as if killing her.

title: De Blasio Chief of Staff to Leave City Hall for U.N. Job
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio is set to lose another senior member of his inner circle as his administration reorganizes for its second year.

title: At Vassar College, Canvases So Big They Are Seldom Seen
description: Back and forth, side to side  visitors to XL: Large-Scale Paintings From the Permanent Collection, at the Frances Lehman Loeb Art Center at Vassar College, may find themselves moving around while viewing each of the works on display. Thats because many of the paintings are so vast that it can be hard to grasp their entirety from a single vantage point.

title: When the Islanders Call, a Gritty Fourth-Line Wing Delivers
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  Missing Kyle Okposo on their top line and scuffling to manufacture goals, the Islanders continue to win with the grit and determination embodied by their fourth line of center Casey Cizikas and wings Matt Martin and Colin McDonald.

title: Nothing New Here: Anthony Endures Meaningless Loss
description: Robert Pera was among the first participants to arrive at Madison Square Garden on Friday night, and he wore the determined look of a welder.

title: In Huntington, an Exhibition of Pioneering Photography Through the Ages
description: Modern Alchemy, a small gem of an exhibition at the Heckscher Museum of Art in Huntington, is a good reminder that experimental photography did not begin in the age of the digital camera, although technology has certainly helped it evolve. A selection of diverse images, accompanied by thorough explanations of how various photographers worked, starting with Man Ray in the 1930s, supports this idea.

title: A Celebrity Facialists Recipe for Remedying Winter Skin
description: On the red carpet this weekend, the New York-based stars Julianne Moore and Maggie Gyllenhaal appeared untouched by winter as they arrived at the 2015 Golden Globe Awards. Their skin was radiant, almost dewy  not dry like most faces in Manhattan these days. And not coincidentally, they were each prepped for the evening by the celebrity facialist Joanna Vargas, who also counts Naomi Watts as a regular client. The expert, who just launched her newest anti-aging solution  the Forever Facial ($700), designed to improve the skins elasticity through the use of heat and radio waves (they push your collagen fibers back together again and trigger collagen production, she explains)  says the secret to great skin, no matter the time of year, is a facial once a month. Nothing you do at home can replace a professional exfoliation, extraction and attention, she says.

title: A Wedding Weekend and a Family Crisis
description: Every wedding weekend needs a family crisis, and the one in Danai Guriras Familiar is the arrival of an eccentric aunt from Zimbabwe with dollar signs in her eyes. But this play, having its world premiere at Yale Repertory Theater, already has other sources of tension: The bride is a 34-year-old virgin, and the groom, marrying into a Zimbabwean family, is white.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I had those normal jitters you have when you are going to say your vows. All of that was just crushed.

title: Corrections: February 14, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: A Game of Young Standouts Favors Dunks Over Defense
description: Andrew Wiggins was named the most valuable player after scoring 22 points for the World team in a 121-112 win over the United States team in the Rising Stars Challenge at Barclays Center on Friday night.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 4 P.M. (TBS) UN-VALENTINES DAY MARATHON Seven hours of disastrous dates, screwball romances and awkward moments come just in time for those looking to counter all the saccharine of Valentines Day. The marathon begins with four episodes of Friends, including the first date Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) had with Ross (David Schwimmer). In Seinfeld, beginning at 6 p.m., four episodes bring back some of Jerrys most memorable girlfriends  including Man Hands and the one whose name he cant remember. And major breakthroughs in science and love are the highlights of six episodes of The Big Bang Theory, beginning at 8 p.m.

title: When Jim Crow Got Cut From Spring Training
description: Here, in March 1947, Jackie Robinson, who was vying to become the first African-American in Major League Baseball in the modern era, obliges an autograph seeker during spring training in Havana.

title: Chinas Top Taxi-Hailing Apps Say They Will Merge
description: HONG KONG  If you cant beat them, join them.

title: From Feuding Friends, Lovers From Russia and Ukraine
description: Oksanas Yushkos personal contribution to the long history of love stories started because of Facebook.

title: Ferry Captain Is Convicted in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  The captain of a ferry that collided with another passenger vessel in 2012, leaving 39 people dead in Hong Kongs worst maritime accident in decades, was found guilty of manslaughter on Saturday.

title: What to Expect on the Third Day of New York Fashion Week
description: Happy Valentines Day, darling! I got you a full day of shows.

title: Ukraine Cease-Fire Goes Into Effect, but Rebel Leader in Key Town Repudiates Accord
description: ARTEMIVSK, Ukraine  A fragile, European-brokered cease-fire deal for Ukraine appeared at risk of unraveling, at least in part, when a rebel leader announced Saturday night that he would not be bound by the accord on a central battlefield of the war.

title: Polio Team Attacked in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Gunmen attacked a vehicle carrying a polio vaccination team in northwestern Pakistan on Saturday, killing the driver and wounding a health care worker, according to police officials.

title: New York Fashion Week: Suno Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: New York Fashion Week: Suno Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: After His Coup With Beyonc, Boots Strides Out of the Shadows
description: TWENTYNINE PALMS, CALIF.  Weve got to go now, said Jordan Asher, the musician who records as Boots, as his video crew rapidly packed up equipment. With the Mojave Desert as a backdrop, Boots was directing a mini-movie called Motorcycle Jesus wrapped around five of his new songs to be released on his website just eight days later on his 28th birthday, which was Friday.

title: Dasha Denisenko Transforms at Suno
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Dasha Denisenko before (left) and after (right) makeup by Alice Lane and hair by Odile Gilbert.

title: The Invention Mob, Brought to You by Quirky
description: As inventions go, Jake Ziens was a clever fix rather than an imaginative breakthrough: Irritation was the mother of his invention.

title: Turning Ideas Into Goods
description: Quirky, based in Manhattan, has become a laboratory for testing how far the crowd-based model of innovation and product development can go.

title: Naked Came The Class Warriors
description: Shaila Dewan, in the Upshot, notes that a number of Republican governors are proposing tax increases  but that in every case the tax hike would fall most heavily on those with lower incomes, and many are proposing simultaneous tax cuts for business and/or the wealthy.

title: Reformers Try to Tackle the Tax Machine
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas education proposal was intended to be the essence of policy elegance, simplifying a tangle of tuition aid programs and targeting assistance to families with the greatest need.

title: Feeling the Heat From a Property Manager
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Tips for Navigating a Changing Tax Landscape
description: Whats new this tax season? In a word: Obamacare. Thats the answer given by many tax professionals.

title: Better Software Lets You Kick Back and Do Your Taxes
description: Trying to do a tax return while lying on the couch, iPad balanced on my chest and a basketball game playing in the background, was admittedly distracting. My eyes kept drifting from the alternative minimum tax to the screen  which felt right, because I like the Los Angeles Lakers about as much as I like the I.R.S.

title: The Middle-Income Trap and the Alleged Price of Success
description: Ive read a couple of recent articles about what you might call peak Google  a nice piece by Farhad Manjoo, another via FT Alphaville  both of which argue, in effect, that Googles past success is turning it into a dinosaur. Manjoo:

title: Another Reason to Detest Tax Season
description: Our good friends at the Internal Revenue Service are offering a bit of sober advice as tax season comes around again. They say it is a very dangerous time of year.

title: To Win at the Tax Game, Know the Rules
description: To feel like a winner this tax-filing season, figure out how to give yourself a tax cut. After all, Washingtons gridlocked politicians may not provide much help.

title: Employee or Contractor? Health Care Law Raises Stakes
description: If you work for a living, do you know who your boss is? And if you run a business, do you know whos on your payroll?

title: Surviving the Perils of the Quest for Higher Yield
description: Throughout the last year, frustrated investors who have sought to increase their income through alternative investments have been warned about adding risk to their portfolios.

title: If You Owe Back Taxes, Try Making the I.R.S. an Offer
description: The Internal Revenue Service has made it easier  though by no means automatic  for delinquent taxpayers to cut the amount they owe on back taxes.

title: What Your Online Comments Say About You
description: When we comment on news stories, most of ushope to say something about the topic at hand  even (or maybe especially) if its that the author got it all wrong. But what do the comments we leave say about us  about our beliefs, our biases and how we act when the ordinary rules dont apply? And how do our comments affect the beliefs of others?

title: Variety: Spiral
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  First, Happy Valentines Day to all the Wordplayers!
