title: After the Housing Crisis, a Cash Flood and Silence
description: On Aug. 17, 2012, the federal government began expropriating all the earnings of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the mortgage finance giants that succumbed to the 2008 crisis.

title: Islamic State Sprouting Limbs Beyond Its Base
description: WASHINGTON  The Islamic State is expanding beyond its base in Syria and Iraq to establish militant affiliates in Afghanistan, Algeria, Egypt and Libya, American intelligence officials assert, raising the prospect of a new global war on terror.

title: The Coming Silly Season: Baseballs 2015 Calendar of the Absurd
description: Spring training camps open this week in Florida and Arizona, heralding the start of a baseball season sure to be full of surprises. Well have plenty of time for serious predictions  Could the Mets have more wins than the Yankees? Could the Giants win the title in an odd-numbered year?  but heres a look at a calendar of the absurd:

title: Freezy Freakies, a Colorful Blast From Winters Past
description: If youve heard of Freezy Freakies gloves, Hans and Karl Reichstetter know this about you: You were probably born in the 1970s or early 1980s and you probably spent your childhood in the Northeast.

title: A Preferred Guest Gets the Cold Shoulder
description: Why do so many corporations refuse to speak to the Haggler? Nearly all will communicate with him via email. But get on the phone and have a conversation? Apparently, this is an unnerving prospect, even to people whose job is spokesman or spokeswoman, which you may have noticed has the word spoke right in the title.

title: Perched in the Sky, Rihanna Toasts Fendi
description: Have you ever been this high before?

title: Bank Hackers Steal Millions via Malware
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  In late 2013, an A.T.M. in Kiev started dispensing cash at seemingly random times of day. No one had put in a card or touched a button. Cameras showed that the piles of money had been swept up by customers who appeared lucky to be there at the right moment.

title: His Eyes Fixed Straight Ahead, Tony Stewart Plans Resurgence After Two Trying Years
description: Eighteen months after badly breaking his right leg in a crash, Tony Stewart is still not fully healed. He has had four operations so far  the latest on Dec. 1 to replace a rod in the leg  and another is planned after this season. It will be the third straight Sprint Cup season in which Stewart is not physically 100 percent.

title: Let It Snow. Theres Work to Be Done.
description: Great news for employers: A blizzard is coming!

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 2
description: Fendi opens Madison Avenue store with Karl Lagerfeld, Rihanna, Sarah Jessica Parker and others

title: The Tyranny of the Forced Smile
description: I am a Libra of Libras, an inveterate balancer of opinions. My scales rarely tip to one side; my cons stack up against my pros. Count on me to discern the downside to upside, and the upside to down. If you want an unequivocal statement, Im not your fellow  at least not usually.

title: Anastasia Lagune Transforms at Dion Lee
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Anastasia Lagune before (left) and after (right) makeup by Val Garland and hair by Jon Pulitano.

title: The Ants, the Honeybees and Me
description: It began with a trail of little black ants marching across my kitchen counter in the middle of the night  marching, in fact, right under the half-screwed-on lid of one of my honey jars. This was honey Id harvested myself from hives I keep in my yard. How dare those ants!

title: Challenging the Comfort Zone
description: Nolan Kombol, 29, is a course designer and director of innovation for Tough Mudder, a 10- to 12-mile, military-style obstacle course. The courses are constructed in the United States and abroad for specific events, then dismantled. He is based at its Brooklyn headquarters.

title: New York Fashion Week: Dion Lee Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: New York Fashion Week: Dion Lee Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Catching or Throwing, Worthy of the N.F.L.
description: Nearly two weeks after he caught a game-winning touchdown pass to help the New England Patriots defeat the Seattle Seahawks, 28-24, in Super Bowl XLIX, wide receiver Julian Edelman was still buzzing. In addition to celebrating the Patriots fourth Super Bowl title at a victory parade and elsewhere, Edelman has been promoting

title: Searching for a Safe Deposit
description: The First Bank of Bud (Feb. 8) reported on the Fourth Corner Credit Union in Denver, created to serve the unmet banking needs of the marijuana industry. The credit union has a license from Colorado but has yet to receive approval for a Federal Reserve Bank account that it needs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Smith Shone On Court and Off

title: The Epidemic of Facelessness
description: A PART-TIME delivery driver named Peter Nunn was recently sentenced to 18 weeks in a British prison for tweeting and retweeting violent messages to Stella Creasy, a member of Parliament. He never saw his victim but the consequences of his virtual crime were real enough. In a statement, Ms. Creasy described fears for her physical safety, going so far as to install a panic button in her home. Mr. Nunn has been physically separated from the rest of society for posting abusive words on a social media site.

title: The Lies Heard Round the World
description: DURHAM, N.C.  LYING may be an age-old part of politics, but its becoming easier to spot the fibs, fictions and falsehoods. A growing army of fact-checkers around the world is busy debunking falsehoods from presidents, prime ministers and pundits  and if their results are indicative, 2014 was a banner year. Some of the claims were so absurd that fact-checking groups honored them with awards, like Australias Golden Zombie and Italys Insane Whopper of the Year.

title: Vitamins Hide the Low Quality of Our Food
description: THERE is much concern these days about whats in our dietary supplements. Are they actually filled with the ingredients that the labels promise?

title: Great! Another Thing to Hate About Ourselves
description: A FEW years ago I got a Groupon for laser hair removal.

title: The Smoking Toll Gets Much Worse
description: It seems impossible to believe that smoking is even more harmful to health than we had thought. Yet that is exactly what a large and authoritative study published last week has revealed.

title: Wildlife Slaughter Goes Unabated
description: As the worlds booming black market for body parts from endangered species continues to elude effective policing, rhinoceros deaths quadrupled in four years to the 1,215 killed by African smugglers in 2014. These magnificent animals were slaughtered so that urbanites in places like China and Vietnam can take a dose of powdered rhino horn, which fetches tens of thousands of dollars a pound as a luxury cure for hangovers.

title: What Libyas Unraveling Means
description: Largely overshadowed by the crises in Syria, Iraq and Ukraine, Libyas unraveling has received comparatively little attention over the past few months. As this oil-rich nation veers toward complete chaos, world leaders would be wise to redouble efforts led by the United Nations to broker a power-sharing deal among warring factions.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: David Merriam
description: David Merriam, a former California state trial judge and champion bull terrier breeder, is the Best in Show judge at this years Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show, which begins Monday.

title: Too Much Prayer in Politics
description: GOD had a busy week. Alabama alone was a heavy lift, what with all those God invocations by state leaders trying to cast out the demon of gay marriage, then London called as well. Scott Walker was on a trip there, and he tugged God into the picture when he was asked about evolution and declined to answer, as if embracing it would be a heathen outrage.

title: The Caligulan Thrill
description: IN a society where almost every cultural phenomenon ends up interpreted through an ideological lens, the success de scandale of Fifty Shades of Grey  the books, the movie, the branded cuffs and whips  has left culture warriors a little bit confused. Is this another transgressive breakthrough  the latest blow to whatever remains of traditional morality, the mainstreaming of a lifestyle long locked away from view? Or is the now-famous story, with its alpha male gazillionaire and his punished female prize, actually a reactionary fairy tale, encouraging submission to the latest version of the patriarchy?

title: Unpaid, Unarmed Lifesavers in Syria
description: WHO would have thought there could be an uplifting story from Syria?

title: Call Off the Dogs
description: WASHINGTON  ILL pay for this column.

title: What Were Watching: Sunday Shows
description: President Obama asked Congress for formal authorization to use military force against the Islamic State terrorist group this week, which lawmakers will debate in committee hearings this month. Senator Bob Corker, Republican of Tennessee and chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, will talk about the upcoming hearings on CBSs Face the Nation, along with Denis McDonough, the White House chief of staff.

title: Evolution From Modest Start to a Bonanza
description: Among the striking sights of last years N.B.A. All-Star Game  the dunks, the no-look passes and the general tomfoolery  was the final score.

title: Did a Text Kill My Brother?
description: ONE Wednesday afternoon in 2013, I received a frantic call. My older brother Bob had been in an accident. He had been babysitting for two of his granddaughters until just after lunch. Then, sensing it was one of the final bursts of summer, he put on his helmet, hopped on his 2007 Harley and headed down lazy back roads toward the New Jersey shore.

title: Gunman Believed to Be Behind 2 Copenhagen Attacks Is Fatally Shot, Police Say
description: LONDON  The Copenhagen police said on Sunday that they had shot and killed a man believed to be behind two attacks that killed two people, one at a cafe and one outside a synagogue.

title: A Curious Case of Writers Block
description: Dr. Yalom, I would like a consultation. Ive read your novel When Nietzsche Wept, and wonder if youd be willing to see a fellow writer with a writing block.

title: In Spanish Abuse Scandal, a More Open Vatican
description: GRANADA, Spain  David Ramrez Castillo first met his parish priest, the Rev. Romn Martnez, as a 7-year-old catechism student. Later, he became one of his altar boys. Step by step, Mr. Ramrez says, the priest convinced him that to deepen his faith he should spend more time with him and the other clergy members.

title: At North Carolina, Throwing Javelins and Running for Office
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  Time is precious for Houston Summers, a 27-year-old junior at North Carolina, and not just because he is majoring in psychology, with two minors, in the hopes of attending medical school. Summers, a former professional baseball player, is now a walk-on javelin thrower on the track team, and he is also trying to become the student body president.

title: Teaching the Needy
description: Readers react to an article about the decline in applicants for Teach for America.

title: In Louisiana, Desire for a French Renaissance
description: VILLE PLATTE, La.  Qui cest qui parle? Jim Soileau asked, his baritone filling the studio of radio station KVPI and traveling across the Cajun prairie.

title: After a Nap, Mikaela Shiffrin Plods, Then Bursts to a Slalom Repeat
description: BEAVER CREEK, Colo.  Early this winter, Mikaela Shiffrin was beaten three times at her best event, the slalom. The youngest Olympic champion in the history of the event, Shiffrin was not even making it to the podium.

title: Greeces Excess Burden
description: Whats the state of the Greek crisis? I have no idea, or at any rate no idea beyond what any diligent reader of press reports might glean. I do, however, have a pretty good idea of what Greece is asking for on the fiscal side, and it might be useful to talk about the arithmetic behind that position.

title: Roger Goodell Looks to the Future, but Troubles Cloud the View
description: During his address last month on the state of the league, N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell appeared eager to turn the page on 2014, a year when he was under siege for mishandling several domestic violence cases and for seemingly every other misstep that befell the league.

title: Koos van den Akker Dies at 75; Designed Bill Cosbys Vivid Sweaters
description: Koos van den Akker, a Dutch-born fashion designer with a celebrity clientele who was called the master of couture collage for his prismatic creations, notably the bold sweaters popularized by Bill Cosby on his long-running sitcom, died on Feb. 3 in Manhattan. He was 75.

title: Military and ISIS Clash Over Iraqi Town Near a Base Housing U.S. Troops
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi soldiers and militants of the Islamic State group clashed again over the weekend in a western Iraqi town that has changed hands several times in skirmishes near a military base where American troops are training Iraqi soldiers.

title: Experiencing the Alpine World Ski Championships From Above
description: BEAVER CREEK, Colo.  The first ski race I covered was the Olympic womens downhill in Meribel, France, in 1992, and I watched it from the finish area amid the cheers, the groans and the rubbing shoulders in the close-quarter mixed zone.

title: Tim Duncan Is a Five-Time Champion. Enough Said.
description: Tim Duncan did not sound overjoyed to be in New York for his 15th N.B.A. All-Star weekend, or maybe it was more the company he was forced to keep late Friday morning.

title: James L. Dolan, a Consummate 1 Percenter
description: N.B.A. Commissioner Adam Silver paused in preparations for the corporate branding orgy that is his leagues All-Star Game and tossed a spray of a bouquet at James L. Dolan, the owner of the Knicks.

title: Alexander Wangs Fall 2015 Collection at New York Fashion Week
description: [Watch the live stream.]

title: Mara Hoffmans Messy and Majestic Braids
description: T shares the best hairstyles from the runways.

title: From Diabelli, a Variety of Variations
description: Two adventurous smaller events, both on Tuesday, look especially intriguing this week. One explores the context of Beethovens Diabelli Variations, which he composed after the publisher Anton Diabelli sent a little waltz he had written to the leading composers of the Austrian empire, asking them each to write a variation, with the idea of publishing the entire set. Beethoven turned out a stand-alone colossus of a piece.

title: Fresh Cut Orchestra, a Jazz Band Thats Hard to Define
description: The Fresh Cut Orchestra is a new young 10-piece Philadelphia-jazz municipality, a little hard to define and very much worth looking into. Its a well-drilled band with three different leaders: the trumpeter Josh Lawrence, the bassist Jason Fraticelli and the drummer Anwar Marshall. (You might know them from records or bands led by Orrin Evans, Taylor McFerrin, Erykah Badu and Dave Douglas).

title: Films by Jessie Maple in Lincoln Center Series
description: The work of Jessie Maple, a filmmaker and the first African-American woman to join New Yorks camera operators union in 1975, will be celebrated on Monday with the program An Evening With Jessie Maple at the Elinor Bunin Munroe Film Center (144 West 65th Street). Ms. Maple, who wrote a book, How to Become a Union Camerawoman, about her life and hard-fought battle to join the union, directed two narrative features.

title: Havana Rakatan at City Center Offers a History of Cuba
description: City Center begins its three-week festival of Spanish and Latin American dance, A Bailar, with Havana Rakatan, a lively, rhythmically rich production that condenses 500 years of Cuban musical history into two hours. The show was bound for New York before the United States and Cuba renewed diplomatic ties, but that news should only bolster its feel-good spirit, as embodied by the exceptional dancers of Ballet Rakatan and the live music of the Cuban son band Turquino. Before Wednesdays performance, a panel of Cuban and Cuban-American artists  including Eduardo Vilaro, the artistic director of Ballet Hispanico  will discuss the countries shifting political and cultural relations.

title: Vikings on the History Channel Returns With a New King
description: The History channel remains a grab bag where you can find quirky reality shows like Down East Dickering, decent mini-series like last years Houdini, and assorted schedule-fillers about extraterrestrials and people who live in swamps. Amid this hodgepodge, Vikings, a scripted series that begins its third season on Thursday night, has emerged as an anchor.

title: Herve Leger By Max Azria: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Requests and Recommendations: Jeb Bushs Letters
description: During his fathers terms as vice president and president, Jeb Bush, then a businessman and emerging Florida politician, used his White House connections to make special requests and recommend allies for appointments.

title: As Dynastys Son, Jeb Bush Used His Connections Freely
description: The stream of requests to the White House from Jeb Bush, a young but well-connected Republican leader in South Florida, ranged from the weighty and urgent to the parochial and mundane.

title: Sexy, Cozy Fur Slippers at Tibi
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Christian Siriano: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Split Ends
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  How do you feel when your crossword answers go wandering off in different directions? Are you one of those solvers who likes their answers either Across or Down, but never the twain shall meet? Youre out of luck today, my friends.

title: Yale Restricts a Fraternity After Sexual Misconduct
description: A Yale fraternity has been banned from conducting on-campus activities until August 2016 as punishment for violating the universitys sexual misconduct policy at an initiation ceremony last year and then trying to impede the resulting investigation, the university announced this week.

title: New York Fashion Week: Alexander Wang Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: New York Fashion Week: Alexander Wang Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Autopsy Cites Cancer as Cause in Death of David Carr, Times Reporter
description: David Carr, the New York Times media columnist who died unexpectedly Thursday night, had lung cancer, and died of complications from the disease, according to the results of an autopsy released Saturday evening.

title: Heavy-Metal Hair and Makeup at Alexander Wang
description: What a dynamic duo the makeup artist Diane Kendal and the hairstylist Guido Palau made this evening at Alexander Wangs fall 2015 show. Inspired by heavy metal, they together created a beautifully gothic and gloomy look. Im keeping the skin very pale, with a dark brown and gray greasy feel on the eye, Kendal explained. With a clean brush, she dragged the eye makeup (Aigle Noir Velvet Shadow Stick, Transvaal Eye Paint, Bellissima Duo Eyeshadow and Vientiane Matte Multiple, all by Nars) downward, to create the effect of a hint of dark circle, as Kendal put it, around the models eyes.

title: India Blocked an Activist From Traveling to Britain
description: NEW DELHI  The Indian Ministry of Home Affairs has said it prevented a Greenpeace India activist from boarding a flight to Britain in January, where she was scheduled to brief members of Parliament on the effect of mining on indigenous communities in central India, because her visit was prejudicial to the national interest and would hurt Indias image abroad.

title: Threatened Smelt Touches Off Battles in Californias Endless Water Wars
description: RIO VISTA, Calif.  On a boat in the heart of Californias biggest river delta, a researcher pored over a sample of murky, weed-infested water, looking for a rare fish about the size of a finger. Spotting one, he shouted in triumph  then measured it and quickly tossed it overboard.

title: Sexual Abuse Allegations Against Imam Stir Rifts in Insular Illinois Community
description: ELGIN, Ill.  She ordinarily did not wear a veil. But it was required at the Islamic school where she worked, and she remembers being surprised when the head of the school, a conservative imam, suggested that she remove it.

title: A Community Mediator
description: Omer Mozaffar, an Islamic scholar in Chicago, acted as a mediator last year when a woman accused a prominent local imam, Mohammad Abdullah Saleem, of sexual assault.

title: Obama to Intervene in Dispute at West Coast Ports
description: LOS ANGELES  Seeking an end to a protracted labor dispute that has led to costly delays in West Coast shipping, President Obama has decided to intervene, the White House announced on Saturday.

title: Delhis Air Is Often More Polluted Than Beijings
description: The levels of harmful fine particulate matter, called PM2.5, are significantly higher in Delhi during the winter months than they are in Beijing.

title: Museum Rules: Talk Softly, and Carry No Selfie Stick
description: In a famous lab trial, a chimp named Sultan put two interlocking sticks together and pulled down an elusive prize, a bunch of bananas hanging just out of arms reach.

title: Delhi Wakes Up to an Air Pollution Problem It Cannot Ignore
description: NEW DELHI  For years, this sprawling city on the Yamuna River had the dirtiest air in the world, but few who lived here seemed conscious of the problem or worried about its consequences.

title: Alexander Wang: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Raw Eggs and No Husband Since 38 Keep Her Young at 115
description: VERBANIA, Italy  Celebrity came late to Emma Morano. Her routine life, in fact, might have raised barely an eyebrow were it not for the fact that shes managed to hold on to it for so long.

title: Dikembe Mutombo and John Calipari Are Among 12 Finalists for Basketball Hall of Fame
description: As famous for his wagging finger and charitable work as he was for his play on the court, Dikembe Mutombo, a four-time N.B.A. defensive player of the year, headlined a list of 12 finalists announced Saturday for induction into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame.

title: G.M. Expands 2014 Recall for Power Steering Failure
description: General Motors is recalling more than 81,000 cars because their power steering systems could suddenly fail, making the vehicles harder to turn. The action expands a recall from last March that covered 1.3 million vehicles in the United States.

title: Hundreds Protest Fatal Police Shooting in Washington
description: PASCO, Wash.  A protest held here Saturday over the police killing of a Mexican-born apple picker had the air of a mournful family picnic.

title: LaMarcus Aldridge Will Replace Anthony Davis in Wests Starting Lineup
description: After recently labeling himself a boring All-Star, LaMarcus Aldridge can add starter to that moniker. He replaces the injured Anthony Davis, who just happens to be one of the most exciting young players in the N.B.A.

title: At Millrose Games, Bernard Lagat Sets a Mark for 40-Year-Olds
description: Bernard Lagat, in his return to the event he has owned for more than a decade, did not disappoint the local fans jammed into the 168th Street Armorys New Balance Track & Field Center in Manhattan on Saturday.

title: Altuzarra: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Adam Silver Lays Out Goals, Focusing on Player Health and Draft Lottery
description: With his first year as the N.B.A.s commissioner largely defined by how he dealt with off-the-court controversy, Adam Silver said in a news conference Saturday that he wanted the focus of his second year to be on basketball.

title: Billy Reid: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

description: Jeb, we all sensed, had a strong interest in a political future of his own. We listened to him.

title: The Post-Trend Universe
description: In a world where fashion moves Instagram-fast, the look of the season is a thing of the past. And thats a cause for rejoicing.

title: Gun Attacks Leave Copenhagen on Edge
description: A gunman sprayed bullets into a cafe where a cartoonist who had caricatured the prophet Muhammad was speaking, followed hours later by a shooting near the citys main synagogue.

title: Facing the N.B.A.s Best 3-Point Shooters, Stephen Curry Finishes First
description: In one of the best groupings of shooters to ever participate in the N.B.A.s 3-point contest, Stephen Curry of the Golden State Warriors cruised to victory Saturday, at one point hitting 13 consecutive shots, much to the delight of a Brooklyn crowd that seemed to be rooting for him from the start.

title: Allison Polland, Adam Roth
description: Dr. Allison Rachel Polland, a daughter of Diane L. Polland and Elliot R. Polland of Kings Point, N.Y., is to be married Sunday to Adam Joseph Roth, the son of Anne W. Roth and Dr. Stuart M. Roth of Columbia, Md. Cantor Daniel Neiden is to officiate at the home of the brides parents.

title: Anthony Hird and Reed Caldwell
description: Anthony Raymond Hird and Dr. John Reed Caldwell are to affirm their partnership Sunday with a commitment ceremony at Las Caletas Hideaway Beach in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico. Andrew A. Hopping, a Universal Life minister and a friend of the couple, is to lead the event.

title: Irene Jefferson, Jake Sherman
description: Irene Beren Jefferson and Jake Sherman are to be married Sunday at the Ritz-Carlton in Washington. Rabbi David J. Saiger, the brides brother-in-law, is to officiate.

title: Khadija Ali and Fritz Charles
description: Khadija Hinda Ali and Fritz Emmanuel Charles were married Monday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Alisa Fuentes, a staff member in the City Clerks office, officiated.

title: Maya Hartman,  Michael Fieldstone
description: Dr. Maya Elise Hartman and Michael Benjamin Fieldstone are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Marc Philippe at the St. Regis Bal Harbour Resort in Bal Harbour, Fla.

title: Heather Hume and Jonathan Zagzag
description: Dr. Heather Emma April Hume and Dr. Jonathan Zagzag are to be married Sunday at the Metropolitan Building, an event space in Long Island City, Queens. Rabbi Laurence A. Sebert is to officiate.

title: Elisabeth Kruger and Devin Thomas
description: Elisabeth Claire Kruger, a daughter of Joy V. Asche of Old Greenwich, Conn., and Thomas E. Kruger of Stamford, Conn., was married in New York Saturday to Devin John Thomas, the son of Marguerite S. Thomas and Dr. John E. Thomas of Gainesville, Fla. The Rev. Glenn Woertz, an interfaith minister affiliated with the Alpine Community Church in Alpine, N.J., officiated at the New York Yacht Club.

title: Roselvin Sanchez and Sagiv Edelman
description: Roselvin Sanchez and Sagiv Yaacov Edelman are to be married Sunday evening at the Coral Gables Country Club in Coral Gables, Fla. Edgar M. Sanchez, a brother of the bride who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate.

title: Devi Nampiaparampil and Hormis Thaliath
description: Dr. Devi Elizabeth Nampiaparampil and Hormis Antony Thaliath were married Saturday at the Church of St. Paul the Apostle in Manhattan. The Rev. Thomas Holahan, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Erin Sobel,  Alexander Gitlin
description: Erin Heather Sobel and Alexander David Gitlin are to be married Sunday at the Cypress Grove Estate House, an event space in Orlando, Fla. Cantor Beth Schafer will officiate.

title: Patrick Beverley Wins N.B.A.s Overhauled Skills Competition
description: In an N.B.A. take on Aesops The Tortoise and the Hare, Patrick Beverley of the Houston Rockets proved that patience can triumph over speed as he lumbered his way to victory Saturday in the N.B.A.s revamped skills competition.

title: Kelly Linehan,  Noah Solomon
description: Kelly Elizabeth Linehan and Noah Emmanuel Solomon were married Saturday at St. Jude Parish in Waltham, Mass. The Rev. Stephen J. Linehan, a Roman Catholic priest and an uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: Mary Ellen Hammond, Andrew Mondi
description: Mary Ellen Webster Hammond and Andrew Richard Mondi were married Saturday at Memorial Church at Harvard University in Cambridge, Mass. The Rev. George Salzmann, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Zach LaVine, With Nod to Michael Jordan, Soars to Victory in Slam Dunk Contest
description: Showing off an ability to seemingly jump out of the building, Zach LaVine of the Minnesota Timberwolves lapped the competition Saturday night on his way to winning the N.B.A. slam dunk contest at Barclays Center in Brooklyn.

title: Rachel Grunberger,  Evan Tyroler
description: Rachel Cohen Grunberger and Evan Kraig Tyroler are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Lyle A. Fishman at Bnai Israel Congregation in Rockville, Md.

title: A Couple Finds Their Bearings
description: Katherine Ann Bradley and Eric William Waldo were married Saturday evening at the InterContinental San Juan, a hotel in Puerto Rico. The Rev. Aran Santana, a minister of the Missionary Churches of Christ, led a ceremony that included Catholic and Jewish wedding traditions. Colin J. Callahan, a friend of the couple, took part.

title: A New Cruise to Cuba
description: Under newly relaxed regulations governing travel to Cuba, Cuba Cruise is offering Americans seven-night trips that circumnavigate the island.

title: Resi Stiegler Struggles With Injuries and the Fight Within
description: BEAVER CREEK, Colo.  Up on the slalom course on Saturday afternoon, Mikaela Shiffrin was staring down the moment on home snow and winning her latest gold medal.

title: Vows | Pushing Each Other to Succeed
description: Despite being set up without their knowledge, Dr. Devi Nampiaparampil and Hormis Thaliath discovered love through a shared project.

title: Rail Strike May Disrupt Industries Across North America
description: OTTAWA  About 3,000 locomotive engineers and conductors at the Canadian Pacific Railway walked off the job Sunday morning in a dispute over wages and benefits.

title: Corrections: February 15, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Terror Attacks by a Native Son Rock Denmark
description: COPENHAGEN  After killing a Danish film director in a Saturday afternoon attack on a Copenhagen cafe and then a Jewish night guard at a synagogue, the 22-year-old gunman responsible for Denmarks worst burst of terrorism in decades unleashed a final fusillade outside a four-story apartment building before dawn on Sunday.

title: Slice and Carve: The Next Wave in Computer-Aided Creativity
description: SEATTLE  The desk space next to PCs first welcomed paper printers and later made room for three-dimensional printers that could conjure any shape from spools of plastic.

title: Review: Paul McCartney Offers an Intimate Valentines Day Gift
description: A holiday, a song title and a free night before a TV appearance were pretext enough for Paul McCartney to book a sudden show on Saturday night at Irving Plaza; its capacity, about 1,000, is an order of magnitude smaller than the arenas he usually headlines. The audience, he said joshingly, was so close you can see my dental work. On Sunday, Mr. McCartney was scheduled to perform on Saturday Night Lives 40th-anniversary prime-time special. But Saturday was also Valentines Day, and Mr. McCartney announced, Tonight its all about love.

title: 1915: Amputation Scheduled for Sarah Bernhardt
description: In connection with the postponement of the operation which Mme. Sarah Bernhardt was to have undergone Sunday [Feb. 14], it is now announced that its a question of amputating her right leg, and the delay is occasioned because of a decision to carry out a preparatory treatment lasting about ten days. Mme. Bernhardt was lately taken from Arcachon to a private hospital in Bordeaux, where the operation was to have taken place on Sunday, but after a consultation, a postponement was thought advisable.

title: Weimar and Greece, Continued
description: Try to talk about macroeconomics, and youre sure to encounter accusations that your policies would turn us into Weimar Germany; those wheelbarrows full of cash remain the ultimate bogeymen for many, despite years of being wrong about everything. As some of us have noted, however, theres a peculiar selectivity in the use of Weimar as cautionary tale: its always about the hyperinflation of 1923, never about the deflationary effects of the gold standard and austerity in 1930-32, which is, you know, what brought you-know-who to power.

title: Marvin David Levy, Composer Who Rose, Fell and Rose Again, Dies at 82
description: It was only after he entered Dantes Inferno  his name for the series of federal penitentiaries that became his home for two years  that the composer Marvin David Levy marshaled the resolve to write the kind of music he had always wanted.

title: Taxi by Jafar Panahi Takes Top Prize at Berlin Film Festival
description: Taxi, in which the Iranian director Jafar Panahi mounted a dashboard camera in a yellow cab and drove it around Tehran, took the top prize, the Golden Bear, at the 65th Annual Berlin Film Festival on Saturday. Mr. Panahis young niece, who appears in the film and steals the show with her luminous curiosity, accepted the award on her uncles behalf.

title: Philip Levine, a Poet of Grit, Sweat and Labor, Dies at 87
description: Philip Levine, a former United States poet laureate whose work was vibrantly, angrily and often painfully alive with the sound, smell and sinew of heavy manual labor, died on Saturday morning at his home in Fresno, Calif. He was 87.

title: Once Behind the Scenes, a Police Union Official Works to Topple His Boss

But the officers stayed put on that slushy sidewalk in the Bellerose section of Queens last week, their attention fixed on the big man in pinstripes, the insurgent in the ranks.

title: Whats On TV Sunday

Also included in the episode will be a report on the French neighborhood and prison that gave rise to the terrorists who attacked the Charlie Hebdo offices in Paris last month; and Steve Kroft interviews Bradley Cooper about his role in the Oscar-nominated movie American Sniper.

title: Derek Lams Simple, Pretty 70s-Inspired Ponytail
description: Inspired by a pair of bell-bottom trousers from Derek Lams fall 2015 collection, the hairstylist Orlando Pita mimicked the wide shape in a textured ponytail. To get the look, Pita blow-dried the hair using, depending on the density of the models tresses, either Phytos Phytovolume Actif or Phytos Intense Volume mousse for texture. He kept the top portion slick and tidy, with an off-center, controlled part, and pulled the rest back into a ponytail at the nape of the neck, finishing the look with Phyto Phytolaque Soie hairspray. And, for a little extra interest: We have this accessory in the hair, in the ponytail, which women would use in the 70s when I went to high school, Pita said. We made a streamlined New York version for today.

title: 1940: Spy Plot, Including a Beautiful Blonde, Revealed
description: For the first time in five-and-one-half months of war, romantic Frenchmen were given the details yesterday [Feb. 15] of an espionage affair which conforms to all the traditional demands of fiction: an allegedly faithless government employee, a beautiful blonde and a number of enemy spies. What made the case more interesting was the fact that it occurred before war broke out and not until yesterday was it revealed that a certain Baroness von Einem was supposedly the ringleader of the gang. All Paris was surprised to learn of the implication of the beautiful young Baroness von Einem and of Gaston Amourelle, a stenographer in the French Senate.

title: Review: In Green on Blue, an Afghan Boy Narrates Story of War
description: This haunting debut novel by Elliot Ackerman  a decorated veteran who served five tours of duty in Afghanistan and Iraq  is told not from the point of view of an American soldier, but in the voice of an Afghan orphan named Aziz who is forced to join a United States-funded Afghan militia called the Special Lashkar after his beloved older brother Ali is gravely wounded. Green on Blue is a novel that conveys, with harrowing power, the fallout that decades of war (going back through the Soviet occupation of the 1980s) has had on that countrys people, and at the same time, its a kind of Greek tragedy about the cycles of revenge and violence that can consume families and tribes, generation after generation.

title: Review: Original Leads Return in City Ballets Romeo + Juliet
description: It was 2007 when Peter Martins unveiled his Romeo + Juliet. At the time, the New York City Ballet production  which began a run of nine performances on Friday at the David H. Koch Theater  had one thing going for it: Mr. Martinss decision to cast his leads, particularly Juliet, young. (His Romeos required more experience and strength for partnering.) He worked with students at the City Ballet-affiliated School of American Ballet, including the now-esteemed soloist Russell Janzen, but eventually settled on two fresh company members for the premiere: Robert Fairchild and Sterling Hyltin.

title: Review: Summation Dance, in a Kaleidoscope Repeatedly Snapping Into Focus
description: In 2010, when Sumi Clements and Taryn Vander Hoop founded Summation Dance Company, they were just about to graduate from the Tisch School of the Arts at New York University. Five years later, their all-female ensemble still looks young, and the choreography by Ms. Clements retains the feel of high-level student work, adeptly constructed but emotionally and artistically immature.

title: This Weeks Mens College Basketball Games to Watch
description: 8 Kansas at 21 West Virginia

title: Review: Danish National Symphony Orchestra Honors Sibelius and Nielsen at Carnegie Hall
description: As anniversaries go, a sesquicentennial may lack the obvious punch of a centennial or bicentennial. (Dont bother to look it up; a sesquicentennial is a 150th anniversary.) But the classical-music world will take any anniversary it can get.

title: Imprint on a Dirt Road
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  On the face of it, this looks like an ordinary crossword puzzle, which is what you would expect, especially on a Monday. But then you would remember that its Washingtons birthday, or Presidents Day, or whatever theyre calling it these days, and you would probably say, Hey! Where my presidents at?

title: Writers Guild Chooses Top Screenplays of 2014
description: The Grand Budapest Hotel and The Imitation Game were named best original and adapted screenplay, respectively, at the Writers Guild of America Awards, given out Saturday in Los Angeles and New York. The script for The Grand Budapest Hotel, a comedic caper about a charismatic concierge and a young bellboy at a popular 1930s European ski resort, was written by Wes Anderson. The Imitation Game was written by Graham Moore and based on Andrew Hodgess book about the British code-breaker Alan Turing. Other winners included Brian Knappenbergers The Internets Own Boy: The Story of Aaron Swartz, about a computer programming prodigy and information activist, for best documentary screenplay; Nic Pizzolattos True Detective, the HBO mini-series that revisits a 1995 murder case in rural Louisiana 17 years later, for best drama series and best new series; and Louie, a fictionalized series starring the comedian Louis CK, for best comedy series (written by Louis CK and Pamela Adlon) and best episodic comedy.

title: Auction May Reveal Secrets of American Pie
description: Decades of speculation about the meaning behind of one of the 20th centurys most renowned and enigmatic songs could finally end when the notes and manuscripts of Don McLeans American Pie go up for sale this spring  that is, of course, if the highest bidder chooses to publicly share what insights they may hold. The auction house Christies announced last week that the original working manuscript and typed drafts to the song  16 pages total  would be auctioned on April 7 in New York. Mr. McLean, 69, told Reuters he decided to sell the documents on a whim. Other than admitting that a line in the song, the day the music died, refers to the Feb. 3, 1959, deaths of Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens and J. P. Richardson, known as the Big Bopper, Mr. McLean has been mostly vague about the meaning of other parts of the song. He told Reuters that the writing and lyrics will divulge everything there is to divulge. American Pie was released in 1971. The manuscript is estimated to fetch between $1 million and $1.5 million.

title: Picking Through the Racks of Fashion Week
Mission Not Yet Accomplished
description: President Obama has announced that almost all of the American troops sent to West Africa to help contain the Ebola epidemic will be withdrawn soon. That makes sense because they have largely completed the work they were sent to do. The next phase of the battle will rely on public health measures carried out by local and international health workers and experts.

description: Three days into New York Fashion Week, and it was starting to feel as if we had taken a wrong turn on the way to the catwalks and ended up on the basketball court at Madison Square Garden instead. title: David Carrs Last Word on Journalism, Aimed at Students
description: David Carr was known at The New York Times as a supreme talent scout, a mentor to young reporters and a blunt critic of those who didnt measure up. He was a natural teacher, and right up until the day he died last week, he was bent on minting the next generation of journalists. Last fall, David joined the faculty at Boston Universitys communications school. While David did not write his curriculum as a column, it has all the essential ingredients of one. So here it serves as the final Media Equation under Davids byline.

title: Sunni Lawmakers to Boycott Iraqi Parliament Over Shiite Militias
description: BAGHDAD  After the abduction and murder of a Sunni tribal leader last week, Sunni lawmakers, in an effort to pressure the government of Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi to curb the growing influence of Shiite militias, said Sunday that they would boycott sessions of Parliament. The boycott of Parliament was supposed to last a week, lawmakers said.

description: TOKYO  Japan emerged from recession at the end of 2014, government data showed on Monday, though the economic growth  the countrys first since early last year  was weaker than experts had forecast.

title: Dangers, Frustrations and Snow Keep Piling Up in New England
description: BOSTON  Leaden skies tested the patience and sanity of winter-weary New Englanders once again over the weekend, unleashing more than two feet of new snow on parts of the region. It was the latest installment in a relentless string of storms that have blended, one into the next, enveloping every car and every home so that nothing has a distinct shape anymore; the landscape is just one seamless blanket of white.

description: A look back at the 2015 Alpine world championships in Beaver Creek, Colo., where the United States won five medals on its home snow.

title: Snow Buries Boston Again
description: A storm on Sunday put the city near its record for accumulation, and economic damage piled up, too.

title: An All-Natural Beauty Site With a Cult Following Opens Up Shop
description: Its barely a year old, but the wellness web store CAP Beauty has already gained a cult following among the celebrity set, including Helena Christensen and Brooke Shields, for its all-things-natural approach. And this weekend, the brand opened its first brick-and-mortar boutique-spa hybrid in New Yorks West Village. The available means of discovery in New York has really been limited, says the cofounder Kerrilynn Pamer, who teamed up with her friend Cindy DiPrima Morisse to launch the shopping platform last May. Theres a health food store, a grocery store, and bits and pieces of different brands in different outlets  but if you wanted to take on a clean beauty routine, that experience of going to one place to smell perfume and try eye cream, all while feeling safe, has been missing.

title: Senate Democrats Lobby for a Reprieve for Some Who Failed to Get Insurance
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats urged President Obama on Sunday to allow extra time for some people to sign up for health insurance as hundreds of thousands of Americans raced to beat the enrollment deadline.

title: No Corrections: February 16, 2015
description: The Times welcomes comments and suggestions, or complaints about errors that warrant correction. Messages on news coverage can be e-mailed to nytnews@nytimes.com or left toll-free at 1-888-NYT-NEWS (1-888-698-6397). Comments on editorials may be e-mailed to letters@nytimes.com or faxed to (212) 556-3622.

title: Yankees Set to RetireAndy Pettittes Jersey
description: The Yankees are set to retire Andy Pettittes No. 46 jersey and honor him with a plaque in Yankee Stadiums Monument Park in a ceremony on Aug. 23. Pettittes son Josh, a pitcher at Rice University, broke the news on his Twitter account that the Yankees would honor his father.

title: Whats On Monday
description: 10 P.M. (13) INDEPENDENT LENS Thomas Allen Harriss documentary Through a Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People tells the story of the men and women who have captured African-American culture over the past 170 years, including Carrie Mae Weems, Lorna Simpson, Anthony Barboza, Lyle Ashton Harris, Hank Willis Thomas (Crossroads, above), Coco Fusco and Clarissa Sligh. A. O. Scott, writing in The New York Times, called the movie a family memoir, a tribute to unsung artists and a lyrical, at times heartbroken, meditation on imagery and identity. He added, The film is always absorbing to watch, but only once its over do you begin to grasp the extent of its ambitions, and just how much it has done within a packed, compact hour and a half.

title: In N.B.A. All-Star Game, Pizazz Returns to Garden, and West Stars Shoot Their Way to a Win
description: In a spectacle of lights, music, fancy sneakers and flamboyant athleticism, the N.B.A. on Sunday night presented what should be, barring a dramatic turn of events, the final notable professional basketball game to be played at Madison Square Garden this season.

title: N.B.A. All Star Game
description: The 64th N.B.A. All-Star Game, played at Madison Square Garden, was a typically high-scoring affair,, with celebrities not only on the court, but also in the stands.

title: Russell Westbrook, Tight-Lipped Before Game, Makes a Statement as the M.V.P.
description: Russell Westbrook was one of the least enthusiastic players at the N.B.A.s media day on Friday. Sitting on a podium and continually checking his phone, he gave one-word answers and seemed as if he would rather have been anywhere else.

title: New York Fashion Week: Prabal Gurung Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: New York Fashion Week: Prabal Gurung Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Egypt Launches Airstrike in Libya Against ISIS Branch
description: CAIRO  Egypt conducted an airstrike against an Islamist stronghold in Libya on Monday in retaliation for the beheading of at least a dozen Egyptian Christians by a local franchise of the Islamic State, in Cairos deepest reach yet into the chaos that has engulfed its neighbor.

title: Women in Saudi Arabia
description: To the Editor:

title: Bias in the Workplace

description: To the Editor:

title: Save the Wisconsin Idea
description: MILWAUKEE  EARLIER this month, Scott Walker, the governor of Wisconsin and potential Republican presidential candidate, unveiled a proposed budget that would cut $300 million of funds to the University of Wisconsin system and shift power over tuition from the Legislature to a new public authority controlled by appointed regents. The initial draft of Mr. Walkers budget bill also proposed to rewrite the universitys 110-year-old mission statement, known as the Wisconsin Idea, deleting the search for truth and replacing it with language about meeting the states work-force needs.

title: Weimar on the Aegean
description: Try to talk about the policies we need in a depressed world economy, and someone is sure to counter with the specter of Weimar Germany, supposedly an object lesson in the dangers of budget deficits and monetary expansion. But the history of Germany after World War I is almost always cited in a curiously selective way. We hear endlessly about the hyperinflation of 1923, when people carted around wheelbarrows full of cash, but we never hear about the much more relevant deflation of the early 1930s, as the government of Chancellor Brning  having learned the wrong lessons  tried to defend Germanys peg to gold with tight money and harsh austerity.

title: How to Force Prosecutors to Play Fair
description: When prosecutors cheat and lie repeatedly to win convictions, should their office be held accountable?

title: George Washington, Slave Catcher
description: AMID the car and mattress sales that serve as markers for Presidents Day, Black History Month reminds Americans to focus on our common history. In 1926, the African-American historian Carter G. Woodson introduced Negro History Week as a commemoration built around the birthdays of Abraham Lincoln and Frederick Douglass. Now February serves as a point of collision between presidential celebration and marginalized black history.

title: The Health Law, in the Real World
Goodbye to the Electronics Store
description: I was assembling a home audio system recently and needed speaker wires. A friend recommended RadioShack. I went to two  in Manhattan and in Brooklyn  but, to my surprise, neither carried any. How could RadioShack, the place Americans go to for cables, connectors, circuits and all kinds of other electronic doodads, not have speaker wires?

title: A Kaffeeklatsch on Race
description: In our collective imaginations, we tend to conceive of the constantly called-for national conversation on race as having the formality of some grand conclave of consciousness  an American Truth and Reconciliation equivalent, a spiritual spectacle in which sins are confessed and blame taken and burdens lifted.

title: Nigerias Miserable Choices
description: The Nigerian government was supposed to hold presidential elections this past weekend, which presented voters with the dispiriting choice of keeping a lousy incumbent or returning to power a former autocratic leader. Now they will have to wait at least six weeks to cast votes.

title: What Alabamas Roy Moore Got Right
description: Roy Moore, the chief justice of the Alabama Supreme Court, escalated the conflict over same-sex marriage last week, when he ordered probate judges in the state not to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, even after a federal judge struck down Alabamas ban on the practice. In a recent radio interview, Moore said that he would continue to resist federal intervention: Theres nothing in the U.S. Constitution that authorizes the Supreme Court of the United States or any federal court anywhere to misinterpret the word marriage to include something outside that. The government, he added, does not have the power to redefine marriage.

title: Hong Kong Ferry Captain Sentenced to 8 Years in Prison for Deadly Collision
description: HONG KONG  The captain of a ferry involved in Hong Kongs deadliest maritime accident in more than four decades was sentenced on Monday to eight years in prison after being found guilty of 39 counts of manslaughter.

title: Happy Presidents Day
description: Were taking the day off on this national holiday  but well be back with most of our regular content, including the Weekly News Quiz, on Feb. 17.

title: Deutsche Wohnen Offers to Buy Austrian Real Estate Rival
description: LONDON  The German real estate company Deutsche Wohnen is planning a takeover bid for its Austrian rival Conwert Immobilien Invest that values the company at 1 billion euros, or about $1.1 billion.

title: Recording Music, With a Camera
description: As with any scrappy aspiring rock band, when Mother Falcon goes on tour, its members endure the hardships of the road  sleeping in the van, hauling instruments, recouping after canceled shows, eating cheaply, quickly, and imprudently, and taming the tensions that flare up in close quarters among musicians.

title: British Gambling Website 888 Holdings Ends Takeover Talks
description: LONDON  The British online gambling company 888 Holdings said on Monday that it had ended takeover discussions with its larger competitor, William Hill.

title: Aid to Needy Often Excludes the Poorest in America
description: The safety net helped keep Camille Saunders from falling, but not Charles Constance.

title: Astro Teller, Googles Captain of Moonshots, on Making Profits at Google X
description: Google is all over the place. From biotechnology and robots to satellites and space exploration, the company has dipped into a dizzying and often confusing range of projects, especially when you consider that the core business is to sell advertising.

title: Islam and the West at War
description: After a Danish movie director at a seminar on Art, Blasphemy and Freedom of Expression and a Danish Jew guarding a synagogue were shot dead in Copenhagen, Helle Thorning-Schmidt, the prime minister of Denmark, uttered a familiar trope:

title: What to Expect on the Fifth Day of New York Fashion Week
description: Its a race to the starting line this frigid Monday morning, and anyone hoping to make a clean sweep of the days events will have to be up by cocks-crow, or just about.

title: When Grief Wont Relent
description: Bereavement  how one responds and adjusts to the death of a loved one  is a very individual matter. It is natural to experience a host of negative reactions in the weeks and months following the loss of a loved one: among them, sadness, difficulty sleeping, painful reminders of the person, difficulty enjoying activities once shared, even anger.

title: Anger of Suspect in Danish Killings Is Seen as Only Loosely Tied to Islam
description: COPENHAGEN  When Aydin Soei, a sociologist in Denmark, met members of an inner-city gang in 2008, one teenage tough stood out as more intelligent than his peers, and more mercurial. He showed little interest in Islam, but a deep loathing for Denmark, the country where he was born and spent his entire life.

title: Matthew Lightner Will Leave Atera
description: Matthew Lightner, the well-traveled chef whose tasting menu at the tiny TriBeCa restaurant Atera has won huge acclaim, will leave there after March 28 to embark on a new project.

title: Veteran Communist Leader Is Shot in India
description: NEW DELHI  A veteran Communist leader and critic of right-wing groups was shot along with his wife in central India on Monday morning as they were out for a stroll, the police said.

title: SNS Reaal Agrees to Sell Dutch Insurance Arm to Anbang of China
description: LONDON  SNS Reaal, a state-owned Dutch financial services company, said on Monday that it had agreed to sell its Vivat Verzekeringen insurance arm to a unit of Anbang Insurance Group of China.

title: Fatal Accidents as a Global Health Crisis
description: Worried about what to worry about? Accidents should move higher up your list.

title: Restaurant Critic Pete Wells on How He Does His Job
description: Pete Wells has been restaurant critic for The New York Times since January 2012. As restaurant critic, he says that he has probably eaten close to 800 meals. (And he says, miraculously, he hasnt gained weight.) Here he gives Insiders a sense of how he does the job.

title: Daily Report: Two Start-Ups Offer Calls Via Wi-Fi First
description: It would not be an insult to say Republic Wireless and FreedomPop are obscure little companies. But they dream big, Brian Chen reports.The two companies are at the forefront of a tantalizing wireless communications concept that has proved hard to produce on a big scale: Reduce cellphone costs by relying on strategically placed Wi-Fi routers. And when there are no routers available, fall back on the traditional cellular network. Read more

title: Good Odds But Odd Goods
description: This paper using a dynamic search model to explain why most single people are crazy is brilliant  and I dont just say that because it starts with homage to a classic forerunner.

title: Bard SummerScape to Feature Work of the Composer Carlos Chvez
description: The music of Carlos Chvez, a key 20th-century Mexican composer whose works blended modern, folk and pre-Columbian influences, will be explored this summer at the Bard SummerScape Festival in Annandale-on-Hudson, N.Y., the festival announced Monday.

title: 1940: Women Called to New Fight
description: NEW YORK  A call to leaders of American women to meet in New York next fall for a Womans Centennial Congress to make plans for a campaign to extend feminine rights during the next century was issued today [Feb. 16] by Mrs. Carrie Chapman Catt, president of the National American Womans Suffrage Association. Mrs. Catt announced that the congress was also intended to commemorate the almost unbelievable changes that have taken place in the status of women in the last 100 years. She said the fight for womens rights had been so successful in this period that it might well be called the Womens Century.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 17, 1940

title: New York Diversifies
description: One thing I learned from Ed Glaesers fine work on the economy of New York was that the city, after a complex past, had become essentially a monoculture. That is, its export sector  the part of the economy that sells to other locations, as opposed to providing local, nontraded goods and services  was basically finance and nothing else.

title: Imitation Game, Grand Budapest Hotel and Decorum Win Over Writers Guild
description: Stories of freewheeling Writers Guild Awards ceremonies of yore was one of the reasons the Bagger traveled to the tourist-chocked confines of Midtown Manhattan on a frigid Saturday night. The event isnt broadcast, booze freely flows, and writers supposedly can be a devilish bunch. Antics of years past included a tipsy Patton Oswalt letting rip and a sloshed Jonathan Ames railing against the cancellation of his HBO show Bored to Death.

title: 1965: Anti-U.S. Rally in Indonesia
description: DJAKARTA  About 5,000 high school students, including President Sukarnos daughter Rachmawati, 15, staged an anti-American demonstration today [Feb. 16] in Djakarta streets. The students paraded after attending a rally at the hall of the Communist-inspired Youth Front Organization, where they burned effigies personifying Americans and Prime Minister Tengku Abdul Rahman of Malaysia. The rally and demonstration were sponsored by the Communists. The demonstrators did not attempt to go near the U.S. embassy. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 17, 1965

title: In Hospitals, Board Rooms Are as Important as Operating Rooms
description: If you or a loved one is having a heart attack, your most pressing concerns probably include how quickly you can get to the hospital and the quality of care youll receive. Youre probably not thinking about the hospitals board room, even though quality of care for heart attacks and many other conditions may be determined in large part by decisions made there.

title: Research Finds a Reason Leprosy Has Persisted
description: The bacteria that cause leprosy can survive for months inside amoebae that are common in water and soil, and even in human eyes and noses, scientists at Colorado State University have found.

title: Triumph of the Chart
description: Ive been behind the curve on the Vox interview with President Obama. But the reactions to that interview  not just from the right, but from centrists  are remarkable. Jack Schafer compares it to a Scientology recruitment film; Rich Lowry compares it to Leni Riefenstahl. Why?

title: Meeting on Greek Debt Produces an Ultimatum
description: BRUSSELS  The standoff between Greece and its European lenders appeared to reach a new low on Monday as European officials handed Athens an ultimatum: Agree by Friday to continue with a bailout program or risk the funding that the country needs to avoid a default.

title: Up to 14 Years of Hot Flashes Found in Menopause Study
description: Conventional wisdom has it that hot flashes, which afflict up to 80 percent of middle-aged women, usually persist for just a few years. But hot flashes can continue for as long as 14 years, and the earlier they begin the longer a woman is likely to suffer, a study published on Monday in JAMA Internal Medicine found.

title: Health Care Success for Midwest Co-op Proves Its Undoing
description: RED OAK, Iowa  A few days after Christmas, Lisa Lovigs doctor called with jarring news. The health insurer covering her cancer treatments had run out of money, and its future was at best uncertain.

description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Helga Traxler.

title: What Children Think of the Internet (and Why It Matters)
description: On a recent late afternoon, my 5-year-old son requested pizza for dinner, as he does pretty much every day. I wasnt sure if we had one in the freezer. Lets ask the Internet, he suggested. A few days later, he proposed consulting Google to find out what time his father would be home from work.

title: 2016 Ambitions Seen in Walkers Push for University Cuts in Wisconsin
description: MADISON, Wis.  Atop a steep hill on the University of Wisconsin campus is a granite boulder affixed with a bronze plaque honoring the university systems lofty mission: to benefit the entire state by promoting public service and a search for truth.

description: Our puzzles this week were suggested by Greg Ross, periodic Numberplay contributor and curator of the incredibly popular Futility Closet, the online compilation of the most addicting tidbits from history, literature, language, art, philosophy and mathematics. This weeks challenges are from Gregs recently-released Futility Closet 2. Lets give them a try, starting with

title: Sweetest Violins Explained: Holes Fill In Blanks
description: Some of the worlds most prized violins were made in Cremona, Italy, in the 17th and 18th centuries by the Amati, Guarneri and Stradivari families. Researchers at M.I.T. wanted to know what accounted for the instruments unique acoustical properties.

title: Disorder Rules the Universe
description: On or about September 1927, wrote the philosopher Ray Monk, the physical world changed. Until then, according to Robert P. Crease and Alfred Scharff Goldhabers rich and entertaining new book, The Quantum Moment, we lived in a homogeneous, continuous, Newtonian world in which all objects moved seamlessly from the past to the future, governed by universal mathematical laws.

title: At the Fall/Winter 2015 Shows, Designers Are Pushing Buttons
description: What is in a button? Its functional and fastens, usually without being noticed  until now. On the fall/winter 2015 runways in New York, the utilitarian little notions have been upgraded from behind the scenes to front and center. We saw them first at Victoria Beckham, who sewed large horn buttons onto knit shift dresses and sculpted outerwear. A few hours later, Derek Lam introduced double-breasted vests fastened with oversize white buttons and turtlenecks dotted with black ones. And at Edun, buttons embellished extra-large pea coats and the necks of dresses. Practical or not, theyre poised to be a fixture for fall.

title: In Arenas Shadow, Holdouts at Atlantic Yards Site Must Now Leave
description: Last week was a busy one at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn. The rusticated arena lost its shot at hosting the 2016  Democratic National Convention, but there was still plenty to cheer during its first N.B.A. All-Star celebration.

title: The S.N.L. 40th-Anniversary Show: Very Funny, Except When It Wasnt
description: Humor, like beauty, doesnt always last. Chevy Chase and Eddie Murphy proved that.

title: Wimpy Kid Musical to Have Premiere in Minneapolis
description: Diary of a Wimpy Kid, Jeff Kinneys series about the misadventures of a misfit middle schooler, has sold more than 120 million books and inspired a Hollywood franchise. Now, a musical version will hit the stage next spring, capping off the 50th anniversary season of Childrens Theater Company in Minneapolis.

He cited a letter he received from Sri Lankas foreign minister, Mangala Samaraweera, who agreed that a U.N. working group on disappearances could visit the country.

description: Sunday night parties for Diane Von Furstenberg, Public School, Prabal Gurung and Opening Ceremony.

title: The Afghan Militant in the Photo? The Wrong Man, and Hes Not Happy
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  After an airstrike killed a prominent recruiter for the Islamic State in Afghanistan last week, the Afghan spy agency issued a triumphant news release announcing his death and providing a picture of a man it identified as the wanted militant, Mullah Abdul Rauf Khadim.

description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: Bassem Youssef, an Egyptian Talk-Show Host in the Jon-Stewart Vein, Is Films Focus
description: LOS ANGELES  What everyone at The Daily Show really wants to do, apparently, is direct.

title: A Cancer Cluster Is Tough to Prove
description: Last month, thousands of Marines and their families were blocked in federal court from pursuing their claim that the government had given them cancer. The decision, involving people exposed to contaminated drinking water while stationed at Camp Lejeune, a base in North Carolina, didnt consider the science.

title: Jewish Graves Vandalized in France
description: PARIS  Teenage vandals are suspected of overturning as many as 250 gravestones in a cemetery in a rural part of eastern France near the German border, where many Jews once lived but have long since left.

title: Quiz: Westminster Dog Show Look-Alikes
description: Do dogs really look like their owners? Put the theory to the test by trying to guess which dog from the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show belongs to which owner.

title: A Moths Tail Can Deceive Bats
description: Like a caterpillar blending into a leaf to escape a birds gaze, luna moths that have tails can use them to generate a noise that guides attacking bats away from their bodies. Using high-speed infrared cameras, researchers at Boise State University watched big brown bats hunt moths by means of echolocation. The ones with tails had a 47 percent survival advantage over those without, the researchers reported Monday in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.

title: An Angular, Runway-Inspired New Track From New Yorks White Prism
description: Theres an undeniable visual quality to White Prisms sound. The project features cool, breathy vocals that float above a bed of icy, angular synths and syncopated beats, simultaneously harkening back to 80s dance pop and conjuring something strangely futuristic. I really wanted to concentrate on marrying the two things that I love, which are fashion and music, says White Prisms lead singer and songwriter Johanna Cranitch, whose blunt bleached bob and shockingly blue eyes even seem suited to the music she makes.

title: Review: In Paradox of the Urban Clich, Verse Melts Into Drama
description: The soft sound of snapping fingers rippled through the audience at Paradox of the Urban Clich, a thoughtful new play by Craig Grant, as a character named Smiles laid down her rhymes. The pain-filled verses flowed with an easy grace, and the snaps on a recent night at the Wild Project were a sign of approval borrowed from the world of performance poetry.

title: U.N. Delays Release of Report on Possible War Crimes in Sri Lanka
description: The United Nations Human Rights Council on Monday agreed to defer the release of a landmark inquiry into possible war crimes in Sri Lanka, after an intense lobbying campaign by the countrys newly elected government and what the United Nations top rights official described as signals of broad cooperation from Sri Lankan officials.

title: Genes Tell Only Part of the Story
description: I had intended to discuss President Obamas plans for personalized precision medicine with my patient Barbara last week, but she missed her appointment. Or, more accurately, she arrived two hours late, made the usual giant fuss at the reception desk and had to be rescheduled.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 4
description: Despite freezing temperatures, the fashion faithful kept the parties going. Diane von Furstenberg held a party at her meatpacking district studio that included Cindi Leive, the editor in chief of Glamour. See the photos.

title: The Science of Online Dating
description: One in 10 American adults is registered with an online dating service. The number of people looking to find love online has never been greater, but the wealth of options also means that singles can spend months combing through hundreds of profiles without ever securing a successful date.

title: Transocean Chief Steps Down Suddenly With Company in Doldrums
description: HOUSTON  After five tumultuous years at the helm, Steven L. Newman, the chief executive of Transocean, a leading offshore drilling service company, has abruptly stepped down.

title: Water Crisis in So Paulo
description: The largest reservoir system serving So Paulo, Brazil, is near depletion. Drastic water rationing for millions of people may be needed.

description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Taps Start to Run Dry in Brazils Largest City
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Endowed with the Amazon and other mighty rivers, an array of huge dams and one-eighth of the worlds fresh water, Brazil is sometimes called the Saudi Arabia of water, so rich in the coveted resource that some liken it to living above a sea of oil.

title: New York Fashion Week: Eckhaus Latta Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: In Performance | Luba Mason
description: Ms. Mason sings Beautiful from Pretty Filthy, a musical about the porn industry, accompanied by the show's composer, Michael Friedman, on piano.

title: Steep Fees and First-Class Prices, but Private Jets Are Available to More
description: Aaron Smart flies two or three times a week and prefers private jets, but he doesnt own a plane. He has a smartphone for that. Mr. Smart, who is an owner of Manhattans ArtNowNY and Joseph Gross galleries, has homes in Rancho Palos Verdes, Calif., and New York, making for a lot of time spent on planes.

title: Scene City: When NBA All-Star and Fashion Week Collide
description: LeBron James, Carmelo Anthony, Russell Westbrook and other All-Stars party alongside the stars of New York Fashion Week.

description: For as long as Bob Feller, the Hall of Fame pitcher for the Cleveland Indians, remained alive, the business model for the Bob Feller Museum in Van Meter, Iowa, his hometown, worked perfectly.

title: Listening to Bad Pitches and Asking One Question Too Many
description: IM in the inventions business, hosting a radio show called My Cool Inventions, and Im a frequent guest on HSN and QVC International showcasing inventions. I work in the product development end of things, too. All of these ventures involve a lot of travel, about 150,000 to 200,000 miles a year.

title: Amare Stoudemires Time With Knicks Done After Buyout
description: Amare Stoudemires tenure with the Knicks came to a bittersweet conclusion on Monday when the team announced that it had bought out the remainder of the 33-year-old forwards contract.

description: With the NBA All-Star game in New York on Sunday, the weekend was jammed with roundball-related festivities. On Thursday night, Zegna hosted a dinner that drew players like Serge Ibaka, a power forward on the Oklahoma City Thunder. See the photos.

title: Milly: Fall 2015 RTW

title: Debating the Rules and Ethics of Digital Photojournalism
description: The disqualification of a large number of images from this years World Press Photo contest has sparked a debate over the need for more explicit rules on what is  and is not  acceptable in digital photography.

title: Dillon Gee Arrives in Mets Camp With Status Unsettled
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Dillon Gee spent his off-season at home in Texas, hunting and spending time with his family. It was relaxing for the most part. But whenever he saw his agent calling, he would become anxious. The Mets had been shopping him in trades, and on more than one occasion, he thought a deal might be close.

title: With Ukrainian Troops Trapped, a Cease-Fire Grows More Fragile
description: ARTEMIVSK, Ukraine  The plight of as many as 8,000 Ukrainian troops trapped in the vicinity of Debaltseve, as well as the prospects for an already fragile truce, look decidedly dimmer on Monday after a Russian television correspondent strolled down what was supposed to be a hotly contested road.

title: Scenes From the All-Star Game
description: The 64th N.B.A. All-Star Game, played at Madison Square Garden, was a typically high-scoring affair, with celebrities not only on the court but also in the stands.

title: U.S. Embedded Spyware Overseas, Report Claims
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The United States has found a way to permanently embed surveillance and sabotage tools in computers and networks it has targeted in Iran, Russia, Pakistan, China, Afghanistan and other countries closely watched by American intelligence agencies, according to a Russian cybersecurity firm.

title: At Opening Ceremony, the Clothes Are Only the Start
description: Its not at all unusual to be invited to a Chelsea gallery during fashion week. Designers love to rent out the galleries that line the far-west blocks of Chelsea  even in February, when frigid winds blow off the nearby river  to stage their fashion shows.

title: Review: Ballet Arizonas Napoli Embodies a Culture of Exuberance
description: PHOENIX  Naples, a city I adore, and its environs burst to life onstage in Napoli, a ballet choreographed in 1842 by August Bournonville. When the curtain rises on Act I, the audience applauds the view of the citys famous bay, with Vesuvius dominating the horizon. When it rises on Act II, the applause is accompanied by gasps, because here were in the Blue Grotto of Capri. Act III is not set in any location so famous, but theres something so picturesque about its bridge and pilgrim shrine that the audience applauds anyway.

title: Your Letters: Carbon Dioxide Storage, H.I.V. Drugs and Ebola Management
description: Climate: Energy Use

title: On the Fall 2015 Runways, Fresh Takes on an Old Standby: Black Eyeliner
description: Black lines are defining the eyes in unexpected ways at the fall/winter 2015 shows. Last Thursday at Coachs presentation, a seamless, symmetrical cat-eye immediately drew attention; the black stroke went across the top lid and back down halfway alongthe lower lid, with just enough of a pull at the corner of the eye. DKNY explored the trend with a little more adventurous oomph, outlining the outskirts of the eye with a thick black line; and at Cushnie et Ochs, it was more rock-n-roll, a smoky eye that stole the beauty moment  thick and smeared, with a slight interruption at each corner that separated the top and the bottom portion of the eye like the ends of a brushstroke.

title: Review: Berlin Philharmonic Goes to London in Simon Rattle Homecoming
description: LONDON  Whenever the conductor Simon Rattle takes his Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra to London, theres a sense of reckoning: about the boy who went away, made good and is now bringing home the proof. For British audiences, the very idea that a conductor from England  what Germans used to call the land without music  is in charge of Germanys flagship orchestra is a continuing source of national delight. British music lovers are always curious to know how the relationship has worked out.

title: Review: Rap Guide to Religion Examines Why Humanity Created God
description: You know what would make Baba Brinkman happy this weekend? If just one winner would get up at the Oscars and make an acceptance speech that began not with an expression of gratitude to God but with I want to thank Charles Darwin.

title: Review: Auryn Quartet Forges a Radiance at the Frick
description: A warm sound is invariably an appealing attribute of solo or ensemble playing  and as temperatures plummeted on Sunday afternoon, it felt particularly welcome to bask in the Auryn Quartets glowing timbres in the snug acoustical cocoon of the Frick Collections intimate Music Room.

title: A Bold, Punky Lip at 3.1 Phillip Lim
description: Its unquestionable (and understandable) that designers have lately preferred to keep their beauty looks simple, and the choice to eschew that effortless style in favor of a bold one feels innovative and inspired. During a season thats so far been filled with natural-looking lips, its refreshing to see a color speak for itself, as we did at 3.1 Phillip Lims fall 2015 show today. Backstage, the makeup artist Francelle Daly professed her love affair with Nars Cosmetics newest lip color, VIP Red, taking us down a nostalgic burgundy punk path. I fell in love with this shade when they showed it to me, Daly said. I remember in the 90s and late 80s, it was all about my red leather Dr. Martens boots. The oxblood red lipstick is also the perfect complement to the clothing Lim showed: It really fits into all these beautiful gold, brown and green tones that you see in the collection, Daly said.

title: Vaccinations Are States Call
description: Henning Jacobson just said no. Even though Massachusetts required it, he did not want to be vaccinated. He had had a bad reaction to a vaccine, and he opposed vaccination in general.

description: ESTELLE

title: Prison Architecture and the Question of Ethics
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Faced with lawsuits and a growing mountain of damning research, New York City officials decided last month to ban solitary confinement for prison inmates 21 and younger. Just a few weeks earlier, the American Institute of Architects rejected a petition to censure members who design solitary-confinement cells and death chambers.

description: On Friday at the Joyce Theater, an unusual sound rippled through the audience, a sound not often heard at performances by the Martha Graham Dance Company: laughter.

description: Trains of musical thought that wind from one part of the world into another and from one century to the next: A sense of boarding and changing trains on a far-reaching journey ran through Dianne Reevess concert at Jazz at Lincoln Centers Rose Hall on Friday evening.
