title: Fox Searchlight Outshines Rivals in Oscar Hunt
description: LOS ANGELES  At the Academy Awards on Sunday, Fox Searchlight Pictures will have two films in the running for top honors: Alejandro G. Irritus Birdman and Wes Andersons The Grand Budapest Hotel.

title: Admiring Mount Fuji From a Black-Sand Beach
description: Mount Fuji is a beloved and sacred peak that is an unforgettable sight and easily viewable, which is why I was frustrated when on a visit in 2013 I was able to get to within a few miles of the mountain only to find it obscured by thick clouds.

title: Island Hopping Off the Coast of Borneo
description: It seemed like a good idea at the time. Adam Dean, a photographer working for The New York Times, and I had just returned from several back-to-back voyages in the South China Sea last November, reporting on the fishing industry and sleeping on cramped, roach- and rat-infested boats from Thailand and Indonesia. While waiting in Kota Kinabalu, Borneo, for our next boat to arrive, we had a couple of down days. So I suggested we try the Coral Explorer day package on offer from an adventure tours company called Intrepid Travel, based in Melbourne, Australia.

title: A Call for Law Firms to Go Public
description: Many law firms have been seeking new ways to keep themselves financially sound as their clients become more cost conscious.

title: In Wilton, Conn., Historic Homes and Fine Schools
description: Heather and Christopher Mah went looking for a place to live in Fairfield County, and wound up choosing a house before theyd chosen a town.

title: Photoshop at 25: A Thriving Chameleon Adapts to an Instagram World
description: The history of digital technology is full of innovations that are praised for having changed the world: the Mac, Microsoft Windows, the Netscape Navigator browser, the iPod and countless others. Then there are the many products that changed the world and were suddenly overtaken by some newer, supposedly better thing: the Mac, Microsoft Windows, Netscape Navigator, the iPod and countless others.

title: Khmer-Inspired Shopping by Angkor Wat
description: Siem Reap, the gateway city to Angkor, is renowned for a lot of things  more than 100 ancient temple ruins dot the surrounding jungles  but shopping isnt one of them. Its often an afterthought, with visitors snagging the prerequisite temple souvenir. But the heart of the city on the west side of the Siem Reap River is brimming with a clutch of stylish, recently opened boutiques carrying contemporary wares that often reference traditional Khmer culture. The shops are found along narrow lanes and well-trodden streets in a roughly 10-block radius, many owned by well-traveled expatriates breathing new energy into this tourist-oriented city. (Note: U.S. dollars are widely accepted.)

title: Obama Urges Global United Front Against Extremist Groups Like ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama called on Americans and more than 60 nations on Wednesday to join the fight against violent extremism, saying they had to counter the ideology of the Islamic State and other groups making increasingly sophisticated appeals to young people around the world.

title: Anna Ewers Transforms at Rodarte
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Anna Ewers before (left) and after (right) makeup by James Kaliardos, hair by Odile Gilbert.

title: New Artistic Director for Guthrie Theater
description: The Guthrie Theater in Minneapolis has named its next artistic director: Joseph Haj, who currently leads PlayMakers Repertory Company in North Carolina. Mr. Haj, one of the few Arab-American artistic directors in the country, will take over the Guthrie on July 1, succeeding Joe Dowling, who is stepping down after 20 years. The Guthrie boards chairman, Lee Skold, said Tuesday that the search team and board members  who spent a year looking for a leadership match  had been drawn to Mr. Hajs inspired vision, collaborative spirit, and standard of excellence.

title: David Ives's Lives of the Saints From Primary Stages
description: The playwright David Ives is all over the place. The Metromaniacs, his verse adaptation of an 18th-century play, has just opened at the Shakespeare Theater in Washington. His comedy Venus in Fur, seen widely at regional theaters, may get another goose from the movie release of a certain hugely popular series of novels about erotic transgression. It has also been announced that Mr. Ives will collaborate with Stephen Sondheim on a new musical adapted from a pair of Luis Buuel films.

title: 1915: Italians Clamor for War
description: ROME  All adherents of the democratic parties had been convoked for to-day [Feb. 18] to the Piazza Monte Citorio for the purpose of a demonstration in favor of war. The square was barricaded by troops and police, but in the neighborhood of the Chamber a grave demonstration took place in spite of all precautions. Immense crowds gathered and clamored for war, interspersing their cries with shouts of Down with Austria! Processions of demonstrators marched through the streets with flags at their heads shouting against Germany and Austria. German and Austrian shops had all had their shutters put up.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Feb. 19, 1915

title: Peter Careys Amnesia
description: Now that the politics of hacking has assumed an importance hitherto unknown, the theme Peter Carey has chosen for his latest novel seems especially timely. In many ways, its a departure from his previous work, although throughout Amnesia he maintains the temper and Rabelaisian fury of a prose we know all too well. You can pick any page at random and locate an energy that never seems to flag. His sentences hit their intended marks with an emotion that often feels like exasperated cruelty, and none of his characters are spared a little bloodletting.

title: House Hunting In ...Thailand
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM VILLA WITH WATER VIEWS IN PHUKET, THAILAND

title: Jeff Augustin on Haiti, Voodoo and Roundabout Underground
description: Magic realism doesnt work in a world where anything goes as a matter of course. At some point, the magic needs to give way to  or at least nestle alongside  reality.

title: Head of State, by Andrew Marr
description: Early in this comic political thriller, an eminent historian is shown round 10 Downing Street. It is mid-September, 2017, a few days before a referendum on whether Britain should leave the European Union. (In real life, such a referendum is a virtual certainty if the Conservatives are still in the government after this years general election.) The historian, who has been promised unparalleled access in order to produce an authorized history of the vote, has come to interview the prime minister, a man whose charisma seems to be all that keeps Britain from decamping. But the prime minister is not available, and instead an aide conducts a tour of the premises  up the famous staircase with portraits of previous occupants and into a grand state room. The historian is unimpressed. He was all too aware that the real work went on one floor below them, in the cabinet room and the P.M.s office and the private secretaries rooms.

title: Michael Korss Fall 2015 Collection at New York Fashion Week
description: [Watch the live stream.]

title: Mark Twains America and Huck Finns America
description: Fresh and funny today as he was more than a century ago, Mark Twain wittily distrusted everything bogus, inflated, predictable or empty. He was a man of a thousand American parts  novelist, stand-up comic, travel writer, impresario, capitalist, full-time celebrity and coruscating social critic  whose ear for dialogue, nuance, slang and absurdity seldom failed him. No wonder we still read him, debate him, scold him, censor him. William Dean Howells aptly canonized him as the Lincoln of our literature.

title: No Bitterness From Victoria Azarenka After Surprise Split With Coach
description: In a time of increased shuffling in the coaching ranks of professional tennis, the partnership between Victoria Azarenka and her longtime coach Sam Sumyk ended abruptly, at least from Azarenkas perspective.

title: Sketching Shakespeare
description: Macbeth  unlike, say, Hamlet or Romeo and Juliet  doesnt feature classically adolescent themes, and its main characters are grown-ups. Yet with its simple, linear plot, its witches and its ghosts, its clear-cut moral questions about the lure of evil and whether and how we control our own fates, it is well suited for teenagers. Gareth Hindss stellar new graphic-novel adaptation, aimed at a young adult audience, makes that abundantly clear. The play also, of course, features some epic fight scenes and lots and lots of blood, and Hinds makes the most of these opportunities to show how naturally Shakespeare takes to the comics form.

title: Probing the Mysteries of a Photographer and Her Images
description: One of the most fascinating art world stories of recent years is the discovery of the work of Vivian Maier and her rapid elevation to one of the great American photographers of the 20th century. It was John Maloof who found thousands of her negatives and undeveloped rolls of film at an auction house in Chicago, and paid $380 for them, and he is also the director, with Charlie Siskel, of Finding Vivian Maier, one of five films competing for the Oscar for best feature-length documentary.

title: 1965: Vatican and Protestants Agree
description: GENEVA  The Roman Catholic and Protestant churches today [Feb. 18] reached a historic agreement to try to end their differences and achieve Christian unity. The first giant step toward a common understanding came during the unprecedented visit of a Roman Catholic cardinal to the World Council of Churches this morning. Augustin Cardinal Bea, on behalf of the Holy See, accepted the councils proposal to establish a mixed committee to determine the principles and methods for future inter-church collaboration.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 19, 1965

title: Hospitals Try to Reduce Suffering: Reporters Notebook
description: Gina Kolata wrote a Feb. 18 front-page article about hospitals and their increased interest in reducing suffering. She explains how the story took shape.

title: Earthquake Dangers in Dutch Gas Field Were Ignored for Years, Safety Board Says
description: LONDON  An independent Dutch safety panel has found that the operators of Europes largest natural gas field, Royal Dutch Shell and Exxon Mobil, as well as the Dutch government, for years ignored the dangers posed by earthquakes in the field.

title: New York Fashion Week: Oscar de la Renta Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Helga Traxler.

title: New York Fashion Week: Oscar de la Renta Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Helga Traxler.

title: A Bid for Guns on Campuses to Deter Rape
description: As gun rights advocates push to legalize firearms on college campuses, an argument is taking shape: Arming female students will help reduce sexual assaults.

title: Greece to Propose Extension of European Union Bailout Program
description: ATHENS  Greek officials are planning to submit a proposal to eurozone finance ministers for breaking the impasse in debt negotiations between the new government in Athens and Greeces European creditors.

title: Excerpt: The Odd Couple
description: Matthew Perry and Thomas Lennon star in a CBS update of the classic sitcom.

title: New York Fashion Week: Narciso Rodriguez Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: New York Fashion Week: Narciso Rodriguez Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Trade Group Accelerates Push for a Fast Track Deal
description: Members of Congress might be home for the Presidents Day recess, but they cannot avoid the debate over trade.

title: New York City Rail Crossings Carry a Deadly Past
description: New Yorkers may not think railroad grade crossings have anything to do with them, but the city owes its immensely popular High Line to a campaign that began more than a century ago against the carnage caused by a street-level freight line.

title: Memorable Sports Apologies Through the Years
description: The most believable part about Alex Rodriguezs public apology to the Yankees and fans Tuesday for past misdeeds might have been the section in which he acknowledged that most people would not believe anything he said. The most unusual part might have been his chosen medium for the moment: a handwritten letter, in cursive, in 2015. Most offensive, stylistically, was probably his decision to stretch the letter to a second page, making it aesthetically unpleasing on social media.

title: What You Get for  $1,050,000
description: A former hunting retreat in Colorado, a contemporary in Alabama and a cottage in West Virginia

title: $1,050,000 Homes in Colorado, Alabama and West Virginia
description: MEREDITH, COLO.

title: Whats the Most Godless State?
description: A new Gallup poll finds that more than half of Utah residents say they attend religious services weekly, the highest percentage of any state in the union. In Vermont, only 17 percent of residents say they attend religious services weekly, the lowest percentage. Click on the Gallup link for a complete list.

title: New Dr. Seuss Book, What Pet Should I Get?, Coming in July, With More to Come
description: When Harper Lees Go Set a Watchman hits bookstores in July, it will face sales competition from another long-lost manuscript by a beloved author: Dr. Seuss.

title: Nick Hornbys Funny Girl
description: The unassuming title of Nick Hornbys regular column about books for The Believer magazine perfectly matches its authors conversational style: Stuff Ive Been Reading. At a literary festival last October, Hornby spoke, not for the first time, in defense of taking the pain out of literature. Struggling through a book out of a sense of duty, he argued, is reinforcing the notion that reading is something you should do but telly is something you want to do. It shouldnt be like that. Novels should be like TV. It shouldnt be hard work.

title: Kate Brown, New Governor in Oregon, Seeks Publics Trust
description: SALEM, Ore.  Kate Brown took the oath of office as governor here on Wednesday, capping a decades-long climb through the ranks of state government but also commencing what is certain to be a wrenching transition fraught with political risk. Her predecessor, John Kitzhaber, announced his resignation last week, just weeks into his fourth term, amid an onslaught of criminal and ethical investigations and a collapse of support from his own party.

title: Amazon Orders Full Seasons for Five New Shows
description: In January, Amazon Studios, the online retail giants television production wing, posted 10 original pilots for viewers to watch and vote on. This morning, five of them were ordered to series: The Man in the High Castle, based on the Philip K. Dick novel that imagines an alternate reality in which the Axis powers won World War II; Mad Dogs, a dark comedy executive produced by Shawn Ryan (The Shield, Terriers); The New Yorker Presents, a docu-series overseen by Alex Gibney (Taxi To the Dark Side, We Steal Secrets); and the kids series Just Add Magic and The Stinky & Dirty Show.

title: Real Runners Do Take Walk Breaks
description: When a runner friend suggested I run my first distance race by adding walk breaks, the idea startled me. I didnt think you were allowed to walk in races, not if you wanted to be a real runner. But the thought of running in New Jersey, all the way to the boardwalk in North Wildwood from Cape May in a single clip, seemed impossible, and I came around.

title: Below the Line: Editing Whiplash
description: Those who have seen their fair share of films about musicians may go into a movie like Whiplash with certain expectations. But this best picture nominee is not your typical music drama. Instead, in its pacing, acting and particularly its editing, the film behaves more like Bullitt than, say, Bird. The focus is mainly on Andrew (Miles Teller), a jazz drum student at a prestigious music school, and his mentor, Fletcher (J.K. Simmons), an intense, strict and frequently verbally abusive teacher. The films editor, Tom Cross, worked closely with the director, Damien Chazelle, to shape the cuts.

title: Designers Take Cues From Scottish Lads to Make Fall Skirts for the Girls
description: Designers have always loved borrowing from the boys for womens collections; and for fall 2015, they tapped into the structure of a kilt. At Coach, pleated, knee-length skirts, the default bottoms throughout the collection, added femininity to looks featuring structured shearling coats and heavy boots. Tim Coppens, who got his start in mens wear, kept to his usual sporty aesthetic, topping kilt-inspired bottoms with boyish knits and bombers. And at Diesel Black Gold, Andreas Melbostad added texture to his all-black collection with lace, leather and, in this instance, layers of materials in a miniskirt version of the traditional Scottish garment. In all black, the trending color on this weeks runways, the new iterations are much chicer than the tartan originals.

title: Infrastructure Joe Visits Another 2016 Early Primary State
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Wednesday continued his sweep through 2016 early primary states, stopping in Charleston, S.C., to deliver a broad speech on infrastructure as part of the administrations Grow America tour.

title: Same-Day Delivery Resurges, Adding Alcohol
description: There are many bodies in the delivery graveyard. Webvan, Kozmo and Urbanfetch were all seen as the next big thing before crashing spectacularly.

title: Obama Picks Joseph Clancy to Be Secret Services Permanent Chief
description: President Obama on Wednesday appointed Joseph P. Clancy, who had guided the Secret Service on an interim basis for the last four and a half months, to be the agencys permanent director.

title: Reader Mailbag: Questions and Comments About Orders at Chipotle
description: In an article Tuesday, we set out to answer a question that weve always wondered about  what do people actually order when they go to Chipotle? We found that a typical order had about 1,070 calories and almost a full days worth of sodium and saturated fat.

title: 8 Tax Loopholes the Obama Administration Could Close
description: Let Bartlet be Bartlet was the title of a stirring episode of the progressive wish-fulfillment television series The West Wing. In the episode, staff members struggle to be taken seriously on Capitol Hill, working in the shadow of the timid and ambivalent president, Josiah Bartlet. In the face of falling job approval ratings, the chief of staff, Leo McGarry, challenges the president to be true to his values and take the staff off the leash. Mr. McGarry asks the staff members if they are ready for the fight. Each responds, I serve at the pleasure of the president.

title: Company in Bangladesh Agrees to Union Peace
description: After wielding intense pressure against a Bangladeshi apparel maker over assaults on union leaders outside its factories, Western companies have agreed to resume business with that manufacturer, on the condition that it stay committed to halting further violence and make peace with its labor unions.

title: In Philadelphia, Extended Stays With Boutique Touches
description: The extended-stay hotel category gets a boutique-style update in the form of the new Roost Apartment Hotel, recently opened in Philadelphia.

title: Chris Christie Makes a Fund-Raising Push in Bush Country
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, struggling to catch up to the early financial gains of his potential rival Jeb Bush, made an aggressive fund-raising push last week in Greenwich, Conn., the affluent enclave where residents have been part of the Bush family donor network for years.

title: Michael Kors: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Japan Post Paying a Rich Price to Show Global Expansion
description: Japan Post Service is paying a hefty price to stamp global expansion on its roadshow presentation.

title: Pakistani Taliban Kill 3 in Suicide Attack at Shiite Mosque
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  At least three people were killed and two wounded on Wednesday when a suicide bomber detonated his explosives outside a Shiite mosque on the outskirts of Islamabad, officials said. A faction of the Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility.

title: Yemens Last Jews
description: The rise of the militant Houthis and their anti-Semitism has reduced an ancient and once vibrant community to only a few people.

title: Crew Member Injured in Another Bond Movie Accident
description: The shooting of the new James Bond movie, Spectre, continued along its accident-prone way with an on-set crash Tuesday, according to the Hollywood Reporter.

title: 36 Hours in Beijing
description: Compared with Chinas other megacities, Beijing is still a traditionalist at heart, so delve into the shops, galleries and restaurants in the citys old, alleyway-threaded hutong neighborhoods.

title: Persecution Defines Life for Yemens Remaining Jews
description: RAIDA, Yemen  About all that remain of Yemens ancient and once vibrant Jewish community are untended cemeteries, dramatic hillside ghetto villages of thousand-year-old stone houses and a few people like Abraham Jacob and his extended family.

title: Metropolitan Opera Unveils a Season of Big Stars and 6 New Productions
description: The Metropolitan Opera said on Wednesday that it would redouble its efforts to attract new audiences to the opera next season with six new productions, a star-filled roster and new initiatives, including one that will offer half-priced tickets to children during the holidays and another to court young professionals with later curtain times, discounts and social events.

title: An Illinois Budget Chiefs Fond Memories of Jeb Bushs Florida
description: Jeb Bush is in Chicago to talk about foreign policy, but his former budget director Donna Arduin is in the local news.

title: Three Friends, One Jihadi
description: As his dreams crashed into Egypts social and political turmoil, Islam Yaken left his friends, family and a life of guilty pleasures for religious extremism, jihad and the Islamic State.

title: From a Private School in Cairo to ISIS Killing Fields in Syria (With Video)
description: CAIRO  He winced at the mere mention of his sons name, visibly overcome by an unceasing thought that he struggled to articulate. He looked down to hide the tears in his eyes.

title: U.S. Announces Third Bitcoin Auction
description: The United States Marshals Service announced on Wednesday that it would auction 50,000 Bitcoins, worth nearly $12 million, seized in connection with the online marketplace Silk Road.

title: Facing Demand, Uber Expands Funding Round by $1 Billion
description: Uber, the ride-hailing service, likes to trumpet its popularity with consumers. Their fervor is surpassed, perhaps, only by investors.

title: Classical Playlist: Beethoven, Mozart, Hugo Wolf and More
description: HUGO WOLF: Italienische Serenade/EDVARD GRIEG: String Quartet in G minor/LEOS JANACEK: String Quartet No. 2Amphion String Quartet(Nimbus Alliance NI 6289; one disc) The debut recording of this exciting young quartet brims with propulsive energy and raw drama. The players bring jaunty exuberance to Wolfs Italienische Serenade, an epic sweep to Griegs String Quartet in G minor and fiery temperament to Janaceks String Quartet No. 2. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

title: App Smart | Modernize Your Meetings
description: A new generation of meeting organizers helps you invite guests, set agendas and distribute shared documents, all from your phone.

title: In Nigeria, Boko Haram Loses Ground to Chadians
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Chads army has made its deepest push yet into Nigeria in a three-front regional war against Boko Haram, entering a town 50 miles from a beleaguered Nigerian state capital that has been surrounded for months by the militant group, Nigerian security officials said Wednesday.

title: A True Bedhead Look at Michael Kors
description: If I could, I would have started last night, said the hairstylist Orlando Pita, who instructed the models to wash their hair last night and sleep with it slightly damp before arriving backstage at the fall/winter 2015 Michael Kors fashion show this morning. Pita explained his goal was to achieve a disheveled look  the one you naturally have fresh out of bed, almost like you didnt have time to get ready, putting an elastic on your hair and running out the door.

title: A Boom in Private Equitys Secondary Market
description: Investors in private equity funds typically have to wait as long as a decade to get their money back. But many are now cashing out ahead of schedule by selling their investments into a secondary market, reflecting the buoyant state of private equity.

title: John Kirby, Pentagon Spokesman, Will Be Replaced With a Civilian
description: WASHINGTON  Rear Adm. John F. Kirby, the Pentagon press secretary and the public face of the American military for the past year, is stepping down, officials said Wednesday, the first casualty of a new defense secretary who has expressed reservations about having a uniformed officer represent the Defense Department in its daily dealings with the news media.

title: Delpozo: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: 8 Trips Inspired by Oscar-Nominated Films
description: You know a film is a hit when a tourism office or a hotel marketing company starts suggesting a vacation inspired by it (e.g., 50 Shades of Grey hotel packages and Hunger Games tours of Atlanta).

title: Photographing Blackness
description: What is dark is not empty; if you know how to see, there are glories in the shadows.

title: 36 Hours in Beijing
description: It seems like only yesterday that Beijing had its much-ballyhooed coming out party  the 2008 Summer Olympics  but things dont slow down much in Chinas frenetic capital. Already, the city is eyeing another Olympics bid (its one of two finalists for the 2022 Winter Games) and planning a $13 billion airport that is expected to be among the busiest in the world when it opens in 2019. And yet compared with Chinas other vertical megacities, Beijing is still a traditionalist at heart. The city may have fantastic new sculptural monuments designed by Zaha Hadid and Rem Koolhaas, but to truly understand Beijing, one has to delve into the remaining hutong neighborhoods  traditional alleyways lined with courtyard homes  and smell the sweet potatoes roasting on coal fires in the winter.

title: New York Fashion Week: Michael Kors Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: New Approach to Blocking H.I.V. Raises Hopes for an AIDS Vaccine
description: A new compound has blocked H.I.V. infection so well in monkeys that it may be able to function as a vaccine against AIDS, the scientists who designed it reported Wednesday.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 6
description: Net-a-Porter dines at Indochine and Rodarte goes tropical at the Jane.

title: 36 Hours in Beijing
description: Explore street view, find things to do in Beijing and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: Letting Your Kids Play in the Social Media Sandbox
description: Given my line of work, I am asked a lot of tech questions. Whats the best cellphone to get for work? Should I upgrade my laptop? Can you come over to set up my router?

title: Kim Gordon,Sonic Youths Antifrontwoman, on the Band and Breakups
description: Kim Gordon knows her reputation well. Detached, impassive or remote, she ticks off in her new memoir, opaque or mysterious or enigmatic or even cold.

title: Pussy Riot Releases I Cant Breathe, a Protest Song for Eric Garner
description: Two members of Pussy Riot, the Russian activist group, have made their first foray into English-language protest music, with the help of a whos who of indie rockers. In a video released Wednesday for a song called I Cant Breathe, Maria Alyokhina and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova, who were jailed for protesting in Russia, are buried in black dirt, while wearing Russian police uniforms. Their collaborators on the song, made in memory of Eric Garner and using his last words as its title and closing lyrics, include Nick Zinner of Yeah Yeah Yeahs and Andrew Wyatt of Miike Snow, as well as two Russian acts, Scofferlane and Jack Wood, which supplied the vocals (Its getting dark, New York City/I need to catch my breath). Richard Hell, the punk musician and writer, reads out Mr. Garners last words.

title: Quiz: Se parecen los perros de Westminster a sus dueos?
description: Se parecen los perros a sus dueos? Para poner a prueba esta teora, ve si puedes emparejar al perro del Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show con su dueo.

title: New York Fashion Week: Michael Kors Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Fed Appears to Hesitate on Raising Interest Rate
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve is not sounding like an institution that is ready to raise its benchmark interest rate in June.

title: Pharrell Williams, Childrens Book Author
description: Pharrell Williams  singer, songwriter, producer, fashion designer and coach on NBCs The Voice  will soon add the title of author to his credentials. Penguin Young Readers announced that Mr. Williams would create a book based on his hit song Happy, as part of a four-book deal with the Putnam Books for Young Readers division.

title: Why Network News Still Matters
Microsoft Has Suddenly Gotten Serious With Mobile
description: MICROSOFT is suddenly a powerful presence on my phone.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 6
description: Fashion week continued on Tuesday night with a Net-a-Porter dinner at Indochine, where the fashion writers Lynn Yaeger, Mickey Boardman and Meenal Mistry caught up by the entrance. See the photos.

title: Scott Walker on Not Having a College Degree
description: If Scott Walker, the Republican governor of Wisconsin, were to run, and win, in 2016, hed be the first president in more than 60 years without at least a bachelors degree. Given that everything a potential candidate does or does not do,including what he eatsat campaign stops, is considered fair game for critics, its no surprise that his B.A.-lessness has become a hot topic of conversation. Is having a college degree a presidential prerequisite? asked a Washington Post headline.

title: Tools to Make Meetings More Productive (and Maybe More Pleasant)
description: We all know that meetings are vital to doing business. They can also be difficult, slow or argumentative affairs. But tools to help speed up or even enhance your round-table discussions are now readily available.

title: Will Scott Walkers Money Moves Backfire?
description: An awkward punt on a question about evolution aside, Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker has come out of the groundwork phase of a potential presidential run in strong position. Hes in the lead or basically tied for the lead in recent polls from the leadoff primary states, Iowa and New Hampshire.

title: Supreme Leader Doubts Talks Will End Iran Sanctions
description: TEHRAN  Irans supreme leader said on Wednesday that he did not believe that all sanctions against his country would be lifted, a move he had previously said was an essential condition for nuclear talks to succeed.

title: French Cemetery Vandalism Suspects Acted With Anti-Semitic Motive, Prosecutor Says
description: PARIS  Five teenagers who were detained after overturning as many as 250 gravestones in a Jewish cemetery in eastern France over the weekend had a clear anti-Semitic motive, a local prosecutor told reporters on Wednesday.

title: Women and Minorities Make Slight Gains at Law Firms
description: After four years of decline, the percentage of associates at law firms who are women rose slightly last year but is still shy of the high mark in 2009, according to newly released data.

title: Key Points From Jeb Bushs Foreign Policy Speech
description: Former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida on Wednesday made his most extensive comments about foreign policy since announcing that he was considering a run for the Republican presidential nomination. Speaking for more than an hour at the Chicago Council on Global Affairs, he touched on the biggest international threats facing America, offered a critique of the Obama administration and sought to differentiate himself from the presidencies of his father and his brother. Here are some highlights and key points:

title: Drake Hits No. 1
description: Call it a mixtape or an album  Drake is No. 1 regardless.

title: Beagle Named Miss P Wins at Westminster
description: Miss P, a 15-inch beagle, was best in show, the top honor at the prestigious Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show.

title: A Return to Slumberland and a Psychedelic Rediscovery
description: An occasional series on vintage comics.

title: Walton Street Is Charmingly Old-Fashioned  at Least for Now
description: Londons Walton Street, in the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea, to the west of the city, has remained largely unchanged for the last 30 years. But for an increasingly international set of locals, that is its chief delight. Once home to the humorist P.G. Wodehouse, Walton Street still emanates an old-school English charm. Though flanked by Harrods and The Conran Shop, its an enclave of independent, if occasionally chichi, antiques and interiors shops, and art galleries and boutiques that has  so far  bucked the trend for high-end homogenization. There are, however, signs that change is afoot: Many of the streets stucco homes are straining under the scaffolds of hi-spec redevelopment, and rumor has it that the James Perse store may soon be joined by Charlotte Olympia and Christian Dior.

title: His All-Star Moment Over, Carmelo Anthony Ends a Painful Season With Surgery
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The longstanding drama surrounding Carmelo Anthony and his sore left knee  the endless queries, night after night, about how he felt and whether he would play the next game  was put to rest Wednesday when the Knicks announced that Anthony, their star forward, would have season-ending surgery this week.

title: Ukrainian Forces Retreat From Debaltseve
description: Amid heavy fighting, Ukrainian soldiers were ordered to retreat from the strategic town of Debaltseve, where they had been surrounded by Russian-backed rebels.

title: Jeb Bush Tries to Distance Himself From Brother in Foreign Affairs Speech
description: CHICAGO  Jeb Bush pointedly sought to distance himself from his brothers presidency on Wednesday, declaring himself my own man and acknowledging that there were mistakes made in Iraq even as he used his first major foreign affairs speech to call for an assertive American presence that recalled President George W. Bushs approach to international relations.

title: Jeremy Scott: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: E.C.B. Could Be Power Broker in Greek Debt Crisis
description: FRANKFURT  As Athens and Brussels engage in a showdown over Greek debt, the ultimate power broker may reside in neither of those European capitals.

title: Gold, Glittering Mary Janes to Match Michael Korss Sexiest Fall 2015 Look
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Jeb Bush Discusses Foreign Policy Views
description: Former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida talked about Iran and Benjamin Netanyahus scheduled speech to Congress and said his foreign policy positions were his own, not his familys.

title: In Defense of Islam
description: Consider this post a kind ofcomplement, maybe, to my anti-anti-Crusades commentaryof late. The big foreign policy piece that everyone is talking about this week, and deservedly, is Graeme Woods deep Atlantic diveinto the religiouspremises underpinning the Islamic States vision andgrand strategy.Woods argument is richenough to defy easy summary, but his core point is thatWestern analysts tend to understatenot only the essential religiosity ofISISs worldview, but the extent to which that worldview has substantialtheological grounding. It isnt just a few guys making up a cult out of random bits of scripture; its political-religious vision appeals precisely because it derives from coherent and even learned interpretations of Islam. And we ignore the coherence of those interpretations at our peril: The Islamic States intellectual genealogy is intensely relevant to its political strategy, and itstheology must be understood to be combatted.

description: A look at some of Ms. Chenoweths past performances.
