title: Iran Judge Blocks Effort to Hire Lawyer for Reporter
description: The Iranian judge overseeing the case of Jason Rezaian, the Washington Post reporter imprisoned in Iran for nearly seven months, has frustrated his familys effort to hire a lawyer for him, Mr. Rezaians brother and the newspaper said Wednesday.

title: Nigeria, on the Vote Delay
description: To the Editor:

title: Canada, on the Pipeline
description: To the Editor:

title: Saddle Bronc Part 3 Intro
description: Intro sequence for part 3.

title: Syrian Rebels Regain Territory Near Aleppo
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian opposition fighters on Wednesday said that they had gained back the territory they lost near the divided northern city of Aleppo a day earlier, when government forces carried out a surprise attack in an effort to cut off their main supply route to Turkey.

title: Verbatim: We Are Not at War With Islam
description: President Obama, during a three-day meeting on countering violent extremism.

title: Stella Maxwell Transforms at Jeremy Scott
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Stella Maxwell before (left) and after (right) makeup by Kabuki, hair by Eugene Souleiman.

title: Review: In Horseplay, a Terrible Actress Becomes Her Eras Kim Kardashian
description: A hopeless actress with a genius for self-promotion, Adah Isaacs Menken straddled a few decades of the mid-19th century, often onstage, occasionally on horseback. She shared poems and beds with a dizzying host of artists and boxers and intellectuals. If that era had invented Instagram, she would have been its queen.

title: Brown Sworn In as Governor of Oregon
description: Kate Brown, a Democrat, was sworn in to replace John Kitzhaber, who resigned last week after inquiries were begun into his fiances finances and role in his administration.

title: A Trip to Marigold in India
description: The film The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel and its sequel, The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel, to open March 6, are set in the colorful city of Jaipur, India. Now a tripby Wild Frontiers in London gives travelers a chance to put themselves in some of the movies settings.

title: Samsung Buys LoopPay, a Competitor to Apples Mobile Wallet
description: Samsung, the South Korean technology giant, announced Wednesday it had acquired LoopPay, a mobile payments company, signaling its interest in controlling smartphone-based purchases.

title: MSNBC Hires Tom Colicchio As First Food Correspondent
description: Tom Colicchio, an acclaimed New York-based chef who has achieved national prominence as the main judge on Bravos Top Chef, has been named food correspondent for MSNBC. He will contribute reporting and develop programming for the networks television and other platforms, including digital video.

title: Europe Proposes a Capital Markets Union
description: BRUSSELS  The European Union authorities on Wednesday recommended streamlining rules for financial markets to inject dynamism into sluggish areas of the economy and to encourage Britain to see the bloc as an economic opportunity rather than a source of red tape.

title: Boss Women: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Rosanne Somerson Named RISD President
description: When Rosanne Somerson became interim president of Rhode Island School of Design, the job came with a 21-room historic house in Providence, R.I., but not much furniture. Fortunately, Ms. Somerson was a founder and longtime head of the schools furniture department with close ties to the academic community. As described in the On Location feature of Feb. 12, she filled the rooms with dozens of furniture and art pieces made by RISD faculty, students and alumni, creating not only a comfortable second home but also a public showcase of the schools talent.

title: Review: Schuberts Winter Journey Allows Ian Bostridge to Obsess
description: When Schubert played Winterreise, one of the greatest cycles of art songs, or lieder, ever written, for a gathering of his friends, they were puzzled. As one member of his circle recalled decades later, they were utterly dumbfounded by the mournful, gloomy tone of these songs.

title: Paula Hayes Reimagines a Victorian Totem in Madison Square Park
description: Paula Hayes can see into the future. Ive always been a bit witchy, she squeals. Its true: Hayes has been infusing her sculptures with a bit of history and magic since she began creating work back in the 1990s. But it wasnt until her first show in 2004 with Salon 94, which represents her to this day, that it became clear the environmentally focused artists iconic medium, the round terrarium, would trickle down into critical mass. These days, retailers like Target unknowingly shill imitations of her work. Now that every twentysomething in Brooklyn (and their mothers elsewhere) own the little glass spheres that contain living plants, succulents and crystals, Hayes has moved on. Im contemplating in the realm of nature, but it has moved into sculptural form and illumination, the 57-year-old says. On top of her terrariums, Hayes is internationally lauded as a landscape artist  even divining the backyards and terraces of the art worlds elite, including the gallerists Jeanne Rohatyn Greenberg (of Salon 94), David Zwirner and Marianne Boesky. For her next project, though, Im not using living plants, Hayes says. Thats a huge departure for my audience, the aspect of the botanical or horticultural, with more than 15 years in garden design, Hayes continues. So what is she doing?

title: A Cultural Problem for Journalism
description: Jeb Bush traded emails with Lucy Morgan, the longtime Tallahassee bureau chief of The St. Petersburg Times.

title: I Hope You Enjoy Your Stay in the Sunshine State
description: In May 2006, Julie Mason, then a Houston Chronicle reporter, emailed Jeb Bush to ask for an interview during a trip to Florida.

title: Pope Francis Leads Ash Wednesday Mass
description: Pope Francis, in his homily during an Ash Wednesday Mass at the Basilica of Santa Sabina in Rome, urged humility among the Roman Catholic clergy.

title: A Personal Tone on Immigration
description: Peter Wallsten (now an editor at The Washington Post) wrote back to make sure that the email from Jeb Bush was on the record.

title: Inside Witness
description: Priscila Neri and Kelly Matheson at the Witness office in Brooklyn.

title: A Dramatic, Arboreal Ponytail at Delpozo
description: T shares the best hairstyles from the runways.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, France, Taiwan and Spain.

title: The New Faces of Frances National Front
description: Come as you are.

title: Review: Jamie Barton Shows That Shes a Powerhouse of a Mezzo-Soprano
description: Pity the pianist who has to accompany Jamie Barton. Its not that Ms. Barton, a dramatic mezzo-soprano who has found stardom in the opera world since her double first prize in the 2013 Cardiff Singer of the World Competition, treats her chamber music partners callously. During her recital debut at Zankel Hall on Tuesday evening, she exuded immense likability and down-to-earth charm. No, the predicament for Bradley Moore, her very able pianist on this occasion, was that next to the magnificent power of Ms. Bartons voice, virtually everything he played came out sounding forlorn.

title: Feb. 18, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Ukraine, France, Taiwan and Spain.

title: Chips Off Three Blocks
description: Emmanuel Plat, director of merchandising for the store at the Museum of Modern Art, was surprised by the Sunrise carafes when he first spotted them in Milan. The design looked so heavy, he said, and yet, when you hold it in your hand it is very light and delicate.

title: Review: The Composers Concert, With David Hertzberg and Other Young Masters
description: All composers are influenced by, and even steal from, admired predecessors. This is a proven and honorable creative practice. The challenge is to fold such influences into your own musical voice.

title: A Ringling Show in Philadelphia
description: Circus Xtreme at the Wells Fargo Center.

title: Ringling Circus Camels, One Hump or Two, Are Singular Attractions
description: PHILADELPHIA  Cody, a coltish 4-year-old camel with a double hump, stood placidly during rehearsal in the center circus ring at Wells Fargo Center here. That is, until he turned toward the shows ringmaster and placidly began to munch on the shiny brim of his rhinestone-embellished top hat.

title: Should We Replace Our Dated Fireplace Surround?
Oscar Ballots in, Best Picture Seems to Narrow to Boyhood vs. Birdman
description: Up until the fourth week of January it, seemed as if the race for the best picture Oscar was pretty much over except for the balloting. More than a dozen national and international critics organizations had anointed Boyhood the years best film and, with few exceptions, longtime awards season prognosticators forecast that the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences would do the same.

title: Reinventing the Rolling Pin
description: While you may roam around your kitchen in search of a clean coffee cup, Kevin M. Vann and his colleagues at KMN Home in Traverse City, Mich., scan theirs looking for something to reinvent. An engineer turned product designer, Mr. Vann recently seized on the rolling pin, which he said was long due for an update. Experience had taught him that two features guarantee the success of any modern object: anodized aluminum and LEDs.

title: Vikings, and Its Discontent Warlord, Begins Its Third Season
description: Sail. Raze. Repeat.

title: Lighten Your Load
description: The new Plank bench (bottom), from Fern, is all about showing off the softer side of wood. You can see it in the thick, rounded over-sides and legs, said the designer, Jason Roskey, which incorporate softness while maintaining a clean shape. Mr. Roskeys other new bench, Sawyer (top), is more traditional and less curvaceous, but has a lightness to it as well, with its open back.

title: Off the Runway: Day 7
description: Scenes from the seventh day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Discounts at Jooneechees, Broadway Panhandler, Desiron and Gracious Home
description: Everything is 50 percent off at Jooneechees, through Feb. 22 (a Giraffe lamp by Alex Marshall, originally $274, is $137; a Striped vase by Jill Rosenwald, originally $104, is $52); 248 Elizabeth Street (Prince Street), 212-343-7313, jooneechees.com.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Your Own Road to Hana
description: Theres a place in Maui where Sara Storys father has owned property since the 1970s. Black sand beaches, waterfalls you hike up to, one tiny, tiny hotel, said Ms. Story, a New York-based interior designer, describing the isolated community of Hana. That destination, along with three others (Vienna, Bora Bora and Bandol, France), formed the inspiration for her latest collection of wallpaper, out next month.

title: A Deal From the 20th NEC Cup in Japan
description: In Mondays column, we left the final of the 20th NEC Cup in Yokohama City, Japan, with four of the 64 boards to be played.

title: A Look Behind the Headlines on Chinas Coal Trends
description: Armond Cohen at Clean Air Task Force has provided helpful context in the face of recent headlines and a Greenpeace analysis focused on what appears to be the first drop in Chinese coal use in a century.

title: The Mystery of Moore
description: Jonathan Chait seems boggled at an op-ed from Stephen Moore, the chief economist at the Heritage Foundation, attacking Obamacare: Not one alleged fact cited in the piece is right. And were not talking about matters of interpretation. CBO has not changed its view that the ACA will reduce the deficit; health costs have not increased faster than before; premiums are not skyrocketing.

title: Film Society of Lincoln Center Lauds Cannon Films
description: My education was Bogart, Cagney and Cooper, the director and producer Menahem Golan once said. Somewhere along the line, jiggling babes and giggling psychos, Sylvester Stallone and a voracious appetite for schlock became part of the mix, too. Mr. Golan is best known for the Cannon Group, the company he ran in the 1980s with his cousin Yoram Globus. The two men and the strange, wonderful and often terrible cinematic world they made are the subject of the buoyantly funny opening-night attraction of this years Film Comment Selects, the annual showcase that invades the Film Society of Lincoln Center on Friday, bringing with it edge and mess, a splatter of guts and some real glory.

title: Sculpture in the Age of Donatello
description: A look at the new show at the Museum of Biblical Art.

title: A Classic Moment by the Pool
description: No doubt youve seen the photo. Two attractive women sit in lounge chairs beside a teal-blue pool, looking fabulous and moneyed. A third, all legs and carefree attitude, strides toward them with a drink in her hand. In the background is a modern glass-and-stone house and purplish mountains. The landscape is idyllic. The sunlight is hazy and golden. You would live inside the photo if you could.

title: John P. Craven, 90, Pioneer of Spying at Sea, Dies
description: John P. Craven, a former Navy scientist whose innovations in ocean technology and exploration led to some of the nations most celebrated feats of espionage, died on Feb. 12 in Hawaii. He was 90.

title: 3 Drugs for an Eye Disease, With Big Price Gaps, Are Found to Be Equals for Many
description: At a time of rising concern over the cost of medicine, a government-funded study has found that three drugs, ranging in price from $50 to $1,950 a dose, are equally effective in treating many cases of a common form of vision loss caused by diabetes.

title: Suzanne Lipschutzs Chelsea Hotel Apartment
description: The founder of Secondhand Rose stays put in a building papered with memories.

title: How the Other Half Builds
description: Richard Landry found his niche fulfilling the dreams of the rich and famous.

title: A Vintage Life in the Chelsea Hotel
description: As the long, slow death of the fractious, former bohemian enclave known as the Chelsea Hotel continues, Suzanne Lipschutz isnt mourning much. Shes moving on.

title: The Victorian Loft
description: Remodeling a TriBeCa apartment built in the 1830s with new fenestrations, modern appliances and wacky animals.

title: The King of the Megamansion
description: Sometimes Richard Landry cant believe how well his life and career have turned out.

title: A Victorian Loft With Creature Comforts
description: When James Ramsey and Jennifer Blumin bought a TriBeCa loft from the 1830s, they were determined to keep all the original details: the old windows, the tin ceilings, the brick walls. You can feel the 19th century here, Mr. Ramsey said, and imagine the gas-lit street.

title: New York Fashion Week: Boss Women Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: March to Honor Dead Prosecutor Highlights Tensions Over Government in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES  Tens of thousands of Argentines flowed into the center of this city on Wednesday for a demonstration in honor of Alberto Nisman, the prosecutor whose mysterious death last month has gripped the country and highlighted tensions over the governments handling of the crisis stemming from accusations he made against Argentinas president.

title: Shopping with Annie Selke
description: Before computers, trays offered ease and convenience. They still do.

title: Trays: The First Laptops
description: Annie Selke is a textiles designer who has built a group of brands that are all about bringing softness and warmth to the home: Pine Cone Hill makes bedding and table linens; Dash & Albert produces rugs; Fresh American focuses on pillows and pet-related products; and Annie Selke Luxe, her latest venture, being introduced March 1, will offer high-end bedding.

title: Were Sorry, Applicants. We Accepted You in Error.
description: Acceptance to a world-class graduate school, in a highly competitive field, offers a path to credentials that open doors throughout a career, a stamp of validation to last a lifetime. Or maybe a few hours.

title: A Broken Heart, a Childs Life
description: Martin Lehmann knew the tale of Baby Rose, born with a heart defect, would not end well. But before it did, he was there to chronicle her life with a loving family.

title: New York Fashion Week: Boss Women Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: Gurus of Camera-Ready Complexions
description: How three of Hollywoods most in-demand skin-care gurus get their clients ready for the red carpet.

title: Fringes, Flares and Rocks
description: Pamela Loves new stardust jewelry collection, bags to carry you into spring and more.

title: Fashion Designers Finally Notice That Hot Dude
description: What are Hot Dudes Reading actually reading. You know the ones, the guys spotted and surreptitiously snapped on the subway with their heads buried in books. In under a month, this anonymous Instagram account, with just over 20 posts, has pulled in more than 300,000 followers, and its safe to assume the draw is not their actual reading matter.

title: Oscars: Picking Academy Award Winners
description: The Carpetbagger wraps up movie awards season with her predictions for who will win Oscars on Sunday night.

title: An Eye on the Street
description: With Dropcam becoming ever more pervasive, Brian X. Chen, a Times reporter, wondered what he would see if he pointed one at the street in front of his home.

title: Maxim, Famous for Skin, Makes a Foray Into Fashion
description: It was mid-January, the beginning of a new year, and at the mens wear fashion shows in Milan and Paris, a new if not exactly unfamiliar face had appeared in the crowd. Among the magazine editors who traffic in mens fashion, this was unusual. The mens industry, unlike the womens, is cozy and small, many of its high-ranking officials more or less tenured. In 2015, the editors of GQ, Details and Esquire celebrate 12, 15 and 18 years at their posts, respectively.

title: Dropcam Keeps an Eye on the Neighborhood
description: SAN FRANCISCO  WHEN I set up a Dropcam last year, my original goal certainly wasnt to become some sort of neighborhood watchdog.

title: Marchesa: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Tricks of the Hairstyle and Makeup Nominees
description: Sometimes a well-placed prosthetic or a stylish mustache are just what an audience needs to buy into a story, as evidenced by this years Oscar nominees for makeup and hairstyling: The Grand Budapest Hotel, Foxcatcher and Guardians of the Galaxy.

title: N.F.L. and American Needle Agree to Settle Lawsuit
description: One of the longest lawsuits involving the N.F.L. appears to be nearing an end. American Needle, a cap maker that sued the league after Reebok became the leagues exclusive apparel provider, agreed to settle its case against the N.F.L.

title: Basketball and Fashion Share the Court
description: This was not your typical fashion party. Waiters in basketball jerseys carried platters of popcorn and mac n cheese. The jewelry designer Jennifer Fisher brandished an orange Givenchy handbag that resembled a basketball. And Jeremy Scott, the Moschino designer, was unfamiliar with the partys host, J. R. Smith.

title: Two Deals Bring Attention to Bankings Safra Family
description: On a single day last fall, two deals were coming together that would draw unusual attention to a banking family that prefers to remain in the shadows.

title: A New Chapter for Oscar de la Renta Begins With Baby Steps
description: And so a page was turned.

title: Illinois Governor Proposes $6 Billion in Cuts and Reducing Pension Benefits
description: CHICAGO  Expecting significant budget shortfalls this year and in the years ahead, Bruce Rauner, Illinoiss new Republican governor, on Wednesday proposed more than $6 billion in cuts in state spending on universities, health care, local governments and other areas and called for sharply reducing pension benefits for state workers.

title: Israeli Court Ruling on Protesters Death Is Criticized
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli Supreme Courts rejection of an appeal for damages by the family of Rachel Corrie, a young American woman who was run over by a military bulldozer in Gaza in 2003 as she protested Israeli Army actions there, has prompted criticism from the family and from Human Rights Watch.

title: Bush Adviser May Skip Campaign to Work for Super PAC
description: Mike Murphy, the Republican strategist who has played a critical role in getting out Jeb Bushs message and rolling out his all-but-certain presidential run, may not end up working for the campaign itself.

title: In New York, Immigrants Advocates Vow to Fight After Judge Halts Obama Programs
description: Immigrants and their supporters gathered on Wednesday at rallies and news conferences in New York and across the nation to denounce a judges order halting President Obamas sweeping executive actions on immigration and to vow a redoubled effort in support of the initiatives.

title: As Health Exchange Sign-Ups Rise, So Do Stakes for Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said Wednesday that 8.6 million people in 37 states had selected or renewed health plans through the federal insurance marketplace, and that most of them would suffer if the Supreme Court blocked premium subsidies for consumers in those states.

title: Ebola Risks Linger, Officials Warn
description: Top United Nations officials on Wednesday warned against complacency over the waning Ebola epidemic in three West African countries and emphasized the difficulty of eradicating the disease that has left nearly 9,400 people dead. Speaking to the General Assembly, Secretary General Ban Ki-moon noted that Liberia had progressed rapidly over the past month and was now reporting fewer than five new cases per week. But new cases have generally been increasing in Guinea and Sierra Leone in recent weeks, and Mr. Ban said that more than half of the newly infected people in those two countries had not been in contact with people known to have been infected. This reminds us that setbacks can quickly follow apparent gains, he said. Dr. David Nabarro, appointed by Mr. Ban to lead the United Nations anti-Ebola effort, also spoke to the General Assembly and expressed concern about unsafe burials of Ebola victims, considered a major source of new transmissions. He said an Ebola-infected corpse, not handled safely, could spread the virus to as many as 30 others.

title: AT&Ts Offer: Share Your Data for Personalized Ads, or Pay More
description: Would you pay an extra monthly fee just to avoid seeing some online ads based on your web browsing history?

title: Ex-Fortune Editor Joins Yahoo Finance
description: Andrew Serwer, the longtime editor of Fortune magazine, will join Yahoo Finance as editor in chief, the company said Wednesday.

title: Vice Media Chief Said to Pay $300,000 for Dinner for 30
description: Never one known for restraint, Vice Medias Shane Smith may now have outdone even himself.

title: Fresh Challenge to Gay Marriage Increases Confusion in Alabama
description: Though most county probate judges in Alabama are now issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples, the fight over the matter continues to simmer in state and federal courts, fueled by two conservative groups that have asked the states Supreme Court to halt the practice.

title: Anna Sui: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: New York Compels 20 School Districts to Lower Barriers to Immigrants
description: Twenty New York school districts found to be blocking access for undocumented immigrant children will be forced to modify their enrollment policies to break down illegal barriers to education, the state attorney generals office said on Wednesday.

title: Alabama Apologizes to India for Police Assault on Indian Visitor
description: The governor of Alabama offered a written apology to the people of India on Tuesday for the severe injuries suffered by an Indian visitor hurled to the ground by a police officer this month.

title: Lying, Lying, Gone? Fans Should Hope So
description: Hasnt everyone had enough of Alex Rodriguez by now? Enough of the lies and the apologies, and then the lies again, and the apologies again?

title: 35 Artists Donate Works to Benefit Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art
description: LOS ANGELES  Many of the artists who voiced strong support  and also criticism  of the Museum of Contemporary Art here during its struggles of the last decade are now lending a hand financially: they have agreed to donate their own artworks for an auction to benefit the museums endowment. Only instead of taking place between courses at some gala dinner, these sales will take place at Sothebys New York, as part of the auction houses flagship contemporary art sale on the evening of May 12 and its day sale on May 13.

title: Acting as His Own Attorney, Defendant in Bomb Case Cross-Examines a Witness
description: A federal jury in Brooklyn on Wednesday watched a defendant who is accused of planning a terrorist attack question a government witness who has admitted to working with Al Qaeda.

title: White House Struggles on Immigration Ruling
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas lawyers, facing what could be months of delay on the White Houses immigration efforts, are struggling for a response to a Texas judges ruling that has imperiled one of the presidents potential legacy achievements.

title: After Former Players Death, Concussion Litigation Against N.H.L. Gains Heft
description: It was more than a year ago that a group of 10 former N.H.L. players sued the league for, in essence, ignoring the growing evidence surrounding the long-term effects of concussions.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 18, 2015
Guantnamo Conviction of Australian Is Overturned
description: WASHINGTON  A military appeals court on Wednesday overturned the terrorism conviction of an Australian whose guilty plea was once hailed as a sign that the tribunal system at the Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, prison would be swift and effective.

title: Pakistanis Try to Nudge Taliban Along the Path to Peace Talks With Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Pakistans top military and intelligence officials have begun pressing the Taliban to sit down for face-to-face discussions with the Afghan government, potentially opening a path for direct peace talks for the first time since the start of the American-led invasion in 2001, according to Western and Afghan officials briefed on the discussions.

title: Indian Guest Workers Awarded $14 Million
description: A federal jury in Louisiana awarded $14 million in damages on Wednesday to five Indian guest workers who said they were lured to the United States with false promises of permanent residency by a Gulf Coast maritime services company and forced to live in inhumane conditions and threatened when they objected to their treatment.

title: An Observance of Ash Wednesday
description: Alexis Delacruz and his daughter Amos Delacruz, 18 months, at Rose of Lima Church in Manhattan. The observance, which uses ashes as signs of penance and mourning, marks the start of Lent, a time of penitence before Easter, which is on April 5.

title: Reverent Tribute to a Coach Befits a Rivalry, and So Does the Game
description: DURHAM, N.C.  At 9:02 p.m. Wednesday, eight minutes before No. 4 Duke and No. 15 North Carolina tipped off the 239th game of their rivalry, players and coaches from both teams huddled at midcourt of Cameron Indoor Stadium.

title: New York City Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Rules Are Suspended on Thursday
description: Because of the Asian Lunar New Year, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Thursday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Unlikely Cause Unites the Left and the Right: Justice Reform
description: WASHINGTON  Usually bitter adversaries, Koch Industries and the Center for American Progress have found at least one thing they can agree on: The nations criminal justice system is broken.

title: Faulted for Avoiding Islamic Labels to Describe Terrorism, White House Cites a Strategic Logic
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama chooses his words with particular care when he addresses the volatile connections between religion and terrorism. He and his aides have avoided labeling acts of brutal violence by Al Qaeda, the so-called Islamic State and their allies as Muslim terrorism or describing their ideology as Islamic or jihadist.

title: Focus on Transportation and Justice System in Connecticut Governors Budget
description: HARTFORD  Gov. Dannel P. Malloy on Wednesday presented a nearly $40 billion two-year budget that proposes to overhaul the aging transportation infrastructure in Connecticut, cuts the state sales tax and revamps the states criminal justice system.

title: Digital Currency
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  If youre looking for the Dramamine, its right here. Todays puzzle by Jason Flinn had a few wild loop-de-LOOPS in it but, if youre reading this, everyones stomachs should be settling down by now.

title: Review: Verit With Anna Camp, About a Memoir or a Tale Barely Like It
description: I doubt my life is so interesting anyone would want to read about it, says the heroine of Verit, a new play by Nick Jones that opened on Wednesday at Lincoln Centers Claire Tow Theater. The confession seems radical, even heretical in todays culture, when a book or three, or several seasons of reality television, could conceivably hang on a recalcitrant hangnail. Mr. Joness play, a comedy-drama that bleeds uncertainly into dark fantasy, deftly satirizes the mania for memoirs that has felled so many trees and fired up so many Kindles.

title: Out of My Mouth Comes Unimpeachable Manly Truth
description: On a cold, sunny New Years Eve in 2014, I am sitting at the edge of my king-size bed at the Four Seasons hotel in New York, munching through a stack of Wagyu beef slices and demolishing a bottle of pinot noir while watching a woman play a man playing a bearded woman on Russian state television. Standing on a stage lit by gleaming chandeliers before an audience of Russias elite celebrities, the parodist Elena Vorobei sings to the tune of Gloria Gaynors I Will Survive, in a crude impersonation of Conchita Wurst, the Austrian drag queen who won the 2014 Eurovision song contest. Vorobei is dressed in a sparkling gown, winking cheekily, scratching at her bearded face and swishing her lustrous wig around. I have a beard! she belts. At one point she throws out a Hitler salute, a gesture thats meant to evoke Austria, Conchitas homeland. The camera pans the laughing audience, cutting for a moment to a well-known actor-singer-writer-bodybuilder and then to one of the shows M.C.s, Russias pop king, the also-bearded Philipp Kirkorov (widely assumed to be gay). The men, who are almost all tanned, in sharply cut suits, grin with unconstrained glee. The bejeweled women wear tight, knowing smiles. Everyone sways and claps.

title: Hong Kongs Umbrella Revolution Isnt Over Yet
description: On the final night of Hong Kongs largest Occupy camp, a crowd of protesters swelled along an empty highway. It had been 74 days since the first canister of tear gas hit democracy supporters armed with only umbrellas, setting off what the city soon came to call the Umbrella Revolution. It had been more than two months since protesters first sat on that street in their raincoats, sleepless and worried that the military would soon arrive. The fear had now dissipated, and on this cool December evening, the atmosphere was raucous and festive. People filled the empty spaces between tents, spilling out of a metro stop and pouring over concrete barriers with the help of carefully constructed wooden steps. They lined up for free souvenirs  silk-screened T-shirts, leather necklaces, protest stickers  and gathered around microphones for open meetings. They threw glitter and snapped photographs. They sang along to pop songs crooned by a man called Bananaooyoo (now a protest icon whose signature color, like that of the protest itself, is yellow). Archivists removed pieces of artwork for safekeeping, and a few activists hung yellow banners: Well be back.

title: Why Not Us Women?
description: By the time Sgt. Madot Dagbinza showed the photographer Michael Christopher Brown a handful of snapshots, shed been fighting with the 42nd Commando Battalion of the Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo for four years. A member of an elite unit, the baby-faced soldier in her mid-20s rarely left the front lines where the Congolese military (known as F.A.R.D.C.) was battling the Rwanda-backed rebel group M23.

title: Richard R. Buery Jr.s Pre-K Letter
description: A letter from Richard R. Buery, a deputy mayor, that private preschool providers will receive this week.

title: The National Fronts Post-Charlie Hebdo Moment
description: St.-Raphal, a resort town on the French Riviera, is subdued in January, suspended in a state of waiting. Its seaside carousel is brilliantly lit but scarcely used, its hotels are mostly shuttered, its streets are nearly deserted by nightfall. On Jan. 16, however, just nine days after French jihadists stormed the Paris offices of the magazine Charlie Hebdo, a crowd gathered in the drizzling rain outside a small St.-Raphal storefront. In summer days past, the shop sold cheap floppy sun hats to tourists on a table outside, but now a pole with a French flag stood there instead, and a banner had replaced the signs of commerce over the door. The space had been converted into a campaign office for two candidates running for local office, both of whom belonged to the National Front.

title: Meet the Unlikely Airbnb Hosts of Japan
description: Let me introduce you to Yoppy. Yoppy is young and friendly and lives in a small apartment in the Shinagawa neighborhood of Tokyo. His full name is Yuhsuke Yoshimoto, but at least with visitors who come to stay with him through his listing on Airbnb, he prefers to go by Yoppy. He wears heavy-framed black glasses, has a boyish haircut and likes to talk to foreigners, even though his English is admittedly poor. In the one photo Ive seen of him  his profile shot on Airbnb  hes wearing a navy blazer, a collared shirt and a thin silver necklace. He smiles at the camera in a pleasant but not overbearing way. It would be hard, I imagine, not to like Yoppy if you were to meet him at a dinner party or at a gathering of pharmacists or financial planners (according to his profile, Yoppy is both a pharmacist and a financial planner), but still that says little about how you would feel when putting your toothbrush on the sink next to his late at night in a city thats far, far from home.

title: New York City Eases Pre-K Rules to Allow Prayer Breaks
description: Starting in September, some children attending taxpayer-funded prekindergarten programs in New York City may have school on Christmas and Thanksgiving. And their school day may be interrupted by a period for religious prayers.

title: As Bobby Parnell Recovers, Mets Hold His Place
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Bobby Parnell, the Mets closer, has had two major operations in the last two seasons: a procedure for a herniated disk in his neck in 2013 and Tommy John surgery in 2014. He has thrown only one inning in about a year and a half. He has sat and watched three young relievers flourish and establish themselves in his absence.

title: The Media Doesnt Care What Happens Here
description: The favelas of Complexo do Alemo, one of the largest urban slums in Brazil, spill across 700 hilly acres in the North Zone of Rio de Janeiro, not far from the citys international airport. Bounded on three sides by bustling highways and on the fourth by a forested ridge, Alemo can no longer grow outward, and so it has grown upward instead, in increasingly unstable conglomerations of quadruple-decker concrete boxes. The grandfather builds the first floor, the son the second, the grandson the third and the great-grandson the fourth, residents like to say. Rebar sprouts from the rooftops, awaiting the installation of the next story and the next generation that will occupy it.

title: The Americans Recap: Paige and Kimberly, Growing Up Too Fast
description: Season 3, Episode 4: Dimebag

title: Behind the Relaunch of The New York Times Magazine
description: Welcome to the new New York Times Magazine. For the past four months, as weve been putting out the magazine you read every weekend, weve also been busying ourselves behind the scenes, crafting something new and different. It is as if we have been bidding our dinner guests adieu each week, busing the dessert plates and then hurrying out to the garage to tinker with our strange creation under a flickering bulb.

title: A Family Affair
description: Gianni Piscitelli, a home cook I met on a recent trip to Naples, grew up cooking with his grandmother, Maria dOrsi, and later with his father, Attilio, in Montesanto, a residential neighborhood of the city. His grandparents were smart: They bought a sprawling place high on a hill with a view of the sea in 1933, when the area was still countryside  a home where the extended family could all live and cook together. What this family has always cooked is the food of Naples. Which is not what I thought it was.

title: The Visitor
description: A year ago, I was teaching in eastern Thailand, and the dean told me I could have free housing on campus. I went to visit the house. There was a professor living there who was planning to move out. You wont be alone, he said.

title: Ava DuVernay Didnt See the Reaction to Selma Coming
description: The filmmaker talks with A.O. Scott about the shifting discussion over Selma.

title: The Great Divide
description: In Lahore, Pakistan, the city where I was born and where I once again live after two decades abroad, my experience of picking up my children from school has recently changed. As of this term, I can no longer enter my daughters kindergarten. I must show an ID card with her photograph at the fortified gate, a rectangular aperture in a high wall, and she is then brought out to me, emerging like a blue-clad fairy from some strange castle.

title: Abide
description: The poet Jake Adam York died of a stroke in 2012, when he was only 40. This poem calls to mind the hymn Abide With Me, a prayer for constancy: In life, in death, O Lord, abide with me. I have been in a plaintive mood recently, as I remember the many friends Ive lost over the years, including Jake. When I read the poem now, I am struck by a kind of prescience in the elegiac lines, as if he were speaking his last words to the beloved, knowing how those of us who lost him must now abide. Poem selected by Natasha Trethewey.

title: How to Cry on Command
description: If you are happy, having the best day ever, you still have to cry, because that is your job, says Ana Brenda Contreras, a veteran of Mexican soap operas, or telenovelas. The genres operatic plotlines require high-volume, wet-cheeked waterworks, and Contreras, who recently played the lead in 162 episodes of Corazn Indomable (Wild at Heart), weeps on camera almost every day during production. TV screens are small  people need to see that tear to feel the emotion, the 28-year-old actor says.

title: Re: Eddie Huang
description: What did I expect? the author, chef and television host Eddie Huang asked in Wesley Yangs Feb. 8 profile. I expected I could change things. Specifically, Huang  whose memoir, Fresh Off the Boat, has been adapted into a sitcom that had its premiere this month on ABC  wants to change pop-culture depictions of Asian-Americans. Culturally, were in an ice age, he told Yang.

title: A History of Success, but an Uncertain Future
description: NEWARK  For Jaromir Jagr, the oldest active N.H.L. player, simply suiting up for games is significant.

title: Why Couldnt She Stand Up for More Than a Minute?
description: She was dizzy  very dizzy. Doctors couldnt tell if it was vertigo or lightheadedness.

title: Can I Ask My Neighbors to Quiet Their Baby?
description: A couple downstairs has started letting their baby cry it out. Having no kids myself, I dont know if this is a valid parenting strategy. What I do know is that it kept me up for an hour at 2 a.m. last night and has woken me up several times this week. Is it within my rights to talk to them about it? J.B., BROOKLYN

title: How to Build a Solid Drinking Library
description: Are there places I like as much as great bars? Yes: great bookshops. And if I had to pick a favorite in the latter category, its Dog Ears Book Barn in the little town of Hoosick, N.Y. Conveniently, its just a little ways down Route 7 from the Man of Kent, one of Americas best bars. A couple of hours spent digging through Dog Ears for treasure, then bringing those books to the Man of Kent and perusing them over a few pints for a few more hours? Thats what I call a perfect day.

title: Should We Stay, or Should We Go?
description: Say youre Holly Golightly in hot water with a librarian in Breakfast at Tiffanys. Lets get out of here. Or youre Danny in Grease, angling to get sweet Sandy alone. Lets get out of here. Or tragic Jack, aboard the flooding Titanic; or Han Solo in Star Wars, gagging on Death Star garbage. Lets get out of here.

title: A True Picture of Black Skin
description: What comes to mind when we think of photography and the civil rights movement? Direct, viscerally affecting images with familiar subjects: huge rallies, impassioned speakers, people carrying placards (I Am a Man), dogs and fire hoses turned on innocent protesters. These photos, as well as the portraits of national leaders like Martin Luther King Jr. and Malcolm X, are explicit about the subject at hand. They tell us what is happening and make a case for why things must change. Our present moment, a time of vigorous demand for equal treatment, evokes those years of sadness and hope in black American life and renews the relevance of those photos. But there are other, less expected images from the civil rights years that are also worth thinking about: images that are forceful but less illustrative.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Fleetwood Macs Tusk
description: There is a species of spider that hunts by releasing chemicals that imitate the sex pheromones of moths. When its prey arrives, high on fantasies of romance, the spider hits it with a sticky blob of web, then devours it. Scientists call this aggressive mimicry.

title: My Dear, Dear, Dear Watson
description: Part of the Internets beauty is the space it affords people to take an idea and run with it ... and run with it and run with it, until they end up miles away from where they started. Among a subset of online superfans of the BBC show Sherlock, solving mysteries is mere window dressing for the real story: one about unrequited love between Sherlock Holmes (Benedict Cumberbatch) and Dr. John Watson (Martin Freeman). This sort of wholesale invention, by viewers, of a romance between fictional characters who are not romantically linked on-screen is a form of something known as shipping (short for relationship-ing, the term can also refer to rooting for actual fictional couples). It is by no means limited to Sherlock  any form of pop culture, from Scandal to One Direction, is fair game  but that show has inspired vast and vivid fictional worlds, completely imagined by shippers who share screenshots, drawings and even entire books speculating about what a dalliance between Sherlock and Watson (or Johnlock, as its known) might look like. These fans wring meaning out of every lingering glance and anguished expression that crosses Cumberbatchs impressively dimensioned face and superimpose their own dialogue atop these moments, amassing a trove of erotic imaginings that is in some respects more compelling than the canon, at least in the unpredictability of the plot twists. For example, one offshoot of Johnlock, known as Fawnlock, imagines Cumberbatch as an ethereal deer, complete with graceful antlers and a speckled coat  and of course his lover, Watson, cradled in his forelimbs.

title: Proenza Schouler: Fall 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Jon Jerde, Architect of Merging Visions, Dies at 75
description: Jon Jerde, an architect whose designs seized on the human yen to shop, merging the mall and downtown, commercial and public space, and faux environments and real experiences, died on Feb. 9 at his home in Los Angeles. He was 75.

title: Joanna McClure Goes Through the Looking Glass
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Word of the Day | migrant
description: migrant  \mi-grnt\  noun and adjective

title: Herald Price Fahringer, a Defender of Free Speech, Dies at 87
description: Herald Price Fahringer, an urbane New York lawyer who forswore most vices himself but who, on free speech grounds, gamely defended Larry Flynt and Al Goldstein when they were accused of distributing pornography, and represented other high-profile clients like Claus von Blow and Jean S. Harris, died on Feb. 12 at his home in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Emails to Florida Reporters Show a Jeb Bush Eager to Engage
description: The email that a Los Angeles Times reporter sent to Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida in April 2006 asked how his early years in Midland, Tex., had shaped him. Attached was an article the reporter had written about the immigration policies of Mr. Bushs brother, President George W. Bush.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 8:30 P.M. (CBS) THE ODD COUPLE Matthew Perry stars as Oscar Madison, a slovenly sports radio host, and Thomas Lennon is Felix Unger, an avowed neat freak, in this remake of the 70s Jack Klugman-Tony Randall sitcom about roommates struggling to survive their divorces. Wendell Pierce plays Oscars agent; Leslie Bibb lives in their building and is willing to date Oscar, but only for sex; and Lauren Graham is his ex-wife. The new show updates the surface details without dissolving the central bond between the two friends, Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times. This is Mr. Perrys third attempt at sitcom success after a decade on Friends, and there is an uneasiness to his performance  in some scenes he looks startled, even frightened  that makes it hard to play off Mr. Lennon, who seems very comfortable as a nervous nelly. That chemistry could come with time, but even if the show flops, its an interesting experiment. In The Big Bang Theory, leading in at 8, Wolowitz (Simon Helberg) gets some startling news as the gang prepares to help Stuart (Kevin Sussman) celebrate the reopening of his comic book store. And in the finale of Two and a Half Men, at 9, rumor has it that Charlie Harper, the character played by Charlie Sheen, may still be alive.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: You have to understand, I am in pain. My son is gone.

title: Corrections: February 19, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: U.S. to Monitor Air Quality in India and Other Countries
description: HONG KONG  The United States says it will expand air-quality monitoring at some overseas diplomatic missions, following several years of reporting pollution data in China.

title: A Broken Heart, a Childs Life
description: Martin Lehmann says that between Afghanistans war and Thailands tsunami, he has photographed so many dead people you wouldnt believe it. Yet nothing has affected him more than Rose, a little girl with half a heart who lived in Copenhagen, his hometown.

title: Good Puzzle News in The New York Times Magazine
description: SPECIAL POST  Good news: Beginning today, the newly redesigned New York Times Magazine has an extra half-page of puzzles, making two pages altogether. The expanded puzzle section will contain three new mini-challenges of various sorts, all in the easy-to-easy/medium range, and all by well-known puzzlemakers. Everything will appear online, too (some of it in the form of PDFs), for Times crossword subscribers.

title: Changes at the Morgue
description: To the Editor:

title: How to Hold Colleges Accountable
description: WASHINGTON  THE problems with college are well known. Too many students arent learning, dont finish and fall deeply in debt. What will make college better? Federal officials, who are already alarmed by soaring tuitions, must tackle the mediocre education and outcomes at many schools with similar urgency.

title: Regulating the Drone Economy
description: Interest in drones has been growing faster than government rules about how they can be used. Thats what makes the Obama administrations  proposed rules for unmanned aircraft by businesses and federal agencies so important. The measures include many good ideas but do not do enough to protect the privacy of Americans.

title: Superfluous Selfie Sticks
description: To the Editor:

title: The F.B.I. and Race
description: To the Editor:

title: Women, Girls and Violence
description: To the Editor:

title: When One Penalty Is Enough
description: Millions of Americans may be in for a shock when they file tax returns and learn that they have to pay a fine for failing to enroll in health insurance in 2014 and an even bigger fine for failing to enroll in 2015 before the enrollment period ended on Feb. 15. While there is nothing they can do to avoid the 2014 fine, which must be paid this year, they could avoid the 2015 fine, payable next year, if the Obama administration allowed them more time to enroll.

title: The Obama Years
description: As the political parlor game increasingly turns to obsessions about the jockeying to become the next president, my thinking increasingly turns to how history will measure the current one.

title: The Cost of a Decline in Unions
description: Like many Americans, Ive been wary of labor unions.

title: For My Mother, One Last Grand Slam
description: We were getting my mother ready for her big day. The indoor tennis facility in Maryland that she had helped build, and then managed for over 20 years, was being renamed in her honor by the Montgomery County Department of Parks. Hundreds of people were coming for the dedication ceremony. Billie Jean King would be there, so there was some cachet attached to the event. Billie Jean King was still somewhat famous. My mother, now 88, had also been famous, a long time ago. Still, this was better than never being famous at all. A dinner was planned at Bethesda Country Club. The day felt festive, like a wedding, people coming in from out of town, everyone getting prepared. Id flown in from California the day before.

title: A Gun on Every Corner
description: Earlier this month  right between Groundhog Day and Valentines Day  Senator John Cornyn of Texas introduced a bill that would allow people from states with lax gun laws to carry their concealed weapons all around the country.

title: Groundhog Day at the Supreme Court
description: Abigail Fisher is back. Yes, the Louisiana State University graduate who back in 2008 really, really wanted to go to the University of Texas and who claims that her race (white) kept her out of her home states flagship university filed a new Supreme Court appeal last week.

title: Lynching in America: A Grim History
description: To the Editor:

title: My Own Life
description: A MONTH ago, I felt that I was in good health, even robust health. At 81, I still swim a mile a day. But my luck has run out  a few weeks ago I learned that I have multiple metastases in the liver. Nine years ago it was discovered that I had a rare tumor of the eye, an ocular melanoma. The radiation and lasering to remove the tumor ultimately left me blind in that eye. But though ocular melanomas metastasize in perhaps 50 percent of cases, given the particulars of my own case, the likelihood was much smaller. I am among the unlucky ones.

title: A Judges Idea for Grand Jury Reform
description: The latest idea for reforming the grand-jury system in cases involving police brutality  from New York States top judge, Jonathan Lippman  is one of several that have drawn attention in the two months since grand juries in Ferguson, Mo., and Staten Island declined to indict a local police officer who had killed an unarmed man.

title: When Freedom Came to Charleston
description: Nearly two dozen fires burned out of control across Charleston, S.C., on Feb. 18, 1865, as the Union Army moved into the city where the Civil War had begun four years earlier. A brutal 545-day siege, the longest in American history, had reduced much of the city to rubble and driven away most wealthy residents, while Gen. William T. Shermans march through the heart of South Carolina  which threatened to cut off Charlestons supply line  had prompted Confederate forces in the city to set fire to cotton supplies and munitions and then evacuate.

title: Air France-KLM to Cut Investments by$680 Million
description: PARIS  Struggling to regain its financial footing after a crippling two-week pilots strike last year, Air France-KLM said on Thursday that it would reduce planned investments in new aircraft and services by more than $680 million over the next two years and would accelerate a cost-cutting drive in the face of stiff competition.

title: Homes for the Homeless
Test Yourself | Lessons From the Court and the Classroom
description: Here are several paragraphs from a Feb. 17 article, Coachs Ph.D. in Psychology Is Applied on Court and in Classroom.

title: Conflict in Myanmar Reverberates Across the Border in China
description: A photo of a young girl holding a Chinese flag is one of many that Chinas online censors have deleted over the last few days in an effort to quell nationalist support for ethnic Chinese rebels in Myanmar.

title: British Regulator to Examine Competition in Investment Banking
description: LONDON  The Financial Conduct Authority of Britain said on Thursday that it planned to review whether competition was working properly in the corporate and investment banking sectors.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Review: In Hamilton, Lin-Manuel Miranda Forges Democracy Through Rap
description: In Review: In Hamilton, Lin-Manuel Miranda Forges Democracy Through Rap, Ben Brantley reviews the musical Hamilton.

title: North Korea Exports Forced Laborers for Profit, Rights Groups Say
description: SEOUL, South Korea  When the North Korean carpenter was offered a job in Kuwait in 1996, he leapt at the chance.

title: Should the Drinking Age Be Lowered?
description: Many states lowered the drinking age to 18 or 19 in the early 1970s, around the same time as the passage of the 26th Amendment granting 18-year-olds the right to vote. But then all 50 states raised it again to 21 when Congress passed the National Minimum Drinking Age Act  for fear of losing a portion of federal highway money. But does a uniform drinking age of 21 work?

title: Throwback Thursday | King Tuts Tomb
description: On Feb. 16, 1923, the burial chamber of King Tutankhamens recently unearthed tomb was unsealed in Egypt. The New York Times called it perhaps, the most extraordinary day in the whole history of Egyptian excavation.

title: Rexam Board to Recommend Investors Accept Ball Takeover Offer
description: LONDON  Rexam, the British maker of aluminum cans, said on Thursday that its board of directors intended to recommend that shareholders accept a takeover offer by Ball Corporation.

title: Student Crossword | China
description: Test your knowledge of China by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: What to Expect on the Last Day of New York Fashion Week
description: The sun is sure to rise, the weathers set (for once) to hold and New York Fashion Week is to tramp through its inevitable finale.

title: Walk Hard. Walk Easy. Repeat.
description: This article appeared in the Feb 22, 2015 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

title: Remembering Malcolm X
description: On the fifty anniversary of the assassination of Malcolm X, a look at the place where the civil rights leader was killed.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: British Planes Intercept Russian Bombers
description: LONDON  The Royal Air Force scrambled warplanes to intercept two Russian bombers off the coast of Cornwall in southwest England, the Defense Ministry said Thursday, as a government minister sounded alarms about the Kremlins intentions elsewhere in Europe.

title: New York Today: Remembering Malcolm X
description: Good morning on this very cold Thursday.

title: Symbols and Stories of Resistance at Hong Kongs New Year Fair
description: Decipher this sequence: 831, 87, 689.

title: E.C.B. Profit Falls on Lower Interest Rates
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank made less profit in 2014 than a year earlier, as it charged banks lower interest rates for loans and spent money setting up a bank supervisory arm.

title: Daily Report: Microsoft Zeroes In on Mobile
description: Microsoft is suddenly a powerful presence on his phone, Nick Wingfield writes in the Machine Learning column.

title: Greeces Request for Loan Extension Is Rejected by Germany
description: BRUSSELS  Greece is headed toward a potentially destructive standoff with Europe after Germany rejected a last-minute request on Thursday to extend its loan program.

title: A Mosquito Solution (More Mosquitoes) Raises Heat in Florida Keys
description: KEY HAVEN, Fla.  In this bite-size community near Key West, like so many other mosquito-plagued spots up and down the Florida Keys, residents long ago made peace with insecticides dropped into town by planes or rumbling by on trucks. Cans of Off are offered at outdoor parties. Patio screens are greeted with relief.

title: Today in Politics
description: To Fix Justice System, Kochs and Critics Make Strange Bedfellows

title: Tsarnaevs Lawyers in Boston Bombing Trial Ask for Change of Venue
description: BOSTON  A three-judge federal appeals panel on Thursday sharply questioned lawyers in the marathon bombing case, challenging assumptions about the ability of prospective jurors to be impartial as the judges weighed whether to move the trial out of Boston.

title: Retreating Soldiers Bring Echoes of Wars Chaos to a Ukrainian Town
description: ARTEMIVSK, Ukraine  As violence continued to plague eastern Ukraine on Thursday, demoralized Ukrainian soldiers straggled into the town of Artemivsk, griping about incompetent leadership and recounting desperate conditions and gruesome killing as they beat a haphazard retreat from the strategic town of Debaltseve.

title: E.C.B. Council Had Eye on Markets in Weighing Asset-Purchase Program
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank conducted an exhaustive debate before deciding last month on measures to avert a catastrophic decline in consumer prices. But on Thursday the first glimpse ever into the deliberations revealed that, in effect, the decision had already been made.

title: Morning Agenda: Britain to Examine Competition in Banking
description: BRITAIN TO EXAMINE COMPETITION IN BANKING | The Financial Conduct Authority of Britain said on Thursday that it planned to review whether competition was working properly in the corporate and investment banking sectors, DealBooks Chad Bray reports. The regulator conducted a similar review of so-called wholesale securities and investment markets last year, and plans to consider looking at the asset management sector this year.

title: HP Targets Cisco and Facebook With New Line of Open-Source Networking Gear
description: Hewlett-Packard said on Thursday that it would sell a new line of networking switches that are manufactured by a Taiwanese company and depend on Linux-based, open-source software from another company.

title: The Upside of Waiting in Line
description: Waiting in line got a bad rap as an ever-present part of the Communist Soviet Union. It could turn out to be a big part of Americas urban future, because some lines are actually useful.

title: Review: Donatello in a Valedictory Show at the Museum of Biblical Art
description: Hard to believe but true: An exhibition that includes three major works from Florence, Italy, by the early Renaissance sculptor Donato di Niccol di Betto Bardi, a.k.a. Donatello (1386-1466), has come to New York, and its not at the Metropolitan Museum of Art or the Frick Collection. Its at the Museum of Biblical Art, a 10-year-old institution not noted for producing once-in-a-lifetime shows, and its a beautiful, soul-stirring exhibition. Its also a terrific valedictory show, as the museum will be leaving its current location at the end of June because of the buildings recent sale by the American Bible Society. Where it may reopen is yet to be determined.

title: Pressing the Case for Performance Pay for Teachers
description: Gov. Bush responds to a Florida columnist on the subject of education.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: In South India, a Low-Key and Cheap Alternative to Goa
description: The ride was brief, albeit a touch hair-raising. Our vehicle, a rickety auto rickshaw, hurtled down residential lanes emblazoned with Communist-friendly graffiti and lined with houses painted in what appeared to be the official state colors of Kerala: teal, hot pink and tangerine. But the pristine coves of Edava beach near Varkala, a coastal town an hour from Keralas capital, Thiruvananthapuram, at the southwestern rim of India, would have been worth far more trouble to get to.

title: Scenes from Koh Mak and Koh Kut
description: Blissfully there is little to do on these islands beyond swimming, sunning and gazing at the coconut groves.

title: Old Thailand Found on Sleepy Islands
description: Under a blazing midday sun in late 2013, Allen Stewart surveyed the scene before him: The Gulf of Thailand, a spectrum of blues, stretched out as far as the eye could see. To the west, the jagged, emerald-hued peaks of Koh Chang emerged; the Cardamom Mountains of Cambodia rose to the east. Thick swaths of palm trees hugged empty white sand beaches below.

title: From Blogger Endorsed by Chinas President, a Little Bit of the Countrys Dark Side
description: Hi, Im China is a New Years video directed by Zhou Xiaoping, a blogger praised last year by President Xi Jinping as a positive influence for the future of arts and culture in the country. Mr. Zhou is known for harsh criticism of the United States and diatribes against people he deems unduly critical of China.

title: Cupids Arrows Wound in Wolf Hall, Skylight, An Octoroon and Big Love
description: The lyricist Lorenz Hart, a star-struck cynic on the subject of human coupling, regularly itemized the painful symptoms that accompany affairs of the heart, like the sleepless nights, the daily fights/The quick toboggan when you reach the heights. And as most of us can testify, love isnt easy under the best of circumstances.

title: New Off Broadway Plays From Melissa James Gibson and Joshua Harmon
description: The British are coming! The British are coming! Yawn.

title: ScienceLogic Raises $43 Million in New Funding Round
description: The business of managing companies information technology systems has become more complex as corporations have adopted so-called cloud systems that rely on outside servers.

title: Over Chess, Everybody Speaks Russian
description: Dear Diary:

title: An Open Egg Donor, Now Reversing the Role
description: I chose my son by clicking and unclicking a series of boxes, not unlike online dating. Some days, Id scroll through all of the redheads. Other days, all of the Jude Law look-alikes. Most of the donors seemed to be some combination of rock star and rocket scientist; they were handsome and witty and engaging. There was no easy way for me to choose from so many flawless (but relatively indistinguishable) men, particularly when this choice would have such a profound impact on both my life and my childs. So I kept browsing around, spending Friday nights curled up with the top 1 percent of the male population.

title: Proof That Women Are the Better Dealmakers in the Senate
description: A couple of enterprising Harvard University students have uncovered proof of what women in the United States Senate have long suspected and claimed: They really are better than men at working together, passing bills and cutting bipartisan deals.

title: A House in Brooklyn, Mint Condition Not Required
description: Back in 2008, when Diana Vaynshenker and Avner Rubinstein were married, she joined him in his condominium at Schaefer Landing in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. He had bought the one-bedroom preconstruction in 2005 when the market was at its peak.

title: After Attacks, Denmark Hesitates to Blame Islam
description: COPENHAGEN  Arrested for stabbing a 19-year-old passenger on a commuter train in November 2013, Omar Abdel Hamid El-Hussein blamed the effects of hashish for his brutal, random and nearly fatal attack, telling a court last December that he had been gripped by wild fear and thought his victim wanted to hurt him.

title: Richard Price: By the Book
description: The author of Clockers and, as Harry Brandt, The Whites regrets reading Sophies Choice in 1982: Never ever read a powerful novel when youre trying to write a novel of your own.

title: Walmart Raising Wage to at Least $9
description: Walmart, the largest private employer in the country, said on Thursday that it would increase wages for a half-million employees, a move that comes amid persistent scrutiny of its labor practices and high employee turnover.

title: In Asia, Tastes of the Sea
description: We asked chefs like David Kinch and Andy Ricker, as well as cookbook writers and food experts, for some of their most memorable experiences with Asia and its seafood.

title: 1915: Neutral Ships Attacked
description: LONDON  The German war against neutral shipping has begun, the first instance of piracy taking place early this morning [Feb. 19], when the Norwegian tank steamer Belridge, a vessel of 7,000 tons displacement, was torpedoed by a German submarine in mid-Channel. The Belridge is now lying off Kingsdown, near Deal, and is badly down by the head. Her captain and some of the crew are still on board the vessel, but eighteen men and the pilot are reported to have left her in one of the ships boats and no news has since been received of them.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Feb. 20, 1915

title: Helen Macdonalds H Is for Hawk
description: If birds are made of air, as the nature writer Sy Montgomery says, then writing a great bird book is a little like dusting for the fingerprints of a ghost. It calls for poetry and science, conjuring and evidence. In her breathtaking new book, H Is for Hawk, winner of the Samuel Johnson Prize and the Costa Book Award, Helen Macdonald renders an indelible impression of a raptors fierce essence  and her own  with words that mimic feathers, so impossibly pretty we dont notice their astonishing engineering.

title: Victorian Lace Blouses Accentuate Diverse Fall 2015 Looks
description: High-collared Victorian lace blouses rounded out many fall/winter 2015 collections over the past week, and were as diverse as the designers who sent them down the runway. Joseph Altuzarra went for a subtly sexy look, as he is wont to do, pairing one with his signature slit skirt (later, he also layered it under luxe fur coats and low V-neck dresses). At Oscar de la Renta, Peter Coppings rendition felt prim and demure  despite being nearly transparent  thanks to the flouncy cream A-line skirt it accompanied. And at Zimmermann, under a 70s-style jumpsuit, a more opaque version felt just as alluring as the others, but with a cooler, more bohemian vibe.

title: Kristin Chenoweth Returns to Broadway in On the Twentieth Century
description: A tiny, chaotic person in a hair-obscuring hat stumbles onstage and drops her sheet music all over the place. She is flustered. She is late to her job, as a pianist accompanying an actress at an audition.

title: If Twitter Users Could Vote
description: Only members of the Academy can determine Oscar winners, but if tweets were votes, Selma would take best picture. Thats going by the numbers crunched by Twitter, which analyzed discussions surrounding contenders in select categories since Jan. 15, when the nominations were unveiled.

title: As Walmart Gives Raises, Other Employers May Have to Go Above Minimum Wage
description: Walmart is the biggest private employer in America, with 1.3 million United States workers. And many of them will soon see a raise, in the latest snippet of corporate news that suggests a firmer job market is starting to enable workers to successfully demand higher pay.

title: Teaching Children About Giving
description: Charitable giving is an important financial lesson for children, but how do you teach it?

title: Woody Johnson, Jets Owner, Will Support Jeb Bush for 2016
description: Woody Johnson, the owner of the New York Jets and a top fund-raiser for the 2012 Republican presidential nominee, Mitt Romney, will support Jeb Bushs likely presidential campaign in 2016.

title: Chinese New Year 2015
description: Year of the goat.

title: 1965: Rebels Seize Saigon
description: A news report about Nguyen Khanh, a South Vietnamese general who survived a coup attempt in February 1965. (britishpathe.com)

title: Block by Block | Astoria-Ditmars
description: The Ditmars section of Astoria is a cultural melting pot with a spacious take on New York living.

title: Block by Block: Astoria-Ditmars, Queens (Video Series)
description: Astoria-Ditmars, Queens is the focus of the next video in our new monthly series, Block by Block. Watch for future installments from neighborhoods around the city.

description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Christopher Logan.

title: New York Fashion Week: Siki Im Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Christopher Logan.

title: New Rules Spur a Humbling Overhaul of Wall St. Banks
description: Nearly seven years after the financial crisis, banks are still churning out profits and wrestling with regulators.

title: Israels Election Videos
description: Rival political parties strike a variety of tones, from humor to somberness, in a series of online videos ahead of Israels March 17 elections.

title: A New Theory on How Neanderthal DNA Spread in Asia
description: In 2010, scientists made a startling discovery about our past: About 50,000 years ago, Neanderthals interbred with the ancestors of living Europeans and Asians.

title: 2 Teenagers Were Eager to Shovel Snow. Then the Police Paid a Visit.
description: One evening last month, the night before a blizzard that threatened the Northeast with a lot of bluster, two young men in central New Jersey decided to take action.

description: A new collection from the photographer and frequent T contributor explores the relationship between light and object.

title: On Terror, Gentle Hand or Iron Fist
description: WASHINGTON  As he sought to rally the world behind a renewed attack on terrorism, President Obama argued on Thursday that force of arms was not enough and called on all nations to put an end to the cycle of hate by expanding human rights, religious tolerance and peaceful dialogue.

title: Gulf Leaders Back Qatar in Its Feud With Egypt
description: CAIRO  The oil-rich Persian Gulf monarchies hinted on Thursday that they had rebalanced their allegiances as their regional umbrella group admonished Egypt, their client, for criticizing Qatar, previously ostracized by its gulf neighbors for its criticism of Egypt.

title: In Online Videos, Israeli Candidates Pursue Likes and Votes
description: JERUSALEM  With a month to go before Israels elections on March 17, the race has turned into a contest of cheeky online videos, with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in the role of an eager babysitter, and from the studios of the center-left Zionist Union a decidedly unsexy Fifty Shades of Black.

title: Jen Psaki to Succeed Jennifer Palmieri as White House Communications Director
description: Jen Psaki, the spokeswoman for the State Department and a veteran of the White House and President Obamas campaigns, will become the presidents communications director, replacing Jennifer Palmieri, who will leave to join Hillary Rodham Clintons fledgling campaign, officials said Thursday.

title: Izakaya
description: Japanese comfort food in the East Village

title: A Bow to Japan, and a Nod to Naples
description: We take really good care of the cabbage, the soft-spoken waiter said, as if that were the only explanation for why the people at my table couldnt stop eating it, this handful of raw cabbage leaves with little adornment beyond salt, a gloss of sesame oil, dark threads of preserved seaweed and sesame seeds flung on top.

title: No Comment Necessary: Giuliani Doesnt Believe Obama Loves America
description: At a Wednesday night dinner featuring Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, the former mayor of New York, Rudy Giuliani, said that President Obama doesnt love the country he leads.

title: Insert German Curse Word Here
description: Germany says no to Greek request.To be fair, I think news reports describing the Greek letter as a complete u-turn and capitulation are wrong. I see this:

title: New York Philharmonics Archive Expands
description: Alan Gilbert will not step down as music director of the New York Philharmonic until 2017, and has yet to announce what he plans to play at his farewell concert. But data released on Thursday by the orchestras Leon Levy Digital Archive makes it easier than ever to see what his predecessors played for their final concerts, and even to read copies of their farewell programs.

title: U.S. Muslims Take On ISIS Recruiting Machine
description: STERLING, Va.  Imam Mohamed Magid tries to stay in regular contact with the teenager who came to him a few months ago, at his familys urging, to discuss how he was being wooed by online recruiters working for the Islamic State, the extremist group in Syria and Iraq.

title: Giuliani Remarks on Obama Anger Democrats at Gathering
description: Talk at a winter gathering for Democrats was dominated on Thursday by some incendiary comments from a prominent Republican who accused President Obama of not loving America.

title: American Express Violated Antitrust Laws, Judge Rules
description: A federal judge ruled on Thursday that a longstanding practice by American Express aimed at keeping customers from using other forms of payment violates United States antitrust laws.

title: Mrs. Piggle Wiggle, Still Rescuing Parents
description: Weve been reading the Mrs. Piggle Wiggle books aloud at our house  and it may have become my favorite read-aloud series of all time.

title: Judge Urges Settlement in Dispute Over Helen Hayes Theater
description: A New York judge on Thursday urged Second Stage Theater, an Off Broadway company, and the owners of the Helen Hayes Theater, a Broadway house, to settle their differences about the sale of the Hayes with her help, rather than continue to litigate the matter.

title: In Strauss-Kahn Trial, France Discards a Privacy Taboo
description: PARIS  As the trial of Dominique Strauss-Kahn comes to a close on Friday, some here are breathing a sigh of relief after cringing, gasping and giggling uncomfortably for weeks while the sexual proclivities of the man once thought likely to become Frances president were paraded before the world.

title: Move by Democrat, 33, Gets Missouri Senate Race Started
description: The 2016 race for a Missouri Senate seat got started in earnest on Thursday with the announcement by Jason Kander, 33, the Democratic secretary of state, that he would seek his partys nomination for the seat now held by Senator Roy Blunt, a Republican.

title: Faces to Watch: Heroes, Sidekicks, Cartoonists
description: The coming season brings exciting challenges for new artists working on and off Broadway.

description: A federal grand jury in Manhattan voted on Thursday to indict Sheldon Silver on the fraud and extortion charges that were the basis of his arrest last month, and led to his ouster as speaker of the State Assembly.

description: Rexam wants to go to the ball, but trustbusters might ruin the party.

title: For Kazuo Ishiguro, The Buried Giant Is a Departure
description: CHIPPING CAMPDEN, England  About a decade ago, Kazuo Ishiguro was 50 pages into a new novel when, uncharacteristically, he was paralyzed by doubt. The novel, a mythic tale set roughly 1,500 years ago in a wild, fantastical England populated by ogres, pixies, knights and dragons, was unlike anything hed ever written. He worried that the setting and the dialogue might seem stilted or silly.

title: Brooklyn Folk Festival Will Expand
description: The seventh annual Brooklyn Folk Festival will feature genre veterans including Michael Hurley and Peter Stampfel alongside next generation torchbearers like Jerron Paxton and Frank Fairfield when it convenes in the borough April 17-19.

title: Kerry Speaks at Conference on Extremism
description: Secretary of State John Kerry, at a meeting in Washington, said that no one group can respond to the threat of extremism, and that there is room for all in the partnership against it.

title: Calvin Kleins Fall 2015 Collection at New York Fashion Week
description: [Watch the live stream.]

title: Indictment of Sheldon Silver
description: A federal grand jury in Manhattan voted in February to indict Assemblyman Sheldon Silver on the fraud and extortion charges that were the basis of his arrest in January and led to his ouster as speaker of the State Assembly.

title: Hes Come Undone
description: Mens style is progressing toward a more delicate aesthetic. Here are some of the poetic undertones of this new look.

title: An American Sniper, His Killer, and Deep Scars Bared for a Jury
description: STEPHENVILLE, Tex.  They went to high school in the same Dallas suburb. They served in the same war. They both came back home mentally bruised and struggling to find their footing.

title: Europe Increases Aid to Italy to Help With Influx of Migrants
description: FLORENCE, Italy  The European Commission on Thursday announced an increase in funds to help Italy deal with an influx of migrants fleeing African and Middle East nations by boat amid a deteriorating political situation in Libya. It pledged 13.7 million euros, or about $15.6 million, to assist with unaccompanied minors and 18 million to extend Triton, Europe's border control operation in the Mediterranean.

title: Winners? Who Call Themselves Knicks?
description: As the N.B.A. All-Star festivities began to unfold last week, a less heralded exhibition kicked off quietly in front of a few hundred fans at the Steinberg Wellness Center in Brooklyn, 10 blocks from Barclays Center.

title: Delaware Courts Pause on the Deal Price Do-Over
description: The latest hedge fund strategy to seek higher returns has hit speed bumps courtesy of the Delaware courts in a recent case involving Ancestry.com.

title: Mens Wears Most Compelling New Collections, on Its Six Hottest New Models
