title: Skiing with the Sports Next Generation
description: The veteran skier Sage Cattabriga-Alosa spent a day skiing with the young talent in Alta, a ski resort in the Wasatch Mountains of Utah.

title: Video: Skiing With the Sports Next Generation
description: Sage Cattabriga-Alosa, a longtime Teton Gravity Research athlete, enjoys the atmosphere of Alta, a ski resort in the Wasatch Mountains of Utah. What makes Alta unique is not only its terrain, which is dotted with natural jumps, but also its large amount of young local talent. Cattabriga-Alosa spent a day skiing with these young guns, who impressed him with their double back flips, 720s and front flips.

title: Explaining Recovery Performance in Europe
description: I was very interested by the new paper by Claeys and Walsh on plucking as an explanation of differential performance in Europe; basically, theyre saying that fast growth has come in countries that previously had deep slumps. But how does that result interact with the result many of us have found, which is that differences in austerity seem to explain a lot? Heres an example of what I find:

title: A Well-Traveled Journeyman (in His First Full Season)
description: Like many young hockey players, Mark Arcobello spent his formative years trekking around New England for youth tournaments. But even the most intense schedule would pale in comparison with Arcobellos road during his first full N.H.L. season.

title: Guccis Barrettes (and Berets) for Fall 2015
description: T shares the best hairstyles from the runways.

title: Obama Derangement and Bush Hatred
description: Elsewhere in the delta of arguments surrounding the questions Scott Walker didnt want to answer, here is Ezra Klein expounding on what he sees as the essential difference between some of the crazier forms of anti-Bush obsessionand the more intense variants of Obama hatred:

title: A Gymnastic and Marketing Success
description: The University of Utah womens gymnastics team has the highest average attendance in womens college sports nearly every year.

title: Shopping With Lilly Bunn
description: Match strikers, a relic of the past, are still useful, especially ones with character.

title: Santander Consumer Reaches $9.35 Million Settlement Over Military Repossessions
description: Santander Consumer USA reached a $9.35 million settlement with the Justice Department on Wednesday over accusations that the company, an auto lender, illegally seized cars from members of the military.

title: Chicory Simple
description: A New Orleans couple decorates in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn.

title: Monetarism in Winter
description: Brad DeLong is writing about cognitive closure on the right, and focuses on the case of Allan Meltzer, the long-time monetarist standard-bearer and co-founder of the Shadow Open Market Committee. Meltzer has been predicting inflation, just around the corner, for six years; the experience apparently has had no impact on his conviction that he understands the economy better than the Fed. And he considers it rude and unprofessional when some of us point out how wrong he has been for how long.

title: Review: The Jack and the Calder Quartet in Concert
description: Georg Friedrich Haass newest string quartet, his eighth, had its first American performance on Tuesday evening at the Miller Theater at Columbia University. And its second, too.

title: Pictures of the Day: South Africa and Elsewhere
description: South Africa and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Bariatric Surgery Reduces Pregnancy Problems in Obese Women
description: Weight-loss surgery may help obese women have safer pregnancies and deliver healthier babies, compared with women who do not undergo surgery, according to a major new study.

title: Researchers Warn on Anesthesia, Unsure of Risk to Children
description: Faced with mounting evidence that general anesthesia may impair brain development in babies and young children, experts said Wednesday that more research is greatly needed and that when planning surgery for a child, parents and doctors should consider how urgently it is required, particularly in children younger than 3 years.

title: Strippers Go Undercover on Snapchat
description: Porn, it has been said, is a driver of technology.

title: Future Brown, Confident Song Collective, Cooks New Stews
description: We were supposed to have reached the singularity by now, no? That place where the underground scenes that were born in opposition to the mainstream excess of the 1980s and 1990s and 2000s would, through the Internet, come to rest comfortably next to, and inside of, pop. The old distinctions were meant to be relics; now that anyone can get anything at any time, hierarchies were doomed. Right?

title: Feb. 25, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from South Africa, Spain, Ukraine, and Afghanistan.

title: Review: In Mo Yans Frog, a Chinese Abortionist Embodies State Power
description: When the Chinese writer Mo Yan won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2012 and was warmly lauded by the Communist government, he became one of the most reviled winners in the history of that great honor. Among the more benign accusations lobbed at him was that he was undeserving. Herta Mller, a fellow literary laureate, called the choice a catastrophe;  Salman Rushdie called him a patsy for not supporting the jailed Chinese Nobel laureate and dissident Liu Xiaobo; and he was labeled an apologist for not denouncing the government. By the time he made his acceptance speech, Mr. Mo said he felt as if he were watching a play about someone else.

title: Review: Paulo Szots Commanding Take on Bossa Nova at 54 Below
description: A wrenching adjustment is required to accept performances of classic bossa nova songs sung in a voice more commanding than an intimate near whisper. Even Frank Sinatra, who recorded two albums of songs mostly composed by bossa novas founding father, Antnio Carlos Jobim, shed his swinging ring-a-ding-ding persona to adopt the murmur of an enraptured lover.

title: Despite Distractions, Rory McIlroy Finds Refuge in What He Does Best
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla.  On the 17th tee of his pro-am round at the Honda Classic on Wednesday, Rory McIlroy struck up a conversation with Mike Collis, an executive officer in the Coast Guard who served as his caddie for the hole. For about 15 minutes, they spoke animatedly about strength training, a shared passion.

title: App Smart | Think Happy Thoughts
description: Mindfulness training has arrived on the smartphone. Three apps help motivate you to meditate and teach you new techniques.

title: Video Feature: Apps for Meditation and Calming on iPhone and Android
description: THE smartphone can be a wicked tool for distraction and complication. But it doesnt have to be. Your smartphone can actually be an agent of calm, relaxation and mindfulness.

title: Flume Rises in the E.D.M. World
description: In 2011, a young musician in Australia named Harley Streten began posting electronic dance tracks online under the name Flume. Every morning before heading off to work at a magazine shop, he checked the site, SoundCloud, to see how many people were listening.

title: Boris Bidjan Saberis Mad Method
description: Boris Bidjan Saberi had a cold. Or the flu. Something like that. Anyhow, the point is he was sick, and it was an unusual state of affairs in his atelier. Look at a picture of him: Hes a hardy guy, strong, resilient. But this time, he was under the weather, and that was a problem.

title: The Wanderers
description: A couple determined to enjoy one more adventure has been traveling the world from home rental to home rental.

title: Kelly Links Get in Trouble and Five Other Works
description: GET IN TROUBLE

title: Review: Kate Weare Company Celebrates 10th Anniversary at BAM Fisher
description: In the decade since she founded her company, the choreographer Kate Weare has definitely figured out how to make a duet  a certain kind of duet, with lots of tension, sexual and otherwise, between the parties. This became clear last Thursday at BAM Fisher, where her troupe is offering a retrospective of sorts: three duets from 2007 to 2010; a new duet inspired by one of those older ones; and the early stages of a developing trio.

title: A Plot to Keep Teeth Whitening Expensive
description: The Supreme Court made the right call today by ruling against a state dental board that tried to limit competition from salons, spas and other businesses.

title: A Fierce Combat Boot Stomps Down Fausto Puglisis Fall 2015 Runway
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Review: Schuberts Winterreise With Christian Gerhaher
description: Singers are sometimes understandably tempted to infuse Schuberts Winterreise (Winter Journey) with melodramatic touches and theatrical poses. Schubert finished this cycle of 24 songs, depictions of loneliness, bleakly frozen landscapes and heartbreak, a few days before dying at 31, likely of complications from syphilis.

title: England Triumphs at the Junior Camrose in Wales
description: It is interesting to watch potential stars of the future during their formative years as they compete at international events.

title: How NOLA Can You Go?
description: In early 2006, Morgan Babst was wandering around by herself at a Katrina benefit at the Museum of the City of New York, after her brother stood her up, gamely introducing herself to other attendees like Scott Habig, whom she encountered at the bar.

title: In Case of LOral Heiress, a Private World of Wealth Becomes Public
description: BORDEAUX, France  For five weeks, a French version of Downton Abbey has been unfolding in a courtroom here, providing a rare glimpse into the discreet lives of the ultrarich.

title: Whats a Credible Threat in Wisconsin? Unions.
description: On Tuesday evening, a Republican committee chairman in the Wisconsin state senate, Stephen Nass, cut short a hearing on an anti-union bill, citing a credible threat that union members were about to disrupt the proceedings.

title: Whats New in Space Heaters
description: A new generation of heaters has improved safety and efficiency. And some even look good.

title: Beauty and the Heat
description: Its been a rare winter of cheap heating oil, but many homeowners still waste money heating entire sections of the house instead of warming smaller chunks of space where they actually spend their time.

title: A Modern Catskills Country Inn Offers Throwback Pleasures  Ice Fishing Included
description: Just outside the small town of Livingston Manor, about two hours north of New York City, a unique winter weekend sojourn awaits in the rural western Catskills called the Arnold House  a nine-room country inn situated on seven acres atop Shandelee Mountain, surrounded by glistening, mountaintop lakes and snowcapped farmlands. And this weekend, the property welcomes its first winter with an inaugural Ice Fishing Derby. Provisions include hand-warmers and fishing kits, and the winner will have a cocktail named in their honor at the inns 75-seat Tavern, a cozy stone room lined with taxidermy and outfitted for billiards.

title: Match Strikers: Making Sparks Fly
description: The rooms that Lilly Bunn designs are traditional, but in a cleaned-up sort of way  not that chintzy, stuffy look of the 1980s, she said.

title: Reducing Spectacular to Simple
description: In a world glutted with crystalline digital images of buildings to be scrolled, scanned and pinned, Hlne Binets architectural photography stands out for its reserve, its simplicity and an ineffable quality that comes from shooting on film. Her images can reduce a complex building on a spectacular site, like Le Corbusiers monastery at La Tourette, to a series of vertical lines.

title: After Midnight, D.C. to Find Out What Legal Marijuana Is All About
description: At 12:01 a.m., marijuana becomes legal in the District of Columbia.

title: A Crime Reporter Teams Up With a (Comic Book) Crime Fighter
description: Last weekend, Michael Wilson, who writes the Crime Scene column for Metro, filed an unexpected follow-up story.

title: Chinese Leader Is Putting His Alliances on Parade
description: Last year the National Peoples Congress set Sept. 3 as a new Chinese holiday to commemorate the defeat of Japan in World War II. At the time people here took notice, but there was little debate.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Material Matters
description: With their clean lines, minimal hardware and marble tops, Egg Collectives new Morrison Storage Collection pieces for Design Within Reach could easily be mistaken for vintage designs. The console, credenza/sideboard and dresser were created by looking at minimalist art and early American furniture forms, Shaker, Colonial furniture, said Stephanie Beamer, a partner in Egg Collective with Crystal Ellis and Hillary Petrie. And taking inspiration from those forms, but really paring them down while elevating the materials.

title: Putting a Dent in College Costs With Open-Source Textbooks
London Designers Beg to Differ
description: A government call for austerity doesnt reach the runways.

title: Bottoms Up in a Recycled Chandelier
description: In 1997, the designer Tord Boontje and the sculptor Emma Woffenden began making vases and drinking vessels in their London studio out of a somewhat unorthodox material: recycled wine and beer bottles. Called tranSglass, their creations soon landed in the Museum of Modern Arts collection and spawned a workshop in Guatemala City, where artisans now produce the pieces for the accessories company Artecnica.

title: Winter Relief in Bloom
description: Starting Saturday, a profusion of frilly blooms will take the edge off winter in the New York Botanical Gardens annual Orchid Show. Arranged in hanging baskets conceived as chandeliers, the blossoms will be high and low and as far as the eye can see, said Todd Forrest, the gardens Arthur Ross vice president for horticulture and living collections. More than 30,000 orchid species grow in the wild, Mr. Forrest said, which makes them something like the beetles of plant life. Asked for another fun fact, he mentioned a variety that resembles female wasps and is pollinated with the assistance of male wasps buzzing from plant to plant in their futile attempts to mate.

title: Cold Wind Can Take a Back Seat
description: The Rug Company has just added alpaca blankets to its offerings. And the patterns are a lot more subdued than one may expect, given the fanciful floor coverings by artists and designers that the company is known for.

title: Lawmakers Seek Information on Funding for Climate Change Critics
description: Democratic lawmakers in Washington are demanding information about funding for scientists who publicly dispute widely held views on the causes and risks of climate change.

title: Dustin Yellin Sculptures at City Ballet
description: The third annual Art Series, which invites artists to install large-scale works in the David H. Koch Theater, ends on Friday.

title: New York City Ballet Applies a Surreal Touch to Build Audiences
description: There seemed to be an explosion of young men in knit caps and young women in leather pants watching as New York City Ballet recently performed a trio of Balanchine classics. In fact, the average age in the David H. Koch Theater seemed to have dropped by years, if not decades.

title: Food Waste Is Becoming Serious Economic and Environmental Issue, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  With millions of households across the country struggling to have enough to eat, and millions of tons of food being tossed in the garbage, food waste is increasingly being seen as a serious environmental and economic issue.

title: Sales at Crate & Barrel, Zinc Details, Global Table an Minam
description: All bedding is 20 percent off at Crate & Barrel, through March 2 (Marimekko Kesahelle duvet covers and pillow shams, originally about $40 to $150, are about $32 to $120; Nantucket sheet sets, in photo, originally about $30 to $150, are about $24 to $120); 800-967-6696, crateandbarrel.com.

title: Deep Sympathy for Derrick Rose, the Bulls Star-Crossed Star
description: The cloud of uncertainty that had engulfed Derrick Rose of the Chicago Bulls since 2012 was beginning to recede. Then came the news late Tuesday night that Rose  a former N.B.A. rookie of the year and most valuable player  would need his third major knee operation in less than three years.

title: The Reworked Military Jacket Makes It Big and More
description: Military jackets shed the surplus look; cellphone cages from Anndra Neen; a new label that aims to bring something a little quieter to contemporary fashion; and more.

title: A Grand Tour With 46 Oases
description: What does it take to be a Senior Nomad?

title: Review: Ronald K. Browns Evidence Presents 30th Anniversary Season
description: Thirty years ago, a 19-year-old choreographer from Brooklyn decided to take a chance on himself. He formed a dance company called Evidence to pay homage to aspects of life that most people ignore until they hit middle age: family, teachers, faith.

title: Otter Box, a Sunday Party for Hirsute Gays
description: Why go to a gay bar these days when you can specify a niche like twinks, bears, muscle queens and Hellsea gays?

title: A.D.H.D. Diagnosis Linked to Increased Risk of Dying Young
description: People with a diagnosis of attention deficit disorder are at higher risk of dying young than those without the disorder, usually in automobile crashes and other accidents, suggests research reported on Wednesday, from the largest study of A.D.H.D. and mortality to date.

title: A Faster Way to Try Many Drugs on Many Cancers
description: Chemotherapy failed to thwart Erika Hurwitzs rare cancer of white blood cells. So her doctors offered her another option, a drug for melanoma. The result was astonishing.

title: A Legacy More Lasting Than Bronze
description: A look at a new show of works by the Venetian printer Aldus Manutius, at the Grolier Club in Manhattan.

title: Goodbye to All That
description: This February, the last fashion show was staged at Lincoln Center. In the fall, the shows will be held downtown. Here, the final days are documented.

title: In The Studio | Donatella Versace
description: Donatella Versace, who became chief designer after the murder of her brother Gianni, chats with Vanessa Friedman about how her Milan office reflects her pain and inspires her to keep Versace relevant.

title: Fashion Says Goodbye to Lincoln Center
description: A week ago, the last fashion show was staged at Lincoln Center. Come fall, fashion will head downtown. The Lincoln Center complex, home of New York Fashion Week since 2010, was often less than loved, tainted as it was by complaints of overcrowding and commercialism. All the same, it was the site of scores of shows this month. Here, those final days are documented.

title: Back in the U.S.S.R.
description: Arthur Tresss latest offering from his archives comes from a 1967 trip to Russia, where he chronicled daily life amid Soviet pageantry.

title: Shopping Sales and Events in New York City
description: Get colorful with Bloomingdales: The department store has teamed up with Crayola and a number of contemporary designers to create exclusive looks in a rainbow of hues. Stop by the second floor at 59th Street on Thursday at 6 p.m. to shop items like a Rebecca Taylor jacquard culotte jumpsuit ($450) and a Nanette Lepore shift with lace overlay ($450)  and to try out a photo booth that creates coloring pages in your outline. On Friday, the buy-one-give-one shoemaker TOMS is opening its first New York City shop. There you can enjoy treats from a coffee bar serving TOMS Roasting Co. coffee as well as One Girl Cookies. Youll also find the brands full range of slip-ons as well as the new TOMS Handbags line, which includes an ikat duffel ($148) and cognac leather canvas backpack ($248); purchases help provide training and materials for safe births. At 264 Elizabeth Street.

title: Ondria Hardin Transforms at Fausto Puglisi
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall 2015 Fashion Week in Milan. Here, the model Ondria Hardin before (left) and after (right) makeup by Lucia Pieroni and hair by Franco Gobbi.

title: Morgan Stanley in $2.6 Billion Settlement Over Crisis in Mortgages
description: Morgan Stanley said on Wednesday that it had reached a $2.6 billion settlement with the Justice Department over the sale of mortgage securities before the financial crisis.

title: HP Said in Talks to Buy Aruba Networks
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Hewlett-Packard is in talks to buy Aruba Networks, a maker of WiFi access equipment for businesses, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

title: Justices Find Antitrust Law Valid Against Dental Board
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday ruled that a state dental board controlled by dentists may be sued under antitrust laws for driving teeth-whitening services out of business.

title: Kerry Reminds Congress Netanyahu Advised U.S. to Invade Iraq
description: Secretary of State John Kerry reminded Americans on Wednesday that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, who is expected to denounce a potential nuclear deal with Iran during an address to Congress next week, also visited Washington in late 2002 to lobby for the invasion of Iraq.

title: Doctor Who Survived Ebola Says He Was Unfairly Cast as a Hazard and a Hero
description: Dr. Craig Spencer, New Yorks first and to date only Ebola patient, said in an essay published on Wednesday that he was falsely accused of putting the public at risk and was superficially depicted as a fraud, a hipster and a hero after he was hospitalized last fall.

title: Shale Gas Project Encounters Determined Foes Deep in Algerian Sahara
description: ALGIERS  Deep in the Algerian Sahara, daily protests against a pilot hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, project are now well into their second month. The demonstrations have spread to several towns and have provided opposition parties with a new platform at an especially precarious moment for the government, as oil prices have slumped and the declining health of President Abdelaziz Bouteflika has removed him almost completely from public view.

title: Edible Coffee Cup in KFC Tests in Britain
description: Diners at KFC restaurants throughout Britain soon will be able to have their coffee  and eat the cup, too.

title: Dori J. Maynard, Who Sought Diversity in Journalism, Dies at 56
description: Dori J. Maynard, a journalist who was at the forefront of the campaign to make the American news media a more accurate mirror of American diversity, died on Tuesday at her home in Oakland, Calif. She was 56.

title: In a Case of Religious Dress, Justices Explore the Obligations of Employers
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. on Wednesday warned that this is going to sound like a joke, and then posed an unusual question about four hypothetical job applicants. If a Sikh man wears a turban, a Hasidic man wears a hat, a Muslim woman wears a hijab and a Catholic nun wears a habit, must employers recognize that their garb connotes faith  or should they assume, Justice Alito asked, that it is a fashion statement?

title: State Closes an Illegal Hotel in Manhattan That Was Hiding in Plain Sight
description: The tall, slim tower on East 34th Street in Midtown Manhattan looked like dozens of other moderately priced hotels that have sprung up in New York City over the past decade.

title: Next Goal for Walmart Workers: More Hours
description: For Anthony Rodriguez, every diaper for his 2-year-old son means less money to put food on the table, or to fill up his car at the gas station. His fiance, Melinda Prothero, tries to make each diaper last longer, but theres a limit to that, he says.

title: Insanity Defense Fails in Killing of the Former Navy Sniper Chris Kyle
description: STEPHENVILLE, Tex.  It took two years for Eddie Ray Routh to face murder charges in the killings of the former Navy SEAL sniper Chris Kyle and his friend in 2013, and two weeks for his trial to conclude. In the end, a jury of 10 women and two men took about two hours on Tuesday night to reject Mr. Rouths claims that he was legally insane, find him guilty and, in effect, send him to prison for life.

title: Anthony B. Herbert, Decorated War Hero Turned Army Whistleblower, Dies at 84
description: During World War II, he ran away to join the Marines, but was sent home the next day because he was just 14. He enlisted in the Army three years later and, bemedaled with four Silver Stars, four Bronze Stars and four Purple Hearts, became the most decorated enlisted man during the Korean War. He volunteered for service in Vietnam, where, as a lieutenant colonel, he earned a Silver Star, two Bronze Stars, an Air Medal and an Army Commendation Medal in only 58 days of combat.

title: At a Brooklyn Cherry Factory, a Suicide and an Illicit Discovery
description: There was no sign on the former brick factory on the treeless block in Red Hook, Brooklyn, where Arthur Mondella worked. No name on the door. Nothing  other than the bright-red liquid trickling onto the sidewalk and into the gutter, and the thick scent of syrup on a summers day  to announce the presence of one of the countrys largest suppliers of maraschino cherries.

title: Taking Aim at Icicles to Keep Trains Moving Into and Out of New York
description: The rail tunnels that connect New York City and New Jersey are 105 years old, and the technique that Amtrak employees have been using to keep trains running through them this frigid winter is hardly more modern.

title: Scott Walker Is Set to Deliver New Blow to Labor in Wisconsin
description: MADISON, Wis.  It was a flashback to 2011: Hundreds of union members in hard hats and work boots waved signs under falling snow, denouncing Gov. Scott Walker and his fellow Republican lawmakers outside this Capitol building on Wednesday. Yet this time, their numbers were smaller, their chants softer.

title: Jordan: U.S. Warns of Threat to Malls
description: The United States Embassy in Jordan on Wednesday warned American citizens to avoid high-end shopping malls in Amman, the capital, because of credible threats of terrorist attacks. The embassys statement contained no information about the type or timing of any possible attack, but it advised Americans in the country and embassy employees and their families to avoid the malls in the next few days. Extremist groups have repeatedly expressed interest in attacking so-called soft targets, such as malls and restaurants in Jordan, it said. The spokesman for Jordans government, Mohammad Momani, said security measures had already been stepped up because of regional events. Jordan is taking part in the campaign against the Islamic State group, which recently killed a captured Jordanian pilot and released a video showing his grisly death.

title: Eugenie Clark, Scholar of the Life Aquatic, Dies at 92
description: Eugenie Clark, whose childhood rapture with fish in a New York City aquarium led to a life of scholarly adventure in the littorals and depths of the Seven Seas and to a global reputation as a marine biologist and expert on sharks, died on Wednesday at her home in Sarasota, Fla. She was 92.

title: South Korean Island Grows Wary After Welcoming the Chinese
description: DAEJEONG, South Korea  Not far from Shin Yong-kyuns strawberry farm are the crumbling remains of an airfield that Japanese colonialists built in the 1930s, to launch air raids against China, and the coastal caves they gouged out to hide their warships.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 25, 2015
Talk Toughens as U.S.-Israel Relations Fray
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obamas national security adviser sat down with her Israeli counterpart at the White House last week, she upbraided him over leaks in Jerusalem that the Americans interpreted as an attempt to undermine nuclear negotiations with Iran.

title: Inquiry Into Working Families Party Spurs Charges Against Officials Ex-Aides
description: A yearslong investigation into the Working Families Party, the influential left-leaning group that helped fuel the rise of Mayor Bill de Blasio, has resulted in the indictments of two former aides to a Staten Island city councilwoman.

title: Review: Brooklynite, a Superhero Musical With Matt Doyle and Nicolette Robinson
description: Its not easy being a superhero charged with protecting Brooklyn. Making sure all that fresh produce makes it from farm to table. Breaking up fights at the Park Slope Food Co-op. Preventing French tourists from falling into the Gowanus Canal. These and other daily challenges are the responsibility of six superpower-endowed men and women fighting the good fight in Brooklynite, a slight but goofily endearing new musical that opened on Wednesday at the Vineyard Theater.

title: De Blasio, in Albany to Discuss Budget, Faces Competition From Cuomo
description: ALBANY  With 12 hours notice, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo convened an all-hands-on-deck cabinet meeting in the Capitol on Wednesday that focused on three issues: a previously announced plan to battle sexual assault on college campuses, a previously announced plan to expand prekindergarten, and a previously announced snowmobiling event.

title: Its All a Plot
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  I think Caleb Emmons is asking for a raise. You might not have picked up on this, but I did. I became a big believer in subliminal messages after majoring in Strategic Guessing in college. The university insisted on calling it Marketing, but guessing  as in, Were pretty sure consumers wont sue us for selling them this product  was much closer to the truth.

title: As Vote Nears, Watchdog Agency Criticizes Netanyahu on Housing Costs
description: JERUSALEM  In another potential blow to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who faces his countrys voters in less than three weeks, Israels government watchdog issued a harsh report on Wednesday chronicling the failure of successive Israeli governments in dealing with a growing housing crisis  mostly on Mr. Netanyahus watch.

title: Reconsidering Notion of Mercy After a Basketball Rout in Brooklyn
description: The odds were long for Brooklyn Collegiates girls varsity basketball team going into the playoff game on Tuesday night. They were 1-14 for the season. Their opponents, Francis Lewis High School, were 13-3 and the defending city champions, and had beaten them earlier in the season by 85 points.

title: Mark Teixeira Changes His Plate Philosophy, but Only When It Comes to Meals
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Mark Teixeira arrived Wednesday for the start of spring training, declaring himself a changed man. No longer does he eat sandwiches or muffins, and when his children eat pancakes for breakfast, he joins them with a plate of turkey bacon and a veggie smoothie. (For inquiring minds, coconut yogurt, spinach and frozen berries are the go-to ingredients.)

title: Mets Noah Syndergaard Looks to Build on Disappointing Season
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Noah Syndergaard was brushing his teeth last September, the day after his minor league season had ended, when he noticed he had missed a call from Sandy Alderson, the Mets general manager.

title: M.T.A. Chief Tries to Ease Alarm on Budget Gap, but Warns of Risks to Projects
description: The chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority on Wednesday sought to reassure New Yorkers that the agency would secure the necessary funding to forestall what transit experts were warning about  a slump in service, overflowing subway trains and more frequent delays.

title: After Deadly Infections, F.D.A. Asks Device Makers About Cleaning Methods
description: The Food and Drug Administration never reviewed data from manufacturers regarding the procedures needed to clean the complex medical devices that recently infected seven patients with drug-resistant bacteria, an agency official acknowledged on Wednesday.

title: Massachusetts: Opening Is Set in Boston Marathon Bombings Trial
description: Opening arguments in the Boston Marathon bombings trial are set to begin Wednesday. After 21 days of interviews, Judge George A. OToole Jr. of Federal District Court has found 70 people he says are qualified to serve, a court official said. They are to face peremptory challenges Tuesday as lawyers whittle their number to 12 jurors and six alternates. Still outstanding is a ruling on a defense motion to move the trial outside Boston because of apparent prejudice against the defendant, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, 21.

title: Indictment After the Working Families Party Investigation
description: An indictment was revealed on Wednesday against former aides to a city councilwoman from Staten Island and her campaign.

title: Death Toll FromC. Difficile Is Raised
description: The deadly bacterial infection Clostridium difficile is estimated to have afflicted almost half a million Americans and caused 29,000 deaths in 2011, according to a study by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention published Wednesday in The New England Journal of Medicine. The estimate is drawn from laboratory testing and reporting in 10 states and is larger than previous figures based on narrower data sources. C. difficile causes severe diarrhea and colon damage and is linked to overuse of antibiotics. The study estimated that 24 percent of cases occurred in hospitals and 40 percent began in nursing homes or community health care settings.

title: After Twitter Outburst, More Frowns for Knicks
description: BOSTON  Phil Jackson, the Knicks president, may not have built a quality N.B.A. team this season, but at least he has built a following on Twitter.

title: The Americans Recap: Intimacy in the Line of Duty
description: Season 3, Episode 5: Salang Pass

title: Boy, 3, Is Found Dead in Familys Brooklyn Home
description: A 3-year-old boy was found dead in his familys apartment in Brooklyn on Wednesday, the police said.

title: Farewell, Eugenie Clark, the Lady With the Sharks
description: Im missing Eugenie Clark, the shark lady, tonight. She died on Wednesday at age 92 at her Florida home.

title: Springs Quiet Leather Kicks
description: After seasons of loud, colorful trainers comes the welcome respite of white sneakers.

title: Watches With Retro Manly Appeal
description: Sturdy stainless steel timepieces with retro manly appeal get a contemporary jolt from dark dials.

title: A Photo Book, With Words
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Word of the Day | insubordination
description: insubordination  \in(t)-s-bor-d-nt, -bord-nt\  noun

title: What Is Middle-Class Economics?
description: An awkward truth for politicians looking to help the middle class is that theres much less the government can do for them than for the poor. So, the president has picked an opportune time to set his mantra to middle-class economics: a time when middle-class economic fortunes are already improving for reasons not much related to policy.

title: Back in the U.S.S.R.
description: Correction appended.

title: Senate Panel Expected to Endorse Lynch as Attorney General
description: Almost four months after Loretta E. Lynch was picked by President Obama to be the next attorney general, the Senate Judiciary Committee is expected to approve her nomination on Thursday, with a handful of Republicans joining the committees Democrats in backing her.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 10 P.M. (CBS) THE VICTORIAS SECRET SWIM SPECIAL Adriana Lima, Candice Swanepoel, Lily Aldridge, Behati Prinsloo, Alessandra Ambrosio, Joan Smalls and other beauties brave jungle treks and underwater shoots in Puerto Rico as they are photographed for the Victorias Secret swimwear campaign, accompanied by music from Maroon 5 and Juanes.

title: Q. and A.: Jiang Rong on Wolf Totem, the Novel and Now the Film
description: When the novel Wolf Totem was published in China in 2004, it became an overnight sensation. Readers of all ages and occupations embraced the story of a Han Chinese student sent to Inner Mongolia during the Cultural Revolution.

title: Lunar New Year Casualties Include Siberian Tiger
description: When a couple in eastern China called the police about the tiger splayed dead and bloodied in a parking lot below an 11-story building, they encountered some skepticism. Perhaps Lunar New Year excesses had taken their toll, the officer suggested.

title: Corrections: February 26, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Liliane wanted to do things for me, to ease my life. I refused things like a mansion. But she took it so poorly. Its really hard to cross that extraordinary woman.

title: Arms Control for a Cyberage
description: A recently disclosed document from the National Security Agency about the escalation of cyberattacks between the United States and Iran presents a chilling summary of how swiftly cyberwarfare developed from the first salvos against Irans nuclear program a few years ago to a full-fledged cyberarms race.

title: Gun Rights for Terrorists
description: NORTHFIELD, Minn.  EACH day, it seems there are new reasons to heed the growing threat of domestic terrorists. Just last Saturday, a radical Islamist group posted a video urging an attack on the Mall of America in Bloomington, Minn. In response, the secretary of Homeland Security, Jeh C. Johnson, advised visitors there to be particularly careful.

title: The Chronically Homeless
description: To the Editor:

title: A Cheer for James Dolan and Madison Square Garden
More Syrian Horror: Aiming at Doctors and Hospitals
description: To the Editor:

title: Adieu, Chris Christie, Adieu
description: Chris Christie is political toast.

title: Monuments to Americas Past, and Future
description: A historic industrial district in Illinois, a weed-choked gulch in Hawaii and a stretch of riverine Colorado wilderness, home to eagles and bears. These three dissimilar American places are the newest national monuments, established this month by President Obama, to be protected forever by the federal government from development and destructive neglect.

title: Budgeting Ethics in Albany
description: When Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced amendments to the state budget last week, tucked inside were important ethics requirements, including rules on outside income. Lawmakers  many of whom are lawyers  would have to reveal their private income, the names of clients and what they did to earn their fees.

title: Can There Be Good Mental Asylums?
The Human Stain
description: SINJIL, West Bank  The Israeli elections scheduled for March 17 should constitute a triumph, a celebration of democracy and a proud reminder that the nation in which Arab citizens have the most meaningful vote is, yes, Israel.

title: A Mission of Mercy
description: I wasnt worried about whether the baby would die. I knew he would. My fear was that I couldnt keep him alive long enough so he could take his last breath in his mothers arms.

title: With 7th Straight Loss, R.B.S. Announces a Major Downsizing
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland on Thursday reported its seventh consecutive annual loss and announced that it would dismantle its global investment bank as the company looks to shrink.

title: Test Yourself | The Other Stars of the Red Carpet
description: Here are several paragraphs from a Feb. 20 article, The Making of Celebrity Stylists.

title: Standard Chartered Overhauls Leadership
description: LONDON  Standard Chartered was everybodys favorite bank when banks were considered bad news.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Teenage Girl Leaves for ISIS, and Others Follow
description: In Teenage Girl Leaves for ISIS, and Others Follow, Kimiko De Freytas-Tamura writes about a Scottish teenager who may be a jihadist recruiter.

title: Can I Stay Out of an Estate Dispute?
description: In order to decrease his net worth before beginning divorce proceedings, my brother invested $600,000 in an apartment in my fathers name. Years later, he had our mother co-sign a business loan. When the business failed, my mother was sued for $3 million she didnt have. After she died of cancer, my father fought the suit for many years. At 93, he settled for a $1.1 million loss. Unable to live his accustomed lifestyle, he approached my brother with the expectation that my brother would supplement his income. When my brother refused, my father sold the apartment and kept the $600,000.

title: Building the First Slavery Museum in America
description: Louisianas River Road runs northwest from New Orleans to Baton Rouge, its two lanes snaking some 100 miles along the Mississippi and through a contradictory stretch of America. Flat and fertile, with oaks webbed in Spanish moss, the landscape stands in defiance of the numerous oil refineries and petrochemical plants that threaten its natural splendor. In the rust-scabbed towns of clapboard homes, you are reminded that Louisiana is the eighth-poorest state in the nation. Yet in the lush sugar plantations that crop up every couple of miles, you can glimpse the excess that defined the region before the Civil War. Some are still active, with expansive fields yielding 13 million tons of sugar cane a year. Others stand in states of elegant rot. But most conspicuous are those that have been restored for tourists, transporting them into a world of bygone Southern grandeur  one in which mint juleps, manicured gardens and hoop skirts are emphasized over the fact that such grandeur was made possible by the enslavement of black human beings.

title: Do You Need to De-Clutter Your Life?

title: Unexpected Lessons From Fifty Shades of Grey
description: A man watches a movie, and the critic must acknowledge that he is that man. So wrote Robert Warshow, almost exactly 60 years ago, setting down what would become an unofficial motto for the profession. The idea that movies and other forms of popular culture could be subjected to serious critical scrutiny was a new and controversial notion in American intellectual circles at the time, and Warshow wanted to make clear that any such criticism would have to take account of its origins in everyday experience. Wherever your thoughts and judgments might take you, you always start out as a consumer, a member of the audience, a fan.

title: Ravenna, Italy, Glittering Still
description: In the heart of Ravenna, I saw some extraordinary fashion: men sporting leopard-spotted tights and velvet cloaks; women wearing dresses of shimmering silk, jewels gleaming at their ears and throats. But these stylish people were not strolling the Piazza del Popolo or sipping prosecco at a cafe; they were rendered in mosaic, created from tiny cubes of colored glass affixed over 1,500 years ago. Sparkling from the walls of eight early Christian monuments, the towns Byzantine mosaics form the largest such collection in Western Europe.

title: In France, a Visit With the In-Laws (Finally) Becomes a Vacation
description: In Montpellier, cypresses grow as high as the bell tower of Eglise Ste.-Thrse. Whelks, caught that morning from the nearby Mediterranean Sea, are sold by the dozen with a side of aioli at the covered market Halles Castellane. The Muse Fabre, a national museum that houses works by the likes of Delacroix and Courbet in a grand 18th-century chateau, manages to feel inviting, not intimidating. Even its visitors, sipping their espresso at the cafe Insens on the front lawn, look more like leisured houseguests than the sort of wearied tourists you see at the Louvre.

title: No Crudits, but Hillary Clinton Still Has a Long List of Demands for Speeches

title: Review: The Hunting Ground Documentary, a Searing Look at Campus Rape
description: The Hunting Ground, a documentary shocker about rape on American college campuses, goes right for the gut. A blunt instrument of a movie, it derives its power largely from the many young women and some men recounting on camera how they were raped at their schools and then subsequently denied justice by those same schools. Their stories  delivered in sorrow and rage, with misting eyes and squared jaws  make this imperfect movie a must-watch work of cine-activism, one that should be seen by anyone headed to college and by those already on campus.

title: Classical Playlist: Haydn, Poul Ruders, Vaughan Williams and More
description: POUL RUDERS: Nightshade TrilogyCapricorn, Oliver Knussen, conductor; Odense Symphony Orchestra, Paul Mann and Scott Yoo, conductors(Bridge 9433; one CD)When the masterly Danish composer Poul Ruders wrote Nightshade, a work for 10 instruments, in 1986, he did not know it would be the first of three related scores written over 18 years, his Nightshade Trilogy, as he later called it. The Second Nightshade, a Symphonic Nocturne for chamber orchestra, came in 1991. Final Nightshade, an Adagio of the Night for full orchestra, ended the series in 2003. All three works explore extreme contrasts of high and low, loud and soft, fast and slow, and such, as the composer explains in liner notes. But nothing can explain the cosmic allure, audacious inventiveness and gripping strangeness of Mr. Ruderss ingenious music. This recording album brings together three recordings of the three works made over 17 years, conducted respectively by Oliver Knussen (with the Capricorn ensemble), Paul Mann and Scott Yoo (with the Odense Symphony Orchestra). (Anthony Tommasini)

title: 1940: Aged Mother of Traitor Flees

title: 1890: Modern Crusoes
description: LONDON  Despatches received here to- day [Feb. 26] from Vancouver Island state that three Englishmen landed there from the American ship Wanderer, which had rescued them from the uninhabited island of San Alesandro, where they had been for four years. They state that in October, 1885, they took passage on the Japanese vessel Matsuo Marie, at Hakodatt, for Anomari, and while crossing the Straits of Issugaru a gale was encountered, which blew them out of their course. For eighty days they were tossed about and finally the vessel was driven ashore on the island of San Alesandro. The three castaways lived chiefly on the fruit which grew on the island. They suffered considerable privations, and had all given way to despair when the Wanderer rescued them.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Feb. 27, 1890

They took one look at me and said, Youre Italian,' he recalls. You eat pizza and spaghetti. What do you know about French food and wine? Besides, you speak bad French.'

Review: David Cronenberg Dissects Hollywood in Maps to the Stars
description: If the Oscars have left you with a residual hatred of Hollywood or a renewed appreciation of Julianne Moore, Maps to the Stars may be just what you need. Suavely directed by David Cronenberg from an elegantly waspish script by Bruce Wagner, it belongs to the venerable tradition of movieland self-loathing. The film, tipping its hat to Nathanael Wests The Day of the Locust and Mr. Wagners own novels, imagines Los Angeles as an inferno of narcissism, greed and sexual perversity. The radiant sunshine has a sinister glow, and the blossoms on the trees are surely poisonous.

The Republican-run State Assembly is expected to pass the bill next week, and Gov. Scott Walker, who stripped Wisconsins public employees of collective bargaining rights in 2011 and is now eyeing the Republican presidential nomination, has said he would sign it.

description: Images from the semifinals of the City University of New York Athletic Conference basketball tournament. Baruch College and Brooklyn College will meet in the final on Friday night.

title: A City Tournament for a City Game
description: Rich Micallef spent 13 years as a foreign exchange trader, specializing in the German mark. He enjoyed his work, he said, in large part because it was so competitive. His tie often acted as a barometer for the days proceedings.

title: Israels Headline From the Future
description: The embassy of Israel in the United States sent out this tweet earlier today: A fake New York Times front page for March 23, 2025, purporting to report on how Iran duped everyone on a nuclear deal. Israels using every weapon in its PR arsenal.

title: Google Puts European Operations Under a Single Executive
description: LONDON  Matt Brittin, a former Olympic rower, has become Googles man in Europe.

title: Carly Fiorina at CPAC: Love for Netanyahu, Daggers for Clinton
description: Best Applause Line: Carly Fiorina, the former chief executive of Hewlett-Packard, earned her warmest response in expressing solidarity with Israel and its prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Prada Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Shooting Film and TV Sex Scenes: What Really Goes On
description: To hear most actors tell it, filming sex scenes is no turn-on. There are big cameras, of course, and big crew members that come with them. Its a performance with a stranger-turned-scene-partner, for a director whos judging every caress and whimper. Its the antithesis of hot, stars assure us on late-night TV; its awkward and tense. Speak to the filmmakers, though, and you get a different take.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Prada Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Pentagon Shops in Silicon Valley for Game Changers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A small group of high-ranking Pentagon officials made a quiet visit to Silicon Valley in December to solicit national security ideas from start-up firms with little or no history of working with the military.

title: Review: Joey Arias Incarnates Billie Holiday in the American Songbook
description: Early in his centennial tribute to Billie Holiday on Wednesday evening at the Appel Room, Joey Arias, the beloved downtown cabaret singer and performance artist, marveled that he had finally been welcomed into the hallowed halls of Lincoln Center.

title: Prada: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Milan

title: Ideas for E.L.L.s | Teaching and Learning About Animals
description: What are animals thinking? Why do they do what they do? What rights should they have? How do they enrich our lives?

title: The Faces of CPAC: Grizzly Joe
description: [Photo: View on Instagram.]

title: New York International Childrens Film Festival Showcases Dozens of Works
description: Oh, the thrill of turning 18: more respect, more earning power, new rights and privileges.

title: Spring Promises Nature Tours and Outdoor Activities
description: This weekend, as we turn the page on our calendars (or, less ceremoniously, notice that our smartphones now say March), we take a step closer to spring. The thermometer might not show any sign of change, but there are places in New York where you can get an idea of the warmth and color coming soon.

title: In Analia Sabans Unassuming Artwork, More than Meets the Eye
description: The Argentine artist, whose work has drawn support from John Baldessari and Paul McCarthy, has two concurrent upcoming exhibitions in London and New York.

title: China Bans Import of Ivory Carvings for One Year
description: BEIJING  In a move aimed at countering international criticism of skyrocketing Chinese demand for ivory that is decimating African elephant populations, China announced on Thursday a one-year moratorium on the import of ivory carvings.

title: Pat McGraths New Elegance Beauty for Prada
description: This year Prada gave the legendary makeup artist Pat McGrath two words to work with: New Elegance. We used a little bit of a kind of a soft chestnut color on the eyes in the sockets, and then the brow was softly groomed, said McGrath backstage before todays show. For the lips, she chose similarly muted hues: a pale pink and a pale orange. (She also noted that she used a little bit of blush over the lightly applied foundation to complete the look.) It was a stark contrast to the brands bold spring/summer 2015 look, which involved bleached eyebrows with striking cat-eye makeup. It was very funny because last season was a nod to punk  and for Miu Miu we had bad girls, she said, referring to her work with another Prada S.p.A.-owned label. But this year it seems like theyre good girls. And its true  the fall beauty look has a refinement that matches the ladylike air of the collection.

title: No Ambivalence Toward Ted Cruz at CPAC
description: Best Applause Line: We kill the terrorist leaders before they kill us, said the Republican senator from Texas.

title: In Greece, Bailout May Hinge on Pursuing Tycoons
description: ATHENS  As he sifted recently through a sheaf of Greek bank accounts held by executives, politicians and other members of the Greek elite, Panagiotis Nikoloudis, the nations new anti-corruption czar, was struck by some troubling numbers.

title: Game Stinks, So Ionas Coach Vents
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y.  It was after one of Ionas easiest practices of the season, in which the team spent about 45 minutes working on  gasp!  its halfcourt offense, when Coach Tim Cluess ambled over to a folding chair in the empty gym, crossed his legs and began to enumerate the reasons he disdained the current state of college basketball.

title: A Judd Celebration of Trisha Brown Dance
description: In the 1970s, the desolate streets of SoHo were home to many brands of weirdness. (The character Paul Hackett, stranded there in Martin Scorseses After Hours, complains: I just wanted to leave, you know, my apartment, maybe meet a nice girl. And now Ive got to die for it?) But even world-wise SoHo residents were stopped in their tracks by the early outdoor performances of the Trisha Brown Dance Company. In Man Walking Down the Side of a Building in 1970, a dancer used ropes and a harness to walk perpendicularly from the top to the bottom of a Wooster Street building. In Roof Piece (1971), performers positioned on rooftops over 10 blocks functioned like ancient signal fires, passing choreographic messages from street to street.

title: 2015 Triennial: Surround Audience
description: Works in the exhibition at the New Museum.

title: As Hedge Fund Returns Falter, Money Continues to Flow In
description: Another year, and another mediocre performance by hedge funds, to put it kindly. The Barclay Hedge Fund Index gained a meager 2.89 percent in 2014, while the Standard & Poors 500-stock index gained over 13 percent and the Barclays United States Aggregate Bond Index rose over 5 percent.

title: Holding Court on the Stage
description: A guide to dramatic monarchs, once and future.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | 71
description: Yann Demange narrates a sequence from the film 71.

title: Finally, Net Neutrality
description: After years of effort, the Federal Communications Commission on Thursday approved strong net neutrality rules that aim to prohibit unfair practices by cable and phone companies.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Spain, South Korea and India.

title: Personalized Bottles, Ceramic Royals and Chinese Artifacts
description: The British glass historian David Burton has created a 1,740-page set of books to analyze a seemingly narrow topic: antique bottles that bear raised markings identifying the original owners. Mr. Burton, 77, has spent decades hunting for intact and broken vessels in private and institutional collections and deciphering their codes of numbers, letters and family coats of arms for his new three-volume set, Antique Sealed Bottles 1640-1900 and the Families Who Owned Them (Antique Collectors Club).

title: Will.i.am Start-Up Hires Sony Electronics Executive
description: The pop musician Will.i.am has started moonlighting as a technology entrepreneur. Now he has an experienced technology executive to help him run his new wearable start-up, i.am+.

title: Deal Keeps Kardashians Reality Show on E!
description: E! is paying up to keep up with the Kardashians.

title: E.C.B. Stimulus Plan Sends Some Investments Reeling
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Banks plan to begin a big monetary stimulus program next month is already causing money to contort in new and sometimes strange ways.

title: Jihadi John From ISIS Execution Videos Was Under Watch by British Intelligence
description: LONDON  Mohammed Emwazi was 6 when his parents moved to West London from his birthplace in Kuwait, and he seems to have lived a normal life, studying hard and graduating in computer sciences from the University of Westminster in 2009.

title: Feb. 26, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Ukraine, Spain, South Korea, and India.

title: Yann Demange Narrates a Sequence from  71
description: In this video, the director Yann Demange narrates a scene from his debut feature, 71, featuring Jack OConnell. The film is set in Belfast during the Troubles, and this scene involves a British soldier (Mr. OConnell) being chased through an apartment complex. Here, Mr. Demange discusses slowing down the pace of the sequence and, in relation to lighting, treating the scene almost like a horror movie.

title: Fendis Easy, Breezy Beauty Look for Fall
description: T shares the best hairstyles from the runways.

title: The Faces of CPAC: College Republicans
description: [Photo: View on Instagram.]

title: Moschino: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Milan

title: Police Say Thomas Schweich, Candidate for Missouri Governor, Killed Himself
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Thomas Schweich, the Missouri state auditor and a Republican candidate for governor, died on Thursday after apparently shooting himself at his home in suburban St. Louis, the police said.

title: Louise Nevelson: Collage and Assemblage
description: The sculptor Louise Nevelson took up a fair amount of space in New York in the 1960s and early 70s. She was one of the most prominent artists of her generation, known for her imperious personality and a penchant for false eyelashes, heavy jewelry and chinchilla capes. More important were her forward-looking wood reliefs, painted entirely black or white, which linked the found-object aesthetic of assemblage to the clean lines and orderly sequences of Minimalism (and also presaged the all-black assemblage sculptures of Rashid Johnson). But by the time she died at age 88 in 1988, the art world had moved on.

title: Reading The Times With Paul Butler
description: Paul Butler is a professor at Georgetown University Law Center. A former federal prosecutor, he is the author of Lets Get Free: A Hip-Hop Theory of Justice.

title: Merlin James: Genre Paintings
description: One of the quietly great painters of our moment, Merlin James works in ways both predictable and surprising. He has established his own lexicon of terms, which includes modestly sized canvases, atmospheric landscapes populated with partial figures and coy maneuvers into the pictures shape and surface.

title: Jim Lee and the Cream Tones
description: There have been many attempts over the years to merge painting and sculpture. Robert Rauschenbergs combines  a neologism inspired by Alexander Calders mobiles  combined the two practices, while Donald Judds 1965 essay Specific Objects identified a similar hybrid strain in 1960s art. Jim Lee takes on the project with a certain humor and humility, acknowledging his predecessors but offering a subtle contemporary spin on the artistic impulse to remake or deconstruct mediums.

title: Pulp Drunk: Mexican Pulp Art
description: Pulp Drunk: Mexican Pulp Art, an exhibition of original paintings made for the covers of paperback novels of the 1960s and 70s, is a hoot. Its also psychologically and sociologically resonant. Most were done in tempera paints on cardboard by unidentified Mexican artists, who vividly pictured primal fantasies and anxieties dressed up in midcentury garb.

title: In Analia Sabans Unassuming Artwork, More Than Meets the Eye
description: Her works may be beige, but Analia Sabans practice is anything but boring. The Argentinean-born artist, who at 34 has studios in both Santa Monica, Calif., and Hells Kitchen, New York City, is destined for art historical legacy  if her mentors have anything to do with it. John Baldessari is my main adviser, she shares, in a chat on the eve of her first London exhibition, Interiors, with her long-time gallery Sprth Magers, which opens Feb. 27. She also concurrently has a solo showing  her second  at Tanya Bonakdar in Chelsea, New York. Both shows feature her signature playful approach to art-making, which slips between genres and subverts traditional usage of materials. When people start calling me a painter, this is the moment I need to shift. I like to think about where I am showing, I make the work for the space, she says. Its really about experiencing the world and analyzing my own interpretation of what I am experiencing.

title: On Daring Do-Overs
description: I went out with a girl for two years after college. I broke up with her when I thought I had met the love of my life. (I was wrong.) My original girlfriend took the breakup very badly. She refused contact with me and wouldnt return my calls or texts. But now, several years later, I would like to ask her out again. I think she may be the one. Is there a polite and respectful way to do this?

title: Comment in Congress on Homeland Security
description: Harry Reid and Nancy Pelosi, the Senate and House Democratic leaders, and the House speaker, John A. Boehner, a Republican, spoke about the Senate bill to fund the Department of Homeland Security.

title: House and Senate Prepare Measures to Keep Homeland Security Funded
description: WASHINGTON  Just a day before the Department of Homeland Security is set to run out of money, the Senate was preparing a bill that would finance the department without restrictions on President Obamas immigration actions. House Republicans were coming together on a counterproposal that would provide the agency with funds for only three weeks.

title: The Sleeping Beauty
description: Alexei Ratmansky mounts an opulent production of a fairy-tale classic for American Ballet Theaters 75th-anniversary season.

title: Morals Clause in Catholic Schools Roils Bay Area
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It is the issue that is stirring San Francisco: The archbishop has specified that teachers at four Bay Area Catholic high schools cannot publicly challenge the churchs teachings that homosexual acts are contrary to natural law, that contraception is intrinsically evil and that embryonic stem cell research is a crime. He also wants to designate teachers as part of the ministry, which could, under a 2012 Supreme Court ruling, strip them of protection under federal anti-discrimination laws.

title: Review: In Battle Creek, the F.B.I. Sets Up Shop With the Police
description: The title is confusing, yet it kind of explains everything. Battle Creek is a CBS cop show set in that small, rusting city in Michigan, (population 51,848), a place that is mostly associated with Kelloggs cereal.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Moschino Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Moschino Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Grand Entries
description: The grand lobbies of former office towers are sparkling anew as they embark upon new careers as high-end apartment houses.

title: Deciding On a Parents Death
description: The phone call came when these types of calls tend to come  late on a Friday afternoon at the tail end of a brutal Cleveland winter. I picked up the handset as I glanced outside my office windows at the accelerating snowfall, wondering whether I should leave work early.

title: Review: New Museum Triennial Casts a Wary Eye on the Future
description: If youre fed up with big joke-shop sculpture, diva spectacles and brain-dead abstraction, the New Museums 2015 Triennial, titled Surround Audience, will come as a break in the clouds. Not a full flood of new light, but a pull in a different direction, a microgravity shift in a gross-objects industry. Its a glimpse, and just that, of terrain composed almost entirely of border crossings: between genders, media, disciplines, ethnicities and species. Welcome to Planet Trans.

title: Review: Everything Is Design Showcases Paul Rand, Master of Brand Identity
description: You may not know the name Paul Rand (1914-1996), the immensely influential 20th-century advertising art director, illustrator and graphic designer, but its a safe bet youre familiar with some of his works. After shaking up American advertising and book cover design in the 1940s and 50s, he created the logos for UPS, IBM, Westinghouse and other American corporations, symbols that remain ubiquitously familiar today. His admirers called him the Picasso of graphic design; the Museum of Modern Art named him one of the 10 best art directors of all time.

title: On Pradas Sugary Fall 2015 Runway, a Perfectly Sweet Mary Jane
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Weekend Entertainments from the Archives of The New York Times
description: 80 YEARS AGO

title: Review: Julia Holter and the Spektral Quartet in the Ecstatic Music Festival
description: First it was brusque, then eerie and sly. Julia Holter and the Spektral Quartet shared the Ecstatic Music Festival concert on Wednesday night at Merkin Concert Hall in a program that lingered in the cloudy zone where contemporary composition meets the pop song. In its sources and allusions, the concert took for granted the broad-spectrum musical erudition of current composers: hip-hop, medieval motets, Broadway, Impressionism, dubstep.

title: Chris Christies Full CPAC Appearance
description: Gov. Chris Christie, a potential Republican presidential candidate, was interviewed by Laura Ingraham at the Conservative Political Action Conference.

title: Review: Bright Half Life, a Two-Woman Play by Tanya Barfield
description: Erica and Vicky like to play a game of questions that they call A B C: Whats your favorite color? Vicky asks. If you had a superhero power what would it be? Do you think forwards or do you think backwards or do you think just now?

title: Bringing a Daughter Back From the Brink With Poems
description: When George W. Bush was re-elected in 2004, my 13-year-old daughter, Marisa, was so angry that she stopped wearing shoes.

title: Call From the I.R.S.? Hang Up. Its a Fraud.
description: A spate of fraudulent state income tax returns filed using TurboTaxs online software has unnerved consumers this filing season. But con artists also continue to use more traditional means to try to separate taxpayers from their money, like harassing them on the telephone.

title: Quantitative Easing and Monetary Aggregates
description: I havent had time for the broader discussion of cognitive closure, but one more thing about Meltzer and all that: I get especially annoyed when economists who have been wrongly predicting inflation say that its not their fault  who could have known that banks would just sit on all those reserves? The answer is, anyone who had paid attention should have known that would happen.

title: Review: The Robert Glasper Trio Presents Moody Covers at the Village Vanguard
description: The pianist Robert Glasper pitches his tent at the junction of coolheaded logic and digressive caprice. Not long into his sold-out first set at the Village Vanguard on Wednesday night, he tossed off a staccato solo interlude, notes clacking like marbles out of a bag onto the floor. A melodic shape emerged, and bass and drums hit a single, sudden downbeat  thump!  as Mr. Glasper kept extemporizing with chromatic flair.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Enlisting Viruses as Commandos in a War on Cancer
description: Through two seasons, Vice, the newsmagazine assembled by Vice Media and carried by HBO, has been a travelogue for the gonzo armchair tourist. It circles the globe to report on every variety of crisis  wars, drugs, the environment, rape in India, desperate bachelors in China.

title: Scott Walker Speaks at CPAC
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin spoke at the Conservative Political Action Conference on Thursday.

title: Scott Walker Suggests Protesters Have Prepared Him for Terrorists
description: Best Applause Line: We need a leader who will stand with Israel, said the governor of Wisconsin.

title: 'Jihadi John,' in His Own Words
description: Mohammed Emwazi, 26, who was identified as the ISIS militant known as Jihadi John, encountered British security forces on his path to radicalization.

title: Review: The Artists Studio, From Refuge to Gallery, in Shows at the Gagosian
description: In these days of post-studio, post-Internet artistry, of nomadic careers and collaborative cohorts, the artists studio can sometimes seem like a thing of the past, a relic from that bygone era before the supposed death of the author and the age of mechanical reproduction. But even if young artists work increasingly out of backpacks, on laptops or in tandem, alone time in a fairly private work space remains an essential condition for creativity.

title: Pining for Handels Alcina Sorceress, Coming to Lincoln Center on Film
description: Bellinis I Capuleti e i Montecchi. Mozarts La Finta Giardiniera. Berliozs Batrice et Bndict. Rossinis Otello. Verdis I Due Foscari and Giovanna dArco, not to mention his Don Carlos and Les Vpres Siciliennes in their original French versions. Ligetis Le Grand Macabre. Philip Glasss Akhnaten. Zimmermanns Die Soldaten. Meredith Monks Atlas.

title: Beethoven From Andsnes and the Mahler Chamber Orchestra
description: By calling his four-year immersion into Beethoven, particularly that composers five piano concertos, the Beethoven Journey, the superb Norwegian pianist Leif Ove Andsnes tried to bring extra attention to the project. He also raised expectations.

title: Review: In Sex Box, Couples Reveal Their Issues in the Bedroom
description: The premise of Sex Box is twofold. Troubled couples receive valuable advice from a panel of leading sex and relationship experts. They also have sex in a box, onstage, before a live audience. This is why groups like the Parents Television Council are giving the show free publicity by demanding its cancellation.

title: Sniper Case Is Headed to Appeal, Lawyers Say
description: HOUSTON  Lawyers for Eddie Ray Routh, the former Marine sentenced to life in prison on Tuesday for murdering Chris Kyle, the Navy SEAL marksman whose autobiography inspired the movie American Sniper, plan to ask a state appeals court to overturn the jurys guilty verdict.

description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

description: This years winners included coverage of overseas crises, innovative uses of multimedia storytelling, and outstanding editing.
